    RANK 3

    Ammo Crate

    MINOR ACTION

    SUPPORT ITEM

    MAIN

    LIMITED 2, SUMMON

    Ammo Crate ( SIZE 1/2 , HP 10 , DODGE/A-DEF 10 , SPEED 0 )

    You place an ammo crate in an adjacent space. It can't perform any actions (including reactions ), even if another ability would allow it to do so. It has 5 charges . While adjacent to it, you or an ally can expend a charge as a minor action for either of the following effects:

    • Reload one weapon.
    • Regain 2 MP .

    When the ammo crate runs out of charges, it is destroyed. If it is defeated, it explodes in a BURST 2 area. All characters in the area must make an AGILITY save.

    Failure: They take

    8 FORCE

    .

    Success: They take 4 FORCE

    .

    Ammo crates allow groups to quickly resupply, but are extremely explosive.

    Widowmaker

    VOLLEY

    RANGED WEAPON

    HEAVY MAGITECH

    ACCURATE,

    RELOADING

    RANGE 15 3D6 PHYSICAL

    On Crit: This attack is Piercing .

    One shot, one kill.

    Hexblades sow curses and confusion among their foes, weakening them while growing stronger from their misery.

    H exblades know pain and misery better than most. These warriors can take the suffering in their heart and use it to power an array of curses and hexes. To a hexblade, the soul is just another power source.

    BASE ATTRIBUTES

    Hexes are blights upon creatures with aetheric fields. The simplest of them induce minor aetheric imbalances, causing clumsiness and inability to focus. The strongest ones act like magical parasites, using their hosts own aether to produce ongoing, detrimental effects like loss of vision and internal decay.

    • What's the worst luck you had?
    • How does the shape and appearance of your soul alter your weapons and techniques?
    • What's your favorite curse to put on people?
    • How do you get under people's skin?
    SCOPE: 10 SAVE TARGET: 11
    BULK MIND
    HP: 8 STRESS CAP: 5
    RECOVERIES: 4 MEMORY: 6
    AGILITY MAGIC
    DODGE: 7 A-DEF: 8
    SPEED: 5 MP: 4

    TRAITS

    Hex

    TRAIT

    You gain the HEX spell attack , which is equipped for free.

    Hex MINORACTION
    RANGED SPELL ATTACK AUTO-HIT, INNATE,MANA1,
    UNIQUE RANGE = SCOPE

    The target becomes hexed , which lasts until the end of the scene or until you use this ability again. This has the following effects:

    • When you defeat a hexed target, you regain 1 MP .
    • 1/round, you can deal +1d6 bonus damage on a successful weapon attack against a hexed target.
    • 1/round when you inflict a condition on a hexed target, you can also inflict the same condition on another enemy within RANGE 5 of the hexed target. The second character has this condition until the end of their next turn.

    Misery

    TRAIT

    You gain +1 on attacks against characters with one or more conditions .

    runninG tHe Game

    LIMIT BREAK

    Doom Hex LIMIT BREAK

    FREE ACTION

    A character affected by your hex becomes DAZED , MARKED , BLINDED , SUNDERED , SILENCED , SLOWED , and WEAKENED . At the end of each of their turns in which they have at least one of these conditions, they make a MAGIC save. Success: They choose and remove one of these conditions.

    Evil eye. Mind-fog. Dancing legs. Sloughing skin. Atrophied muscles. Eldritch horror.

    Warlocks and witches have hundreds of hexes and curses at their disposal. The most powerful hexblades can create doom hexes - powerful curses that combine multiple curses into one.

    Hexblades mix weapon and spell attacks together. They excel when they focus on taking down one target at a time or on spreading conditions to multiple targets. Because HEX counts as a spell attack, they make good use of the Spellblade talent.

    RANK 1

    Bound Weapon SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT ENCHANTMENT

    You may use one of the following Enchantments at a time:

    • Any Weapon: This weapon becomes Unbreakable , and when thrown, returns to you after the attack resolves. It can be used even if you are DISARMED .
    • Any Technique: This technique becomes Unbreakable . If it's a spell, it can be used even if you are SILENCED .

    When you make a pact for power, the patron will want to monitor your progress. A weapon is manifested as an extension of the patron and given to you. Refusal is not an option.

    Edge of Darkness MELEE WEAPON MAIN BLADE REACH 1 1D6 LUNAR

    FIGHT

    1/turn when you defeat, Wound, or Overstress an enemy with this weapon, you gain 3 TEMP HP and this weapon's damage increases by +1 . This effect stacks with itself to a maximum of +6 . This extra damage lasts until you take a Long Rest .

    This weapon feeds on souls, growing stronger and sharper with each soul consumed. It will only achieve its true form when sated.

    RANK 2

    Curse Bolt VOLLEY Curse Bolt VOLLEY
    RANGED MANA1 SPELL ATTACK 1MEMORY AETHERIC, RANGE = SCOPE / REACH 1 1D6 FORCE

    This spell deals +1 damage for every condition the target had at the time of the attack.

    On Hit: The target is MARKED . Additionally, choose one of the following:

    • Haze Curse: Until the MARK is cleared, your target treats you as INVISIBLE.
    • Soul Curse: Until the MARK is cleared, your target receives +1 on checks and saves.

    Curses are natural phenomena that affect a creature's aetheric field. Warlocks have learned how to manipulate these forces to induce specific types of curses. Hexblades take that knowledge and force these curses into physical forms that can be cast at any creature.

    Curse of Weakness SPELL 2 MEMORY

    When you make a character MARKED , you can spend 2 MP to also make them WEAKENED until the end of their next turn.

    'When your knees buckle, I'll have a good chuckle; it doesn't take a seer to know your doom is near.'

    RANK 3

    Hexing Aura

    FREE ACTION

    SPELL 2 MEMORY ARCING, AURA 5

    You can use one of the following Auras at a time:

    • Intensify Hex: Enemies within your Aura gain +2 when DAZED , instead of +1 .
    • Lingering Hex: Enemies within your Aura take 1 STRESS for each condition they clear.

    Misfortune follows hexblades. The smart ones learn how to make that someone else's problem.

    Soul Strike SKILL 3 MEMORY MANA 1

    When you attack with a weapon, you can turn it into a soul strike . The attack gains the Aetheric tag, deals half damage, and deals all damage as STRESS instead of its normal types.

    It additionally gains On Hit: the target is DAZED until the end of their next turn. If the STRESS from this attack causes them to exceed their STRESS CAP , they are also SUNDERED until it is both the end of their next turn and they are no longer exceeding their STRESS CAP .

    It is possible to convert a weapon's entire form into aether. The aetheric weapon bypasses physical armor, but interacts directly with aetheric fields.

    Knightmares manifest dreams into reality, creating unbreakable aetheric chains to bind their foes. If a Knightmare catches you, there's no escape.

    T he Dreamscape is a realm few know about, and accessible to even fewer. The Awoken are those who can travel this realm of infinite creativity and shape it to their whims; however, not everything there is pleasant, and dangers lurk in the shadows.

    BASE ATTRIBUTES

    Knightmares have been influenced by their brushes with the horrors of the Dreamscape - true nightmares. Using these strong negative emotions, they can take objects from the Dreamscape into the waking world, which display properties that make a mockery of reality.

    • When did you first become Awoken?
    • How do you choose to look in the Dreamscape?
    • Who do you hope to capture in your chains?
    • What nightmare still plagues you to this day?
    SCOPE: 5 SAVE TARGET: 11
    BULK MIND
    HP: 9 STRESS CAP: 6
    RECOVERIES: 4 MEMORY: 5
    AGILITY MAGIC
    DODGE: 6 A-DEF: 7
    SPEED: 6 MP: 3

    TRAITS

    The Chains of Despair

    TRAIT

    You gain the CHAINS OF DESPAIR skill, which is equipped for free.

    Chains of Despair

    REACTION

    SKILL FOCUS 1, INNATE, UNIQUE

    Trigger: An enemy within RANGE 3 makes an attack.

    Effect: You pull the enemy to the closest free space adjacent to you, and their attack must include you as a target. You may also spend an additional +1 FOCUS to GRAPPLE the enemy after pulling them.

    The Inescapable Nightmare

    TRAIT

    When you would be able to make a melee attack as a reaction , you can instead attempt a GRAPPLE .

    Additionally, 1/round if a GRAPPLED enemy would cease to be adjacent to you, you can spend 1 MP to continue the grapple and negate any movement that would break adjacency.

    You can't use this trait if you are STUNNED .

    The Weight of Inevitability

    TRAIT

    You are always considered at least SIZE 3 for the purposes of GRAPPLE and SHOVE and you can perform reactions while GRAPPLED.

    LIMIT BREAK

    Trapped in a Dream LIMIT BREAK

    All enemies of your choice within RANGE 5 are pulled to the closest free spaces adjacent to you and GRAPPLED . Escaping from the grapple requires a standard action during any phase instead of a minor action. Any time an enemy GRAPPLED by this ability attacks, they must include you as one of their targets.

    Your chains move according to your will, wrapping around your foes and dragging them screaming toward you. As they move closer, they find themselves transported into a domain of the dreamscape chosen especially for them. They can see the waking world, but the dreamscape fights them every step of the way.

    Knightmares are a grapple-focused class. The Brawler talent can help them GRAPPLE more often, and grappling tends to shut down enemy defenders, who usually rely on reactions to use their defensive features. THE WEIGHT OF INEVITABILITY means that Knightmares don't need to pick specific ancestries to remain in control while grappling.

    RANK 1

    Body Shields SKILL 1 MEMORY UNIQUE

    Any Physical, Astral, Lunar, and Force you would take is reduced by -1 (before ARMOR and resistances ) for every character GRAPPLED by you. When characters GRAPPLED by you deal damage to you, they don't count toward this damage reduction.

    You don't benefit from this ability while SUNDERED .

    Most people are about the size of a tower shield. They also do a pretty good job at blocking things - like a shield - even if they're not happy about it.

    Night Terrors

    MELEE SPELL ATTACK

    1 MEMORY

    FIGHT

    AETHERIC,

    MANA 1

    REACH 2

    2 STRESS

    On Hit: Choose one of the following:

    • The One Where You're Being Chased: The target receives +1 on all attacks that don't include you as the target. This stacks to a maximum of +3 . If they deal damage or Stress to you, they clear this effect.
    • The One Where Your Teeth Fall Out: If the target is BREAKING , they take 4 STRESS instead of the usual Stress.

    You find the remnants of night terrors still lingering in the corners of a person's mind and make them relive those dreams.

    RANK 2

    Dream Eater SKILL 1 MEMORY UNIQUE

    1/turn , when an adjacent character gains Stress , you gain 1 FOCUS .

    As your foes become tired and stressed, you start to see the outlines of the nightmares that plague them. Turn these nightmares into your strength.

    Recurring Dream SUPPORT ITEM MAIN ENCHANTMENT

    You may use one of the following Enchantments at a time:

    • Any Weapon: When you hit with this weapon, as long as you are attacking the same target, you can VOLLEY , FIGHT , or FULL ATTACK ( Slow weapons only) one phase earlier than before in subsequent rounds. This effect stacks, but cannot shift the attack any earlier than PHASE BOLSTER . It lasts until the end of the scene or until you attack a different target with this weapon.
    • Any Technique that Forces a Save: 1/turn when a target succeeds on a save triggered by this technique, your SAVE TARGET increases by +1 for this technique only until the end of the scene or until a target fails the save, at which point it resets back to normal. This effect can stack.

    'Haven't we been here before? It feels so familiar'

    RANK 3

    Delirium SKILL 2 MEMORY UNIQUE

    Whenever you take damage, you can take 1 STRESS to lower the total needed for you to critically hit on attacks by 1 (i.e., from 20+ to 19+, 19+ to 18+, etc). This effect stacks and lasts until the end of the scene or until you critically hit.

    Give into your own nightmares, and let them take over for a bit.

    Wraith Chain FULL ATTACK MELEE WEAPON HEAVY LONGARM AETHERIC, PULL 2, SLOW, THROWN 5

    REACH 2 / THROWN 5 3D6+1 FORCE

    On Hit: If you are adjacent to the target or this attack pulls them adjacent to you, you may auto-hit on a GRAPPLE against them.

    You can attack with this weapon as a minor action during any phase, but you can only attack with it 1/ turn. If you attack with it as a minor action, it deals no damage.

    This weapon is wrapped in dream-chains, brought from the dreamscape into the waking world. Their strength is unparalleled, unbound by the constraints of reality. With a flick of your wrist, the chain shoots out and binds your victim, pulling them close.

    7: claSSeS and JoBS

    Lifeweavers are battlefield medics who weave flesh together. They can keep their friends active and fighting even through deadly injuries.

    L ifeweavers have unique insights into the dynamics of aetheric fields and can use magic to heal wounds instantly. This knowledge also makes them dangerous fighters, as they know exactly how to hurt or incapacitate foes and turn their own aetheric fields against them.

    BASE ATTRIBUTES

    These healers have honed their training for the battlefield. Their healing magic may not be as effective as proper medical attention, but it serves its purpose of quickly repairing minor injuries and letting people continue fighting.

    • What mark is left behind on those you've healed?
    • What type of effects or injuries do you find difficult to fix?
    • What do aetheric fields look like to you, and how is yours different?
    • What is the worst injury from which you've saved someone?

    Effect: You heal them for 1D6 HP .

    The ability to bring someone back from the dead, no matter how long has passed, exists only in legend. However, there is a very short window of time where life can be restored to the recently departed.

    A lifeweaver can repair and stimulate a person's aetheric field before it completely breaks down, breathing life back into their body and repairing some of the recent damage they've taken.

    Lifeweavers have many ways of keeping their allies healthy during fights, from granting TEMP HP to pure healing. Lifeweavers play a versatile supporting role, especially when combined with other classes like the Tidecaller .

    RANK 1

    Soul Shield SPELL 2 MEMORY

    PHASE SKIRMISH RANGE = SCOPE

    A character within RANGE gains 1D3+1 TEMP HP . You can spend 1 MP to increase this to 1D6+1 TEMP HP .

    While the target has TEMP HP , they don't need to make concentration saves as long as they had the TEMP HP when the save was prompted.

    Strengthen and enhance an ally's aetheric field by drawing power from their own lifeforce.

    Stolen Life VOLLEY

    • Drain Life: Y ou or a character within RANGE 5 of you regains 1D3 HP . Y ou can spend 1 MP to increase this to 1D6 HP instead.
    • Drain Vitality: Y ou or a character within RANGE 5 of you clear up to 2 STRESS .

    Siphon life energy from a victim and transfer it to someone else.

    Inner Balance

    SPELL

    CHANNEL

    1 MEMORY

    MANA 2

    RANGE = SCOPE

    On Release: Choose one of the following:

    • Balance: Choose either yourself and one ally within RANGE or two allies within RANGE . The targets swap their current HP , Stress, or MP , your choice.
    • Imbalance: Choose an enemy within RANGE and roll 2d6, adding +1d6 if they are either BLOODIED or BREAKING or +2d6 if they are both. They take Stress equal to the result of one die, and Piercing Force equal to another, your choice.

    Lifeweavers seek to keep a harmonious balance between the mind, body, and soul. By drawing from another's aetheric field, a lifeweaver can use both fields to balance each other out or induce an internal imbalance.

    Sewing Needle VOLLEY RANGED WEAPON MAIN ARTIFACT PIERCING RANGE 5 / REACH 3 1D3+2 FORCE

    On Hit: If the target is BLOODIED , you can spend 1 MP to make them Immobilized until the end of their next turn. If you do so, any BLOODIED enemies of your choice adjacent to the target are SLOWED until the end of their next turn.

    A tool used to stitch flesh together, turned into a weapon. The needle itself is rarely seen. Instead, you catch glimpses of the shimmering magical thread.

    MANA 1

    RANGE = SCOPE

    One character within RANGE can spend a RECOVERY to regain all HP . If you spend 3 MP instead, they don't need to spend a RECOVERY .

    Months of healing take place in moments. The process repairs all wounds on the patient's body, but leaves them feeling exhausted.

    Serenity

    SPELL

    2 MEMORY

    RANGE = SCOPE

    On Release: Choose one of the following:

    • Lifewell: You create a BLAST 1 zone of healing energy within RANGE . Characters that start their turn within it regain 3 HP . This zone lasts until the end of the scene or until you create a new one.
    • Mend: An ally within RANGE clears a Wound or Overstress. Each character can benefit from this 1/quest .

    The Sungarde, divinely-inspired swashbucklers, have enchanted their ships to make them permanent zones of serenity. People rescued by the Sungarde recover incredibly quickly, which has earned the swashbucklers a stellar reputation. The innocent cheer at the sight of Sungarde flags, and pirates flee from them.

    CHANNEL

    ARCING, MANA 3

    Paladins draw upon their resolve to protect their allies and smite their foes. They can manifest beneficial auras that enhance nearby allies.

    P aladins are motivated individuals driven by their beliefs. What separates a paladin from an advocate is their ability to turn their resolve into power, bolstering their aetheric field and gaining strength through their convictions.

    BASE ATTRIBUTES

    Most paladins are very protective of their friends and will willingly put themselves in harm's way to save one from danger. Their desire to protect becomes so strong that when they sense a threat, they can travel great distances in the blink of an eye to stand ready against it.

    • Who or what would you give your life to protect?
    • What is a belief you hold onto strongly?
    • What sensation or emotion do people feel when they're near you?
    • When did you stand up for something, and what did it cost you?
    SCOPE: 5 SAVE TARGET: 10
    BULK MIND
    HP: 9 STRESS CAP: 7
    RECOVERIES: 6 MEMORY: 5
    AGILITY MAGIC
    DODGE: 6 A-DEF: 7
    SPEED: 5 MP: 2

    TRAITS

    Layered Auras

    TRAIT

    You gain the AURA OF INSPIRATION spell, which is equipped for free. Additionally, you may have two Auras active at once, but they must be from different abilities.

    Aura of Inspiration

    FREE ACTION

    SPELL ARCING, AURA 5, INNATE, UNIQUE

    You and all allies within this Aura gain +1 on checks and saves.

    Guardian Angel TRAIT

    MINOR ACTION

    Choose an ally within line of sight to protect. You may INTERPOSE for them as long as they are within SCOPE , teleporting to a free adjacent space. This lasts for the rest of the scene or until you use this ability again.

    Retribution

    TRAIT

    You can COUNTERATTACK 2/round instead of 1/round .

    Additionally, 1/round when performing INTERPOSE , you can COUNTERATTACK the attacker before the triggering attack happens. This COUNTERATTACK doesn't cost FOCUS .

    LIMIT BREAK

    Bastion of Resolve LIMIT BREAK

    SPECIAL

    At any time during a combat scene, you may harden your resolve and surpass your normal limits. When activated, you clear all conditions and gain the following benefits, which last until the end of this phase next round:

    • You gain resistance to all damage .
    • Your weapons with REACH gain +2 REACH .
    • Your allies count as being under the protection of your GUARDIAN ANGEL ability.

    Paladins draw upon their beliefs and convictions to strengthen their aetheric fields. The more deeply they believe in something, the stronger the effects. Once they've perfected this skill, the only limit on their power is the strength of their resolve. As long as they stand unwavering, they can't be stopped.

    As defenders, Paladins benefit from high ARMOR and other damage-mitigation effects. With their Auras and RETRIBUTION trait, they work best when close to their allies. The Knight talent is a good choice for Paladins.

    RANK 1

    Auras of Resistance FREE ACTION SPELL 2 MEMORY ARCING, AURA 5

    You can use one of the following Auras at a time:

    • Aura of Energy Resistance: Choose either Astral or Lunar. You and all allies within this Aura gain resistance to the chosen damage type .
    • Aura of Freedom: Y ou and all allies within this Aura gain immunity to SLOWED and can automatically break out of grapples as a free action .

    Expand your aetheric field to cover those of your allies. As they overlap, you can imbue their fields with your own protections.

    Lay on Hands

    SKILL 1 MEMORY MANA 1

    You or an adjacent ally can spend a RECOVERY to regain HP equal to their BLOODIED value.

    A reassuring word and a calming hand placed on a shoulder make everything seem easier.

    RANK 2

    Holy Avenger

    MELEE WEAPON HEAVY BLADE REACH 1 2D6+1 ASTRAL

    This weapon is Accurate on turns other than your own.

    On Crit: You or an ally within RANGE 5 can clear either a condition or all Discord .

    The blade of a holy avenger is pure astral energy. Without training, the manifested blade is dangerous and unstable. An aetheric field must be wrapped around it as a form of containment, giving it a solid shape with an appearance unique to the user.

    • Aura of Steel: Allies within this Aura (excluding you) gain +1 ARMOR (up to a maximum of 4 ARMOR ).
    • Aura of Retaliation: 1/turn when an ally within this Aura (excluding you) is hit by an enemy, the enemy takes 3 ASTRAL .

    Layers of magical protection can be used as armor or turned into a retributive shield.

    Stalwart Shield SUPPORT ITEM MAIN UNBREAKABLE

    Gain +1 ARMOR .

    Allies gain the benefits of cover from you as if you were a piece of hard cover .

    Additionally, you gain the GUARDIAN SHIELD BLOCK reaction. If you meet the trigger condition of GUARDIAN SHIELD BLOCK while using INTERPOSE , you can automatically use its effect as part of that INTERPOSE reaction.

    'The resolve to protect others can even come from a place of humility.'

    • Sheeta Shal

    Guardian Shield Block REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Trigger: You or an adjacent ally would take Physical , Astral , Lunar , or Force damage.

    Effect: You take 2 STRESS and grant yourself or the ally resistance to that damage .

    Phoenixes conjure fiery destruction from afar, inflicting lingering burns upon their enemies.

    P hoenixes are elite spellcasters specializing in elemental fire. During training, they take the mythical phoenix as their inspiration, focusing on the different aspects of fire, such as destruction and rebirth. To become a phoenix, you must give over your aetheric field to the raw forces of flame. If you have prepared correctly, it will be returned infused with fire; if not, your aether will be consumed.

    • What color and shape do your flames take?
    • What aspect of fire do you respect the most? Destruction, warmth, rebirth, or something else?
    • How has fire affected or shaped your life?
    • What makes your connection to fire stronger, and what makes it weaker?

    TRAITS

    Burning Spells

    You deal +1 Discord with all abilities that deal Discord .

    Burn Proof

    You have resistance to Astral and Discord .

    TRAIT

    TRAIT

    LIMIT BREAK

    Supervolcano CHANNEL
    LIMIT BREAK HOMING,MANA2 RANGE = SCOPE

    If you stop channeling this ability before releasing it for any reason, you do not expend the limit break.

    On Release: You create a SIZE 3 volcano - a piece of terrain - within RANGE . The volcano destroys any objects (including terrain) other than objectives in its spaces. Characters in these spaces are considered to be atop the volcano.

    Mark 6 spaces as lava flows . These must be adjacent to either the volcano or another lava flow space. Lava flows are dangerous terrain ( AGILITY , 5 DISCORD ).

    Characters within or adjacent to the volcano or a lava flow space receive +2 on checks to clear Discord .

    On subsequent turns, you can spend 1 MP as a minor action to add or remove up to 3 lava flow spaces.

    The volcano and lava flows last until the end of the scene.

    Reaching deep below the surface with aetheric might, the phoenix pulls up a grand manifestation of burning power a raging volcano. Lava erupts from within, forming molten rivers that burn those who stray too close.

    Phoenixes make expert use of effects that deal Discord . Their significant MP and long SCOPE means they are well suited to attack safely from afar with spells. The Sniper talent is a good fit for Phoenixes that use ranged spell attacks.

    RANK 1

    Immolate VOLLEY

    Flames that cling to their target, refusing to be extinguished. The burning doesn't stop until there's no fuel left.

    Solar Flare VOLLEY

    You gain +1 when attacking with this weapon if the target has Discord .

    Long ago, a Reflection exploded. Pieces of the dead world were scattered across the Source, coming to rest in clusters within other Reflections. Thaumaturges fashion these pieces into weapons that project the astral energy of the shattered Reflection.

    Inferno

    CHANNEL

    RANGED SPELL ATTACK 2 MEMORY AUTO-HIT, MANA 2

    RANGE = SCOPE, BLAST 2 3 DISCORD

    On Release: Y ou can choose to reduce the size of the AOE to increase the damage. For every -1 Blast , the spell deals +2 Discord (e.g., reducing it from BLAST 2 to BLAST 1 increases the damage to 5 DISCORD ). If the AOE would be reduced to 0, it instead targets a single space.

    This spell can funnel the heat of a raging inferno into progressively smaller spaces, raising the temperature exponentially.

    Vent Heat

    REACTION

    SKILL 2 MEMORY ARCING, UNIQUE

    Trigger: A character within RANGE 20 clears any amount of Discord .

    Effect: Y ou center a BURST 1 AOE on that character. Characters in the AOE, including the target, take Astral equal to half of the Discord cleared.

    SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT ARMOR, UNBREAKABLE

    +1 ARMOR .

    Enemies within RANGE 5 use your SAVE TARGET when making MAGIC checks to clear Discord instead of the normal target number of 10. Adjacent enemies use your SAVE TARGET+2 .

    First worn by Taliesan, the Verdant Flame, phoenix feathers adorn this red and gold armor. Fires burn brighter and hotter in the presence of this artifact, to the point of being unbearable when near it.

    Wildfire

    MINOR ACTION

    SPELL 2 MEMORY MANA 1

    RANGE = SCOPE

    Choose one of the following:

    • Blueflame: Choose an enemy with Discord within RANGE . Their Discord increases by +2 , but this doesn't cause them to immediately take Discord damage.

    • Flashover: Choose an enemy within RANGE . They gain the same amount of Discord as the character with the highest Discord within RANGE 3 of them. This doesn't cause them to immediately take Discord damage.

    Your flames grow wild and uncontrollable, changing color based on the unique composition of your aetheric field.

    Armed with experimental blades that can cut rifts in space-time itself, riftblades can travel between Reflections to explore new worlds.

    R iftblades explore the different Reflections of the Source, cataloging as much about these new and interesting worlds as possible. The main tool of a riftblade is their signature riftcutter, a magitech device with an infinitely sharp edge that can cut small portals between Reflections. Knowing that each new Reflection is filled with unknown challenges and hazards, riftblades outfit themselves with a wide array of gear to prepare for any situation.

    • What was the most interesting Reflection you visited?
    • What do you hope to find in your travels?
    • What did you leave behind in a rift you'll never be able to get back?
    • Where are you forbidden to open a rift to?

    BASE ATTRIBUTES

    DODGE: 7 A-DEF: 8
    SPEED: 4 MP: 4

    TRAITS

    Rift MINORACTION
    TRAIT MANA1 RANGE 20

    You place a rift in a free space within RANGE . This doesn't require line of sight.

    RANGE , REACH , and line of sight for everything (except placing additional rifts) can be drawn both to and from you as if you were standing in the rift's space. The rift's space is considered occupied by you.

    The rift itself is not an object and cannot be directly interacted with or affected in any way. It lasts for the rest of the scene, until you use this ability again, or until you dismiss it as a minor action .

    Riftcutter

    TRAIT

    You gain the RIFTCUTTER weapon, which is equipped for free.

    Riftcutter

    FIGHT

    MELEE WEAPON

    LIGHT MAGITECH

    ACCURATE, INNATE,

    PIERCING, UNIQUE

    REACH 1

    3 PHYSICAL

    This weapon ignores resistance and immunity .

    LIMIT BREAK

    Gateway LIMIT BREAK

    MINOR ACTION

    You create two SIZE 3 gateways on free solid surfaces within RANGE 15 , ignoring line of sight. These gateways aren't obstructions, don't block line of sight, and last until the end of the scene.

    1/turn when a character fully enters a gateway, they are immediately teleported to the other gateway, being placed in a space of their choice so they are fully within the gateway. If a character enters a gateway as a result of forced movement, their forced movement continues in the same direction from the other gateway starting in a space chosen by whoever initiated the forced movement.

    If a character cannot end this teleport fully within the gateway (e.g., because too many spaces are occupied), the teleport fails.

    Riftcutters can be overcharged with energy, allowing them to create larger and more stable rifts. With the proper architecture, these gateways can become permanent portals, allowing instant travel between two places; however, the portable power packs that riftblades carry aren't strong enough, and the gateways they create will eventually close.

    The Riftblade is a complicated class that use their RIFT trait to gain range and angles on their enemies. Careful positioning of a rift is necessary, as enemies can attack them through it. Try placing rifts in cover or where enemies can't reach.

    RANK 1

    Gravity Well SKILL 1 MEMORY

    Enemies must always stop moving when they become ENGAGED with you, regardless of their SIZE . Adjacent enemies must spend 2 movement when moving to spaces that aren't adjacent to you.

    Gravity generators are a standard piece of equipment for Riftblades. The ability to create a comfortable gravity field around themselves is sometimes the difference between life and death.

    Sensor Goggles SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT

    You know the current HP , STRESS , and MP of all MARKED enemies.

    Additionally, 1/turn , you can reroll the INVISIBLE miss chance when attacking an INVISIBLE target.

    These goggles are equipped with aetheric and biometric scanners for any situation.

    RANK 2

    Flicker Enchantment SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT ENCHANTMENT

    You may use one of the following Enchantments at a time:

    • Any Armor: 1/round while this ARMOR is equipped, you can immediately teleport up to 1d6 spaces as a reaction when you take damage.
    • Any Weapon: 1/round when you critically hit with this weapon, you can teleport the target up to 1d6 spaces .

    Flicker armor is used for emergency escapes. When triggered, it quickly hurls the wearer away from their attacker.

    Portal Gun

    MINOR ACTION

    SUPPORT ITEM

    MAIN

    MANA 1

    RANGE 10

    You teleport an ally or enemy within RANGE up to 3 spaces . This counts as forced movement. Unwilling characters can make a MAGIC save. Success: They resist this effect.

    Portal guns can create small, short-lived holes in reality, allowing limited teleportation at greater range than possible with a riftcutter.

    RANK 3

    Blink

    MINOR ACTION

    SPELL 2 MEMORY MANA 1

    You teleport up to 1d6+1 spaces .

    The earliest riftblades studied teleportation magics and teleporting creatures to better understand the long-term effects of repeated teleportation.

    Displacer Rod

    FULL ATTACK

    RANGED WEAPON

    HEAVY ARTIFACT

    MANA 3,

    SLOW

    RANGE 15

    X FORCE

    This weapon's damage is equal to the number of spaces between you and the target, to a maximum of 20 FORCE .

    Displacer rods create pulses of energy that grow in power the further they travel.

    Icy armor grows over rimeguards, granting layers of protection that grow stronger over time.

    T he Rimeguard's source of power is their frozen heart. A splinter of ice formed from the death of an ancient elemental spirit is driven into their heart, encasing it in ice and freezing the blood in their veins. Those that survive the process become one with the forces of cold.

    BASE ATTRIBUTES

    The icy splinters needed to create a rimeguard are rare, and as a result, rimeguards are an uncommon sight. Their rarity combined with their cold and distant demeanor, gives rimeguards a frightening reputation that is only sometimes earned.

    • Who did you save from certain death?
    • Where were you when you realized you would change the world?
    • What can't you feel when you channel the cold?
    • Who or what have you lost to the cold?
    SCOPE: 8 SAVE TARGET: 11
    BULK MIND

    AGILITY MAGIC
    DODGE: 6 A-DEF: 9
    SPEED: 5 MP: 4

    TRAITS

    Frost Armor MINORACTION
    TRAIT FOCUS 1 RANGE = SCOPE

    You give an ally within RANGE TEMP HP equal to half your current TEMP HP (to a minimum of 1). You can increase this amount by reducing your own TEMP HP by 1 for every additional +1 TEMP HP granted, granting a maximum of 10 TEMP HP received.

    Icy Veins

    You have resistance to Lunar .

    Additionally, you start each combat scene with 6 TEMP HP , and this amount refreshes whenever you take a Wound. When you gain FOCUS , you can choose for any amount of it to become TEMP HP instead.

    You can stack TEMP HP to a maximum of 10 TEMP HP . Y ou can exceed this maximum if a single source of TEMP HP would put you over this amount, but you can't stack additional TEMP HP past that.

    Rimeheart TRAIT

    MINOR ACTION

    RANGE = SCOPE

    An ally with TEMP HP within RANGE gains +2 TEMP HP , to a maximum of 10 . This TEMP HP stacks with existing TEMP HP .

    TRAIT

    7: claSSeS and JoBS

    runninG tHe Game

    LIMIT BREAK

    Absolute Zero LIMIT BREAK

    MINOR ACTION

    You and your allies (ignoring line of sight) clear all Stress and reduce their current SURGE level by 1.

    The rimeguard drops the temperature to absolute zero, freezing everything in its tracks. With a snap of their fingers, the cold breaks. Absolute zero lasts only for a moment, but it's enough for the rimeguard's allies to cool off.

    Rimeguards want to generate as much FOCUS as possible, allocating it between TEMP HP granted by FROST ARMOR and their other FOCUS needs. Because of their unique mechanism for stacking TEMP HP , rimeguards can either keep the TEMP HP for themselves and adopt an interposing defender style, or play the role of the backline defender by sharing TEMP HP with allies.

    RANK 1

    Coldguard SKILL

    2 MEMORY

    When you DEFEND , adjacent allies gain TEMP HP equal to your GRIT+3 .

    The air around you is cold and dry. Leaving your feet still for too long causes tendrils of ice to spread along the ground, crawling up the legs of anyone nearby.

    Frostbite VOLLEY
    RANGED SPELL ATTACK 1MEMORY AETHERIC,
    INDIRECT RANGE = SCOPE 2STRESS

    On Hit: Choose one of the following:

    • Frozen: At the end of their next turn, the target takes Stress equal to their SPEED . This Stress is reduced by -1 for every space they move during that turn.
    • Numbing: The next attack the target makes before the end of their next turn deals half damage .

    When skin turns blue, the cold has claimed it. You have given yourself to the cold. There is nothing left for it to take.

    RANK 2

    Ice Spikes

    SKILL 1 MEMORY UNIQUE

    If you become the target of an attack when you INTERPOSE , you can deal 2 PIERCING LUNAR to the attacker after their attack if they are within your SCOPE .

    You are one with the ice. Without conscious thought, it bristles at your foes, vibrating in anticipation.

    White Wind VOLLEY RANGED WEAPON MAIN ARTIFACT REACH 1 / CLOSE BLAST 2 3 LUNAR

    On Hit: The target is SLOWED until the end of their next turn.

    This staff is powered by a crystal of ice - the same crystal that spawned the icy shard that pierced your heart and gave you the powers of a rimeguard. Remember what you have sacrificed, and the cold will answer your call.

    RANK 3

    Frozen Throne FREE ACTION SUPPORT ITEM MAIN MANA 2 BURST 1

    You create a zone of growing cold around you. Enemies that start their turn in the zone take 2 LUNAR . At the start of each of your turns while this effect is active, its damage increases by +2 , after which you take the updated damage. This damage bypasses your ARMOR .

    You can deactivate this ability as a free action , which resets the damage back to its base value of 2.

    'With ice in your heart, go forth into the world. Build our throne where you travel, and our kingdom will follow.'

    Siphon Heat SKILL 3 MEMORY UNIQUE

    At the start of each of your turns, you gain FOCUS equal to the number of adjacent characters.

    Take their heat, and make it your cold. The warmth is not welcome here.

    Trackers and hunters that always find their prey. Seekers call out priority targets for their allies.

    S eekers are warriors who form bonds with primal spirits, which impart upon them a fraction of their power. In return for power, seekers act as extensions of their patron spirits, operating beyond their normal boundaries.

    BASE ATTRIBUTES

    Most seekers have a positive relationship with their bonded primal, but some forged their bonds out of desperation or necessity. These seekers may not agree with their primal's motives, but are nonetheless compelled to do its bidding or risk losing their powers. However antagonistic the relationship, the seeker acts as the eyes, ears, and hands of their primal.

    • How do you see and know the exact spots to shoot?
    • What primal spirit do you have a connection with?
    • Which of your primal spirit's aspects do you share?
    • What is the most dangerous expedition you've been on?

    Seeker's Sight TRAIT MANA 1

    You MARK .

    Guided Shot

    MINOR ACTION

    TRAIT

    You gain the GUIDED SHOT skill, which is equipped for free.

    Guided Shot

    SKILL INNATE, UNIQUE

    Trigger: A ranged or thrown attack misses an enemy within your SCOPE .

    Effect: The attack roll misses, but the attacker may reroll the attack roll against a different target within RANGE 5 of the original target. A target can't be hit more than once by the same attack.

    REACTION

    LIMIT BREAK

    Heavenly Starfall LIMIT BREAK ARCING

    PHASE SKIRMISH

    You create three non-overlapping BLAST 2 zones within RANGE 40 . All enemies in one or more of these zones must make an AGILITY save. Failure: They take 1D3+1 FORCE . Success: They take half damage . Each character only takes this damage once, even if they are in multiple zones.

    While any of these zones exist, you can spend 1 MP as a minor action to MARK all enemies in these zones and make them DAZED until the end of their next turn.

    At the end of each of your turns, one of the zones disappears.

    An arrow shot into the sky disappears into a rapidly spreading dark cloud. Lightning cracks and rain begins to fall. Each blue raindrop an arrow that seeks a home. There is no escape until the storm passes.

    The Seeker playstyle revolves around the Marked condition. MARKSMAN'S EYE benefits allies that consume MARKS , and SEEKER'S SIGHT allows them to MARK enemies with ease. The Spotter talent is a good choice for Seekers, and any abilities that use SCOPE benefit from their high base SCOPE attribute.

    Chain Shot VOLLEY RANGED SPELL ATTACK 2 MEMORY AETHERIC RANGE = SCOPE 1D3 LUNAR

    On Hit: Choose one of the following:

    • Grounding Chain: The target must make a MAGIC save. Failure: They are IMMOBILIZED until the end of their next turn. You can spend 1 MP to force all characters adjacent to the target to make the save as well.
    • Linked Chain ( 1 MP ): You center a BURST 2 AOE around the target. Characters in the AOE must make a BULK save. Failure: They are pulled to the closest free space adjacent to the original target.

    When this magical arrow strikes its target, invisible chains manifest and begin tightening around them.

    VOLLEY

    RANK 2

    Spectral Shot SKILL 2 MEMORY MANA 1

    Your single-target ranged attacks pass through objects (including terrain). As long as you have line of sight to a target, you can ignore cover when attacking. You can still attack targets without line of sight, but they benefit from hard cover .

    As you draw back the bowstring, you pour aether into the arrow. When it can take no more, it ascends to a higher state of matter and can pass through solid objects.

    Swarming Shot

    VOLLEY

    RANGED SPELL ATTACK 2 MEMORY AETHERIC, INDIRECT, MANA 1

    RANGE = SCOPE, BLAST 1 2 STRESS

    On Attack: Choose one of the following:

    • Buzzing Swarm: The AOE becomes a zone until the start of your next turn. Any character that starts their turn in the zone or enters it during their turn becomes DAZED until the end of their next turn.
    • On Hit: The target is DAZED until the end of their next turn.
    • Distracting Swarm: The AOE becomes a zone until the start of your next turn. Any character that starts their turn in the zone or enters it during their turn becomes MARKED.
    • On Hit: The target is MARKED until the end of their next turn.

    This magical arrow explodes into tiny aetheric motes, which twinkle and buzz distractingly.

    Coiling Shot

    VOLLEY

    RANGED SPELL ATTACK 1 MEMORY AETHERIC RANGE = SCOPE 1D6+4 FORCE

    On Hit: Choose one of the following:

    • Constricting Serpent: The target cannot make OPPORTUNITY ATTACKS until the end of their next turn.
    • Striking Serpent: A spectral serpent coils around the target. Until the end of their next turn, if the target ends their turn adjacent to one of their allies, the ally takes 3 FORCE and is DAZED until the end of their next turn.

    Upon impact, the magical arrow transforms into a spectral serpent. Formed through the victim's aetheric field, the serpent lashes out at anyone that draws near, though it remains indifferent to its host.

    Shadebinders capture and train dangerous shades, forging strong bonds with them.

    S udden shifts in an area's aetheric balance can give rise to shades - creatures made of pure aether. These creatures can be dangerous, often lashing out in pain and confusion due to the environmental imbalance.

    BASE ATTRIBUTES

    Shadebinders capture and train these dangerous shades, returning them to their homes once the imbalance is addressed, or forging strong bonds with them and becoming traveling companions.

    • What was the first shade you trapped, and what were they like?
    • What was the most elaborate trap you set, and what was it for?
    • When were you unable to return a shade to its home, and why?
    • What aetheric disturbance has never been repaired, and is only getting worse?

    Shadebinders are a summoning class that prioritizes having fewer, stronger Summons . COMMAND PARTNER lets their Summons take actions on the behalf of the Shadebinder, like grappling enemies instead of doing it themselves. As with most summoners, they will likely want to take the Summoner talent.

    SCOPE: 10 SAVE TARGET: 12
    BULK MIND
    HP: 6 STRESS CAP: 5
    RECOVERIES: 5 MEMORY: 6
    AGILITY MAGIC
    DODGE: 7 A-DEF: 7
    SPEED: 4 MP: 4

    TRAITS

    Command Partner

    TRAIT

    Once during each of your turns, one of your Summons within SCOPE can use one of your actions against a target within your SCOPE . You lose the action and pay any costs, like MP or Consumable charges, but the Summon is considered to be the one performing it. If it is a CHANNEL action, the Summon is the one that concentrates and can release during PHASE RELEASE .

    While performing an action using this trait, your Summon benefits from your talents.

    Companion Shade

    TRAIT SUMMON

    MINOR ACTION

    RANGE = SCOPE

    Friendly Shade ( SIZE 1/2 , HP = GRIT+8 , DODGE/A-DEF = GRIT+10 , SPEED 4 )

    You call forth a friendly shade within RANGE . When you do so, you gain one of the special reactions on the facing page.

    You can only have one shade in play at a time and it retains its current HP when dismissed, which persists between scenes. If the shade is defeated, you must spend a RECOVERY to summon it again, after which it regains all HP . It regains all HP during Rests .

    Dewdrop

    REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Trigger: An enemy adjacent to the shade starts their turn.

    Effect: They are MARKED by the shade and must make a MAGIC save. Failure: They lose 2 MP .

    Firestarter

    REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Trigger: An enemy adjacent to the shade takes damage or Stress .

    Effect: They take 1D6 DISCORD from the shade.

    Vinecutter

    REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Trigger: An enemy adjacent to the Shade takes damage or Stress .

    Effect: They take 2 STRESS from the Shade and the Shade can slide them 2 spaces .

    LIMIT BREAK

    Aetheric Evolution LIMIT BREAK ARCING

    You empower one of your Summons within RANGE with an influx of aether. It regains all HP and receives the following benefits, which last until the end of the scene or until the Summon is defeated, and remain even if the Summon is dismissed:

    • +1 SIZE .
    • +10 current and maximum HP .
    • If it didn't have a SPEED , it gains SPEED 4 . Otherwise, it gains +2 SPEED .

    It also gains the HYPER RAY , SLASH , SNARL , and RECOVER abilities, which it can perform as standard actions .

    Shades are aetheric creatures. By infusing them with aether, their form can change and grow, becoming stronger than before. This change is temporary, as this new form radiates aether until it returns to its natural state.

    Hyper Ray

    SPELL

    All characters in a LINE 15 AOE must make an AGILITY save. Failure: They take 10 FORCE . Success: They take 5 FORCE .

    After performing this action, the Summon can't move or take any actions during your next turn, and can't be dismissed until the end of your next turn.

    Slash

    SKILL

    An adjacent enemy takes 3 PIERCING PHYSICAL and is SUNDERED until the end of their next turn.

    Snarl

    SKILL

    An enemy within RANGE 5 is MARKED and must make a MIND save. Failure: They are WEAKENED until the end of their next turn.

    Recover

    SKILL

    The Summon regains all of its HP , clears a condition, and gains hard cover until the end of your next turn.

    RANK 1

    Teamwork SKILL 1 MEMORY

    Your Summons can use your BULK, AGILITY, MIND , and MAGIC scores instead of theirs for ability checks and saves.

    Minor Action: If you have at least one Summon in play, choose one of the effects listed below. This lasts for the rest of the scene, or until you choose another effect, end it as a free action, or have no more active Summons .

    These effects affect all of your Summons , including ones summoned after the profile is activated:

    • Threatening Summons: Attacks against your Summons gain +1 , and attacks against you receive +1 .
    • Unassuming Summons: Attacks against your Summons receive +1 , and attacks against you gain +1 .

    You and your summons fight together and cover for each other.

    Trainer Items

    SUPPORT ITEM MAIN CONSUMABLE 3, REACTION

    You gain the REVIVE and RETURN reactions, which expend a charge when used.

    A supply of medicine, supplies, and equipment to keep your companions in tip-top shape.

    Revive

    REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Trigger: One of your Summons within SCOPE would be defeated.

    Effect: The Summon is not defeated, and has its current HP set to its BLOODIED value.

    Return

    REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Trigger: A character starts their turn.

    Effect: One of your Summons (ignoring line of sight) is teleported to a free space adjacent to you.

    Buddy Bond

    SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT ENCHANTMENT

    You may use one of the following Enchantments at a time:

    • Any Support Item or Technique that Doesn't Require an Action to Activate: When you create a Summon , you can choose for it to also receive any passive benefits granted by this item or technique. This lasts until it is defeated or dismissed. The Summon doesn't gain the ability to use any actions granted by this item or technique - just the passive benefits. Only one Summon can benefit from this ability at a time.
    • Any Equipment or Technique with the Summon Tag: When you regain HP , Summons created with the enchanted equipment or technique regain half as much HP . This only affects Summons that are currently in play.

    Your companion has their own appropriately sized equipment.

    Familiar MINOR ACTION SPELL 1 MEMORY MANA 1, SUMMON

    Familiar ( SIZE 1/2 , HP 1 , DODGE/A-DEF 10 , SPEED 0 )

    You call your familiar forth in a free space adjacent to you. You may automatically do this at the beginning of a combat scene, spending the required MP as normal.

    When you call your familiar, choose BULK , AGILITY , MIND , or MAGIC . While you and your familiar are adjacent to each other, you both gain +1 to checks and saves with the chosen ability score.

    Whenever you move (excluding forced movement) while adjacent to this Summon , it can also move to any free space adjacent to you, benefiting from any special forms of movement that you use (e.g., flight or teleportation ).

    This cute creature is your friend. You feel better and more capable when you're near them.

    RANK 2

    RANK 3

    Lifelink SPELL 3 MEMORY

    When you call forth a Summon , you can spend 1 MP to forge a link between you. As long as you are both in play, any time either of you takes damage (after ARMOR and resistances ), the damage is split between both characters. This cannot be avoided or mitigated in any way, and does not count as the second character taking damage (meaning it doesn't trigger additional instances of this effect).

    The link lasts for the end of the scene, or until one of the characters is defeated or you end the effect as a free action .

    Shadebinders can mix their aetheric fields with those of their summoned companions, sharing in any damage and pain received.

    Capture Orb MINOR ACTION SUPPORT ITEM MAIN CONSUMABLE 6, THROWN 5 THROWN 5

    This item starts with the Empty profile:

    • Empty: As a minor action , you can expend a charge and make a thrown melee weapon attack. On Hit: Your target must make a MAGIC save with +1 if they are BLOODIED , +1 if they are BREAKING , and +1 for every condition they have. Failure: They are STUNNED and IMMOBILIZED until the end of their next turn. Make note of their current HP and MP , and this item switches to the Full profile. Success: They are DAZED until the end of their next turn and this item remains Empty .
    • Full: As a minor action , one character within the thrown RANGE gains TEMP HP equal to the combined HP and MP of the character that failed their MAGIC save. This item switches to the Empty profile. This does not expend a charge.

    These devices can convert shades back into pure aether, allowing them to be transported safely and easily. When opened, they return their inhabitant to their normal form. While originally created for use on shades, recent improvements now allow capture orbs to extract trace amounts of aether from other creatures, storing it for later use.

    S H A D O W D A N C E R STRIKER

    Shadow dancers cloak themselves with darkness, moving unseen across the battlefield. Their special connection with the shadows allows them to teleport between areas of darkness.

    S hadow dancers train in the dark, increasing their attunement to the power of the umbra. When they finish their training, their shadow has changed: it moves differently, feels looser, and seems darker. Every shadow looks different to the dancer once they realize that they're all connected.

    • How are shadows linked, and how do you exploit that?
    • What is your favorite type of dance?
    • Why do you feel more comfortable in the dark?
    • What strengthens your shadow, and what happens if it gets too strong?

    BASE ATTRIBUTES

    TRAITS

    Shadow Clones

    TRAIT

    Whenever you teleport , you leave a shadow clone in your former space. These clones are the same SIZE as you, don't cause obstruction, and aren't characters or objects.

    1/round when you or an ally damage a target adjacent to a shadow clone, the shadow clone can cause the triggering ability to deal +1d6 bonus damage .

    You can have any number of shadow clones, which last until the end of the scene or until you are defeated.

    Shadow Realm

    TRAIT

    Any time you teleport , you can spend 1 MP to choose one of your shadow clones as the destination. This destroys the clone.

    Slip Step

    Reaction attacks against you receive +1 .

    • Minor Action: While adjacent to a character, you teleport to another space adjacent to that character.

    Eclipse LIMIT BREAK

    FREE ACTION

    Until the end of the scene, you can teleport when you make your standard movement or use the movement option from RUSH , and can split up movements as normal. You can only create one shadow clone per standard movement or RUSH .

    For the duration, Shadow Realm costs 0 MP .

    Umbral shadows creep over any source of light, plunging the area into darkness. Nothing is safe from the obscurement, not even the sun itself.

    Shadow Dancers are high-mobility attackers, moving across the battlefield to attack precisely when they need to before disappearing into a pool of darkness. The Assassin class has useful stealth-enhancing abilities, and any teleportation effects give the Shadow Dancer more opportunities to gain SHADOW CLONES .

    RANK 1

    Shadow Step SKILL 2 MEMORY MANA 1

    When you use the movement option from RUSH , you can teleport the distance instead. If you end this movement adjacent to hard cover , you can HIDE as a free action .

    All shadows are connected, and you know how to move between them. Step into one, appear from another. Be prepared for what awaits you in the shadow realm.

    Living Shadow

    SPELL 2 MEMORY MANA 3, SUMMON

    RANGE = SCOPE

    Living Shadow ( SIZE 1/2 , HP 5 , DODGE/A-DEF 10 , SPEED 0 )

    You create a living shadow within RANGE . This shadow emits a BURST 2 zone. Enemies are BLINDED while fully within the zone. Enemies that start their turn partly within the zone must make a MAGIC save. Failure: They are WEAKENED until the start of their next turn.

    You call forth a creature from the shadow realm - a living shadow. Its very presence darkens the world around it, draining life and light into a realm of absolute darkness.

    VOLLEY

    Shapeshifters are able to assume various forms to overcome obstacles, transforming their entire body or individual parts as needed.

    S hapeshifters can change their bodies, taking on the features of other creatures or changing into different creatures altogether. The earliest shapeshifters were lycanthropes studying the way their transformations worked. Over time, they discovered how to transform specific parts of their bodies, and eventually how to choose what they transformed into.

    BASE ATTRIBUTES

    SCOPE: 10 SAVE TARGET: 10
    BULK MIND
    HP: 8 STRESS CAP: 7
    RECOVERIES: 4 MEMORY: 5
    AGILITY MAGIC
    DODGE: 8 A-DEF: 7
    SPEED: 5 MP: 4

    This type of shapeshifting is notable because it's a learned skill, not a spell. The shapeshifter carefully rearranges their aetheric balance until it precisely aligns with the typical aetheric balance of the creature they're shapeshifting into. While their form may be different, they're still the same person they were before. A shapeshifter that transforms into a bear isn't actually a bear; they're merely adopting the outward form of a bear.

    • What does it look like when you transform?
    • What physical trait carries over to each form you assume?
    • When was the first time you changed your shape, and what was it?
    • What form or changes feel most natural to you?

    TRAITS

    Beast Weapons

    You gain BEAST WEAPONS , which is equipped for free.

    Beast Weapons

    TRAIT

    FIGHT

    MELEE WEAPON LIGHT CLUB INNATE, UNIQUE REACH 1 1D3 PHYSICAL

    At the end of your turn, if you didn't make an attack that turn, you can attack once with this weapon as a free action . You can use this weapon even if DISARMED .

    Form for the Occasion

    TRAIT

    You move normally in difficult terrain . Additionally, you have an Aquatic Adaptation and you can fly when you move, but you take 1 STRESS at the end of any turn in which you do so.

    Soothe

    TRAIT

    When an ally within SCOPE consumes a MARK , you can clear 1 Stress from them as long as they aren't STUNNED .

    LIMIT BREAK

    Perfect Form LIMIT BREAK

    FREE ACTION

    You gain up to four of the following benefits, which last until the end of the scene. 1/turn as a free action , you can change up to four of your chosen benefits. Only one instance of each option can be in effect at a time:

    • Adaptive Body: You gain +1 on all checks and saves.
    • Dire Beast Weapons: Your BEAST WEAPONS deal 1D6+2 DAMAGE instead of their standard damage.
    • Eagle Eye: You can MARK as a minor action .
    • Perfected Form: Form for the Occasion no longer causes Stress when you fly, and you have flight .
    • Hunter's Eye: At the start of your turn, you gain 1 FOCUS .
    • Insulated Hide: You gain resistance to Physical , Astral, Lunar, Force, Stress, or Discord from other characters.
    • Predator Weapons: You gain +1 on attacks.
    • Resized: Y ou become any SIZE from 1/2 to 4 . Characters are pushed to make space for your new size.
    • Sneaky: You can HIDE as a minor action .
    • Walking Wall: You count as hard cover for your allies.

    Take the best parts of every form you know, and manifest them all at once. As long as you can maintain them, you are the ultimate lifeform.

    A shapeshifter's different forms make them very versatile in combat play, and with FORM FOR THE OCCASION they don't need to worry about changing their equipment and techniques based on the environment. Shapeshifters are a jack-of-all-trades class, and can adopt a range of playstyles by combining their shapeshifting forms with those from other classes.

    Scout Form

    MINOR ACTION

    SKILL 2 MEMORY MANA 2, POLYMORPH

    You assume a scouting form, with the following effects:

    • You become SIZE 1/2 .
    • You gain +2 SPEED .
    • Attacks against you receive +1
    • You can't attack or use spells.
    • You can MARK a character within SCOPE as a minor action .

    This form lasts for the rest of the scene or until you end the effect as a free action .

    By taking on a scouting form, you become a less visible threat, but your reconnaissance skills remain the same.

    Ferocious Bite SKILL 2 MEMORY

    Allies gain +1 on attacks against enemies GRAPPLED with you.

    Strong jaws lock your victim in place.

    RANK 1

    RANK 2

    Defender Form

    MINOR ACTION

    SKILL 2 MEMORY MANA 2, POLYMORPH

    You assume a defensive form, with the following effects:

    • You gain +1 SIZE (to a maximum of 3 ).
    • Allies gain the benefits of cover as if you were a piece of hard cover .
    • When you enter this form or as a minor action , you can select an ally within SCOPE . For the duration, you can INTERPOSE for them without spending FOCUS and you gain +2 ARMOR against the triggering attack when you do. Only one ally can be selected at a time.
    • You can only attack using reactions .

    The form lasts for the rest of the scene or until you end the effect as a free action .

    Transcend the limitations of your natural form. Feel your skin thicken and harden, your bones lengthen. Grow taller, stronger, and tougher.

    Apex Weapon

    FIGHT

    MELEE WEAPON

    HEAVY CLUB

    REACH 1 2D6+2 PHYSICAL

    On Hit: Y ou can auto-hit the target with GRAPPLE . While GRAPPLED by you, they take 1 PIERCING PHYSICAL at the start of each of their turns.

    A tyrannosaurus rex's bite. A tiger's claws. A manticore's spikes. Each of these are the weapons of an apex predator, and you possess one.

    RANK 3

    Familiar Form MINOR ACTION SKILL 2 MEMORY MANA 1, POLYMORPH

    You assume a form that is friendly or important to your foes. Any character that attacks you in this form takes 2 STRESS , but all your attacks receive +1 .

    This form lasts for the rest of the scene or until you end the effect as a free action .

    Adopting the exact appearance of another person is incredibly difficult, but it can be done. Most shapeshifters recommend doing so for only a short time; otherwise, you risk beginning to lose your own sense of self.

    Snarl and Bite

    REACTION

    SKILL 2 MEMORY STRESSFUL 2

    Trigger: Someone makes a melee attack against you.

    Effect: Y ou make a melee attack against the attacker with a LIGHT or MAIN weapon.

    Reflexively lash out with claw and tooth. Make them regret having the audacity to strike at you.

    Skalds are warrior poets who weave magic into song. A skald's songs can bolster their allies, providing powerful benefits.

    T here is magic in a song. There is magic in a dance. Any performance where you put some of yourself into it is magic. Skalds know this, and can push it to its extremes. Stories come to life and move people, or draw out specific emotions. Performance is the weapon of the skald.

    BASE ATTRIBUTES

    A skald's performances stimulate the aetheric field of nearby creatures. By honing these performances, they learn to produce specific, repeatable effects. Skalds enjoy traveling and meeting other skalds, growing their repertoire of performances and related magical effects.

    • What type of performance is your specialty?
    • What weapon and instrument have you combined? Songbow, hammerhorn, or something else?
    • What does your entrance music sound like, or what is the main instrument it features?
    • Who was moved by your performance that you didn't expect to be?
    SCOPE: 10 SAVE TARGET: 11
    BULK MIND
    HP: 7 STRESS CAP: 6
    RECOVERIES: 4 MEMORY: 6
    AGILITY MAGIC
    DODGE: 8 A-DEF: 9
    SPEED: 5 MP: 4

    TRAITS

    Encore

    TRAIT

    At the beginning of any round, if you successfully released a CHANNEL ability in the previous round, you can spend 1 MP to immediately CHANNEL .

    Inspire TRAIT MANA 1

    FREE ACTION (1/TURN)

    RANGE = SCOPE

    You grant Inspiration to an ally within RANGE . Allies with Inspiration can consume it to gain +1 on an attack, check, or save. Each character can only have one Inspiration at a time. Inspiration lasts until the end of the scene or until consumed.

    Tempo

    You gain the TEMPO skill, which is equipped for free.

    Tempo

    SKILL

    INNATE, UNIQUE

    Trigger: An attack misses an ally within SCOPE .

    Effect: The ally shifts 2.

    TRAIT

    REACTION

    LIMIT BREAK

    Ballad FREE ACTION
    LIMIT BREAK ARCING RANGE = SCOPE

    You begin weaving a legendary performance. Upon activation and at the start of each of your turns, pick a verse from those listed below. It affects you and all allies within RANGE . Each verse can only be chosen once.

    Instead of picking a verse (or when there are no more verses to select), you may select a finale from those listed below. It affects you and all allies within Range, following which this ability ends.

    If you are SILENCED , the effects of all verses are suppressed, and you don't choose any new verses or a finale until you have cleared the condition.

    VERSES:

    • Verse of Heroes: +1 on attack rolls.
    • Verse of Journeys: +2 SPEED .
    • Verse of Relaxation: Gain resistance to Stress .
    • Verse of Teamwork: +1 on all checks and saves.

    FINALE:

    • The Last Stand: Gain 1D6+4 FOCUS .
    • The Storm Fades: Regain all MP .
    • Legends Never Die: Regain all HP .
    • A New Beginning: Clear all Stress and conditions.
    • The New World: Each character can shift up to their SPEED .

    A skald can weave so much aether into a performance that it becomes real. The audience feels the stories come to life. they feel the emotions of the players; their hopes and dreams.

    Each ballad tells a specific story, each of its acts mirror whatever is happening in the moment. Eventually, your actions become inseparable from those in the story, and are memorialized in all future retellings.

    Skalds have many ways to support their allies, from the free movement of TEMPO to the accuracy of INSPIRE . They are efficient users of CHANNEL abilities, using ENCORE to chain together channeling abilities each round.

    RANK 1

    Mock

    PHASE SKIRMISH

    SPELL 2 MEMORY

    RANGE = SCOPE

    An enemy within RANGE must make a MIND save. Success: They take 1 STRESS . Failure: They take 2 STRESS and must move their SPEED straight toward you. This movement doesn't count as forced movement, but also doesn't provoke reactions .

    Hit them with a burn so sick they have to respond.

    Wit

    VOLLEY

    RANGED WEAPON MAIN BOW AETHERIC

    RANGE 15 1D3+1 FORCE

    On Hit: The target is DAZED until the end of their next turn and is MARKED .

    The piercing force of this bow is inversely proportional to the mental sharpness of the target. The dumber they are, the more it hurts.

    RANK 2

    Parrying Dagger SUPPORT ITEM MAIN

    REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Trigger: The result of an attack roll would meet or exceed your DODGE .

    Effect: You make a melee attack roll. The result becomes your DODGE against the triggering attack, potentially turning a hit into a miss.

    If the attack misses you, you can spend 1 FOCUS to deal 3 STRESS to the attacker.

    Parrying daggers are held in the offhand and used purely defensively.

    Song of Defense

    SPELL 2 MEMORY ARCING

    On Release: You and all allies within RANGE 5 gain 1 FOCUS . On each subsequent turn, you can spend 1 MP to continue using this song as a minor action , gaining an additional +1 FOCUS . If you don't continue the song this way, the effect ends.

    Sharp, rapid beats keep listeners on their toes and alert to the possibility of danger.

    CHANNEL

    RANK 3

    Song of Rest SPELL 3 MEMORY ARCING

    On Release: Allies within the AOE can spend a RECOVERY to regain all HP .

    On each subsequent turn, you can spend 1 MP to move to the next verse of the song as a minor action , granting 3 TEMP HP to all allies within BURST 3 .

    If you don't continue the song this way, the effect ends.

    This song is soothing and relaxing. Listeners find their aches and pains begin to fade away.

    Soundwave

    SPELL 2 MEMORY MANA 1

    RANGE = SCOPE, BLAST 1

    On Release: This AOE is a zone. Choose one of the following effects:

    • Sound Vacuum: Characters in the zone when it is created take 3 STRESS . Characters are SILENCED and VULNERABLE to Force while partly within the zone.
    • Dead Silence: Characters fully within the zone gain immunity to all subsequent spells and spell effects . Existing spell effects are not affected.

    You can have up to three of these zones in play at once. You can dismiss a zone as a free action during your turn. Otherwise, they last for the rest of the scene or until you become SILENCED or STUNNED .

    The signature spell of Solitaire, the Voice of Revolution. As a sentient vocaloid, she has complete control over soundwaves, which she uses to spread her message of freedom for escognitive and nonorganic people like herself.

    CHANNEL

    Thunderclaws have mastered electricity. They use it to enhance their physical abilities, giving them explosive speed and power.

    T hunderclaws are named after the elite canine warriors that created the fighting style. Training atop a mountain in the Thunderfields, they gained unique insights into the properties of lightning. They learned how to generate and channel it through their bodies, and how to hold it within to enhance their physical abilities.

    BASE ATTRIBUTES

    SCOPE: 5 SAVE TARGET: 10
    BULK MIND
    HP: 8 STRESS CAP: 5
    RECOVERIES: 5 MEMORY: 6
    AGILITY MAGIC
    DODGE: 10 A-DEF: 7
    SPEED: 6 MP: 2
    • What is unique about your fighting style?
    • Where did you train, and why can't anyone else train there now?
    • What is the most dangerous technique you know, and why is it dangerous?
    • What does it feel like to hold lightning within yourself?

    TRAITS

    Flurry

    TRAIT

    You have pool of Flurry that starts at 0 and has a maximum of 6. Whenever you hit with a melee attack, you gain +1 Flurry . When you hit with a melee attack, you can spend Flurry as follows:

    • 1/round , you can spend 1 Flurry to deal +1d6 bonus damage of the same type.
    • 1/round , you can spend 6 Flurry to make a Stunning Strike , forcing one of the targets to make a BULK save. Failure: They are STUNNED and DAZED until the end of their next turn.

    Balance

    TRAIT

    Once during each of your turns, you can convert any amount of Flurry to an equal amount of FOCUS , or vice versa.

    Fast as Lightning TRAIT MANA 1

    You

    MINOR ACTION

    RUSH or make an improvised weapon attack.

    LIMIT BREAK

    Living Lightning LIMIT BREAK

    FREE ACTION

    You channel lightning directly into your body, pushing it past its physical limits and immediately gaining 6 Flurry . Until the end of the scene, your Fast as Lightning trait doesn't cost MP . When you spend 6 Flurry to make a Stunning Strike , the target automatically fails the save.

    A bolt of magical lightning strikes the thunderclaw, but instead of discharging it, they hold it within their body. Years of careful training allow the thunderclaw to take this influx of energy and use it to enhance their physical abilities.

    Supercharged thunderclaws can dart across the battlefield at breakneck speeds, delivering lightningcharged strikes strong enough to punch through steel. Lightning arcs off their body while in this state, as they contain the raw power of a bolt of lightning.

    Held lightning still wants to find a way out of a thunderclaw's body, and the longer it is held, the greater the damage to the thunderclaw. If not discharged, this technique will eventually kill the user.

    Thunderclaws are highly mobile, with abilities that allow them to quickly move around a battlefield, and others that require specific positioning to maximize their effects. The more attacks a Thunderclaw makes, the more Flurry they can generate, so the Stormdancer talent's third rank and other abilities that allow for extra attacks are good choices for this class.

    RANK 1

    Bottled Lightning

    SUPPORT ITEM

    LIGHT

    MINOR ACTION

    CONSUMABLE 2

    BURST 2

    You expend a charge. Characters in the AOE with line of sight to you are BLINDED until the end of their next turn.

    Lightning captured in a bottle, bouncing around angrily while it tries to find a way out. Open the bottle to release it in a blinding flash of light.

    MELEE WEAPON

    2 PHYSICAL

    When thrown, this weapon gains Arcing and deals +1 damage for every space traveled beyond the first.

    This thin disc of metal is made of a rare alloy that allows it to bounce off of surfaces and around corners.

    RANK 2

    Lightning Bolt VOLLEY MELEE SPELL ATTACK 2 MEMORY MANA 1 LINE 10 1D6+2 ASTRAL
