    • Shocked: Characters in the AOE are DAZED and can't perform reactions until the end of their next turn.
    • Drained: On Hit: Target loses MP equal to the total number of characters within the AOE, and you regain 1 MP .

    Your body is the generator. Your hand directs the flow. Let the lightning loose.

    Wolf Claws FIGHT MELEE WEAPON LIGHT CLUB PIERCING REACH 1 2 PHYSICAL

    On Hit: After dealing damage, you can shift a number of spaces equal to the total damage of the attack. If you end this movement next to a different enemy than the one you attacked, you can deal 1 PIERCING PHYSICAL to them.

    Wolf claws are tipped with an indestructible material, allowing them to tear through anything.

    RANK 3

    Chain Lightning Strikes FULL ATTACK MELEE SKILL ATTACK 3 MEMORY SLOW RANGE 5 4 ASTRAL

    On Attack: Choose a character within RANGE . You teleport to a free adjacent space and make this attack against them.

    You can then repeat this attack, targeting a different character each time, and increasing the damage by +1 ASTRAL every time you make the attack roll until the end of the turn. Each character can only be targeted by this ability 1/turn.

    Become a bolt of lightning arcing across the battlefield, finding the shortest path between your foes.

    Kinetic Redistributor REACTION (1/ROUND) SUPPORT ITEM MAIN

    Trigger: A ranged attack roll is made against you.

    Effect: You either impose +1 on the attack or gain 2 FOCUS .

    The thunderclaw fighting style prioritizes efficient movements and using opponents' momentum against them. This logic can be applied to projectiles as well, as demonstrated by the ability of thunderclaws to capture incoming arrows and use their momentum for defense.

    Tidecallers command the oceans and waters. They can manipulate currents to reposition allies and hinder enemies.

    C ommon wisdom suggests that only a fool braves the seas without a tidecaller. Their command over water and their insight into weather patterns make them invaluable additions to any seafaring vessel.

    BASE ATTRIBUTES

    Tidecallers are strongly associated with water-aspect aether, known for its healing properties. A drop of this magical water can heal a small cut, while a deluge can repair deadly wounds and restore vitality. An often-forgotten aspect of water-aspect aether is its weight. Surprisingly, small quantities can knock a grown person off their feet and drag them around in its wake.

    • What secret do you know about the ocean?
    • How do you accurately predict the weather?
    • What underwater-dwelling person do you owe a favor to?
    • How do people typically travel across open water?
    SCOPE: 8 SAVE TARGET: 12
    BULK MIND
    HP: 8 STRESS CAP: 6
    RECOVERIES: 3 MEMORY: 6
    AGILITY MAGIC
    DODGE: 6 A-DEF: 10
    SPEED: 5 MP: 5

    TRAITS

    Rising Tide

    TRAIT

    You have an Aquatic Adaptation . Additionally, 1/turn when you inflict forced movement on an enemy, one of your allies within SCOPE may shift the same number of spaces. You can't use this effect if you are STUNNED .

    River Current TRAIT MANA 1

    MINOR ACTION

    RANGE = SCOPE, LINE 6

    This AOE is a river current - a zone that can be pointed in any direction. It suppresses the effects of difficult and dangerous terrain within it.

    When an ally enters the river current, they can choose to slide to a free space in the zone. Each ally can do this 1/turn .

    This river current lasts for the rest of the scene or until you create a new one, become STUNNED , or are defeated.

    Water Veil

    TRAIT MANA 1

    Trigger: An ally uses a river current.

    Effect: They become INVISIBLE until the start of their next turn. If they are attacked while outside of the river current, INVISIBLE ends after that attack.

    REACTION

    191

    LIMIT BREAK

    Tidal Wave LIMIT BREAK

    PHASE SKIRMISH

    Choose one side of the map. A wave of water washes towards that side from the other, and all enemies must make BULK saves. Failure: They are pushed 6 spaces in a straight line towards the chosen side of the map, are DAZED and DISARMED until the end of their next turn, and are knocked PRONE . Success: They are pushed half as many spaces and are knocked PRONE .

    Enemies that hit a character or obstruction when pushed by this ability take 5 PHYSICAL and are SUNDERED until they clear the condition.

    Tidecallers have control over the seas, but even when far away from the ocean, their power is no less deadly.

    When there isn't water around to command, a tidecaller can converts the ambient aether in the atmosphere to water aether, drawing the moisture out of everything to form a roaring wave.

    Tidecallers use spells to move their allies and enemies around the battlefield with RISING TIDE and RIVER CURRENT , while providing healing support with spells like TIDAL HEALING . Their rank 3 WHIRLPOOL ability is incredibly strong in combat scenes that require controlling an area, like Acquisition or Control .

    RANK 1

    Rainfall

    CHANNEL

    SPELL 1 MEMORY ARCING RANGE = SCOPE, BLAST 1

    On Release: This AOE is a zone. Choose one of the following options:

    • Soothing Rain: Characters that start their turn in the zone clear all Discord and 1 Stress . This zone lasts until you use this ability again.
    • Downpour: Characters are BLINDED while in the zone. This zone lasts until the end of your next turn, but on each of your turns you can extend it to the end of your following turn by spending 1 MP as long as you aren't SILENCED or STUNNED .

    Call down a soothing rainstorm infused with healing magic, or a torrential downpour.

    This attack's AOE can point in any direction.

    On Hit: Targets are pushed to the furthest free spaces within the Line , following its direction. You can spend 1 MP to force all hit targets to make a BULK save. Failure: They fall PRONE .

    This spell forces water into a high-pressure jet strong enough to knock down a wall.

    RANK 2

    Abyssal Scepter

    RANGED WEAPON

    MAIN ARTIFACT

    VOLLEY

    AETHERIC

    RANGE 8, REACH 1 1D3+2 LUNAR

    On Hit: You can spend 1 MP to create a BURST 2 AOE around the target. All characters in the area are pulled to the closest free space adjacent to the target.

    This artifact creates crushing forces using a pearl from the abyssal depths of the sea.

    Tidal Healing CHANNEL
    SPELL 2MEMORY MANA2 RANGE = SCOPE

    On Release: One ally within RANGE regains up to 1D6+4 HP . Another ally within RANGE 5 of them regains up to half of that amount. You may continue healing new allies in this fashion, halving the amount healed each time, until there are no other allies within RANGE 5 of the last target, or the healing reaches 1 HP . Each character can only benefit from this healing 1/turn .

    This spell concentrates healing magic into a liquid essence, which can then be manipulated by tidecallers. This healing water bounces between targets, trying to spread its magic among as many vessels as possible.

    Pool water in their mouth and lungs, drowning them from the inside.

    Whirlpool

    SPELL

    2 MEMORY

    MANA 2

    RANGE = SCOPE, BLAST 2

    On Release: This AOE is a zone. When it is created, you may slide characters in the zone to any free space within the zone, after which they are IMMOBILIZED . They can clear IMMOBILIZED by succeeding on a BULK save as a minor action .

    The zone is difficult terrain . It lasts until you dismiss it as a free action or use this ability again.

    On subsequent turns, you can spend 1 MP as a minor action to slide any number of characters in the zone again.

    The best tidecallers can treat ambient aetheric energy like liquid, creating swirling vortexes from which there can be no escape.

    CHANNEL

    The earth heeds the call of the wardens, rising to restrict their foes while the wardens endure with the planet's lifeforce.

    W ardens are connected to the lifeforce of the planet, controlling the elements of earth and rock. They feel what the planet feels, and when it cries out in pain, they rise to defend it. In return, they can draw upon the strength of the planet itself to protect themselves.

    BASE ATTRIBUTES

    Wardens can connect and attune to any planet or plane to which they travel, although doing so may change how their powers look or work. Traveling to a dimension of fire, for example, a warden might find their hair turning to flame, and their powers becoming wreathed in flame.

    • What earthlike features do you have? Rocky skin, stone hair, something else?
    • What creature or spirit did you learn from?
    • How does the planet communicate with you?
    • What are the unique properties of the tree from which one of your pieces of equipment is made?

    TRAITS

    Earthen Slide

    TRAIT

    When you INTERPOSE and end your movement adjacent to the attacker, you can make them SLOWED until the end of their next turn.

    Additionally, you gain the EARTHEN SLIDE skill, which is equipped for free.

    Earthen Slide

    SKILL FOCUS 1, INNATE, UNIQUE

    Trigger: An enemy or ally starts their turn within your SCOPE .

    Effect: You slide them 1 space .

    Grasping Vines

    TRAIT

    When an enemy starts their turn adjacent to you or is moved adjacent to you by EARTHEN SLIDE , you can spend 1 FOCUS to make them SLOWED until the end of their next turn. You can't use this ability if you are DISARMED , SILENCED , or STUNNED .

    REACTION

    7: claSSeS and JoBS

    LIMIT BREAK

    Gaia's Wrath LIMIT BREAK

    FREE ACTION

    You become an avatar of nature for the rest of the scene or until you return to your usual state as a free action . You gain the following benefits:

    • You gain +1 SIZE (to a maximum of SIZE 3 ) and any adjacent characters are pushed to the nearest free space to accommodate your new SIZE .
    • You gain 2 FOCUS at the start of each of your turns.
    • When you hit a character with any attack, they are SLOWED until the end of their next turn. A character that is already SLOWED is also IMMOBILIZED until the end of their next turn.

    You connect to the aetheric streams that crisscross the Reflection - the leylines. You become an extension of the Reflection's will; an avatar of its wrath and destruction. It acts through you, giving you the power to achieve its goals. Your goals. Our goals.

    The Warden's EARTHEN SLIDE and GRASPING VINES let them bring enemies close and keep them there. From there, they can use their GREATOAK MAULER or other close range AOEs to punish clusters of enemies. The Great Weapon Master talent works great with this type of playstyle.

    RANK 1

    Lifeblood SKILL 1 MEMORY

    You gain +1 on MAGIC saves.

    Additionally, you can make a special MAGIC check to clear Discord immediately after receiving it and taking the relevant discord damage . Success: You clear all Discord .

    You still make a magic check to clear Discord at the end of your turn as normal.

    The lifeblood of the planet flows through your veins.

    Inner Reserves SKILL 2 MEMORY

    When you

    REFRESH , you gain 2 FOCUS .

    You are never down and out. As long as you still breathe, you fight. As long as you can still move, you protect. As long as you still live, there is hope.

    Vines and roots erupt from the ground and your skin, grabbing anything nearby and pulling it close.

    Weight of Earth SKILL 2 MEMORY

    When you hit a character with a reaction attack, they are IMMOBILIZED until the start of their next turn.

    'It was just a halfling wearing some sort of skull mask and holding a wooden dagger, so we didn't think anything of it. As soon as we stepped close, they flung the dagger at us, and I swear to Terram, it pinned Zelk to the wall! It went straight through his armor and shoulder! No one is that strong - it was just a wooden dagger!'

    Warlords are commanders of the battlefield. They lead their allies to victory, making them better fighters in the process.

    T acticians and leaders, warlords are the glue that holds their groups together. They feel the rhythm of battle, adjusting their plans, tactics, and people accordingly.

    BASE ATTRIBUTES

    Warlords can either be backline strategists, supporting their allies with intelligence and positioning, or frontline commanders, leading by example in the thick of battle.

    SPEED: 5 MP: 2
    • Why are people willing to follow your command?
    • When did one of your decisions save the day?
    • What tactical mistake have you promised to never let happen again?
    • Who do you wish you could learn from or serve under?

    TRAITS

    Focused Plan

    TRAIT

    1/round when you make a character MARKED , an ally of your choice can VOLLEY or perform a PHASE BRAWL action against the MARKED character as a reaction with +1 .

    Take a Breather

    TRAIT

    When you or an ally within SCOPE performs REFRESH , another character of your choice within RANGE 10 of that character gains 1D6+1 TEMP HP .

    runninG tHe Game

    LIMIT BREAK

    Follow My Lead LIMIT BREAK

    FREE ACTION

    Until the end of the scene, any time you perform your standard action , an ally of your choice can perform a standard action from the same phase as a reaction . Each ally can benefit from this effect 1/scene .

    You lead by example, your actions inspiring others to do the same. Your confidence bleeds over to your allies, creating a positive feedback loop between them and you. Your confidence inspires, their loyalty enkindles. Together, you all act as one.

    Warlords make their allies better. They can grant extra attacks with FOCUSED PLAN or have allies attack on their behalf with COMMAND . Marks are the primary way that warlords provide support or trigger their abilities, and the Spotter talent helps them apply more of them.

    RANK 1

    Command SKILL 2 MEMORY

    PHASE SKIRMISH

    An ally within SCOPE can immediately make a weapon or spell attack with +2 as a reaction . You can take 1 STRESS to remove the .

    You command someone to take an action. Those that know you and know your leadership style trust in your wisdom.

    Standard of Courage MINOR ACTION SUPPORT ITEM MAIN SUMMON

    Standard ( SIZE 1/2 , HP 5 , DODGE/A-DEF 10 , SPEED 0 )

    You plant a standard in a free adjacent space. It creates a BURST 2 zone. You and your allies in the zone gain +1 on attack rolls, checks, and saves, and when you or an ally start their turn in the zone, they gain 2 TEMP HP .

    During your turn, you can pick up and move the standard when you move, placing it in another free adjacent space.

    This Summon can only be dismissed with a minor action while adjacent to it. You can only have one standard in play at a time and it retains its current HP when dismissed. It regains all HP during Rests .

    If defeated, this support item is destroyed.

    You carry a flag as a symbol of your unit. Those that see it know that any units near it fall under your command and protection.

    RANK 2

    Frontline MELEE WEAPON

    MAIN LONGARM

    REACH 2 1D6+2 PHYSICAL

    On Crit: Y ou can teleport one willing ally within SCOPE up to 5 spaces .

    Before battle, the troops gather around for a meal. As a surprise, their commander produces a treat - a deer they had hunted earlier in the day and prepared in the style of their homeland. As everyone enjoys the meal and camaraderie, their aetheric fields become attuned to the spear lying nearby.

    The next day, in the heat of battle, the commander finds themselves separated from their troops. Facing certain doom, the commander readies their spear. In response, they feel aetheric energies beginning to rise from the spear, and then see a flash of light. The light fades, and the commander sees their troops stood before them, weapons raised and ready to fight.

    Lead from the Front

    SKILL 1 MEMORY UNIQUE

    When you FIGHT or perform a FULL ATTACK with a melee weapon, one ally of your choice within SCOPE gains 2 TEMP HP .

    You take to the battlefield, making your way to the frontlines. Your tactical prowess hadn't been questioned, but now neither will your martial prowess either.

    FIGHT

    RANK 3

    Focus Target SKILL

    3 MEMORY STRESSFUL 2, UNIQUE

    1/round when an ally within SCOPE consumes a MARK , another ally of your choice within SCOPE can make a weapon or spell attack against the target as a reaction .

    It is more efficient to focus your attacks on one target at a time instead of spreading your blows around. If you can take out an enemy, they pose no threat to you. But a wounded enemy can still fight, and can wound you in return. So, do everyone a favor, and make sure they're dead before moving onto the next.

    Rally SKILL

    2 MEMORY

    Trigger: An ally within SCOPE takes a Wound or Overstress .

    Effect: No excess damage or Stress carries over, and your ally gains +4 TEMP HP and clears any Discord and conditions.

    'Rally to me! I will be your shield; I will hold the line! Their assault ends here!'

    REACTION

    Talents are bundles of abilities you can learn that aren't tied to specific classes. Each talent has three ranks. Beacons start with three talents at rank 1 .

    AETHERBENDER

    Your magical expertise gives you insight into the manipulation of spells for different effects.

    Rank 1: Aetheric Upgrade

    You can apply the following effects to your spells. Each spell can only be affected by one at a time:

    • Far Spell: When you use a spell, you can spend 1 MP to do so with +5 RANGE .
    • Fast Spell: During your turn, you can use VOLLEY or FIGHT spells during earlier phases, but no earlier than PHASE BOLSTER . For each phase earlier than its normal phase, you spend 1 MP .
    • Quiet Spell: When you use a spell while HIDDEN , you can spend 2 MP to remain HIDDEN after the spell resolves.

    Rank 2: Advanced Aetheric Upgrade

    You add the following effects to your AETHERIC UPGRADES options:

    • Flexible Spell: When you make a spell attack, you can spend 1 MP to change the defense that it targets ( DODGE or A-DEF ).
    • Empowered Spell: When you use a spell that involves a save, you can spend 2 MP to impose +1 on any saves it causes.
    • Repeated Spell: When you make a non-AOE spell attack, you can spend 3 MP to attack two targets. They must be within RANGE 5 of each other and within your SCOPE .

    Rank 3: Aether Mixer

    You can apply two different AETHERIC UPGRADE at once, spending the MP for each effect.

    Additionally, you gain 1 MP spell attack.

    options when you crit with a

    Talents come in three ranks: rank 1 , rank 2 , and rank 3 . Ranks must be taken in order; you need rank 1 in a talent to take rank 2, and you need rank 2 to take rank 3. When you level up, you can increase the rank of an existing talent or gain a new one at rank 1.

    Once you have a talent, its effects are always available to you.

    ARCHMAGE

    Archmages stand at the pinnacle of aetheric research. They manipulate magic in ways that others can only dream of.

    Rank 1: Spell Sculptor

    When you use a spell or artifact weapon with an AOE, you can spend 1 MP to allow one character in the AOE to ignore the effect.

    Rank 2: Arcane Turret

    You gain the following benefits:

    • When you are channeling, you gain +2 ARMOR , to a maximum of 4 .
    • Taking Stress doesn't trigger concentration saves .

    Rank 3: Focused Caster

    The following option is added to your Reroll Table: Mana Effort: Spend 1 MP .

    ARMORED DEFENDER

    Armor keeps you alive. The stronger and more reliable your armor is, the longer you stay alive.

    Rank 1: Reinforced Plating

    After you DEFEND , you can spend FOCUS , temporarily gaining +1 ARMOR per FOCUS spent, to a maximum of 6 ARMOR . This lasts until the start of your next turn or until you next take Physical, Astral, Lunar, or Force.

    Rank 2: Adamantine Armor

    Your Armor support items become Unbreakable .

    Rank 3: Battle Hardened

    When you reduce a source of damage to 0, you negate all other effects the attack or ability would have on you, including on-hit effects.

    ARTIFICER

    You have been building your own custom weapon and while it's not what most would consider 'stable' , it's close enough for field testing.

    Rank 1: Experimental Weapon

    When you gain this talent or during a Long Rest , you create an EXPERIMENTAL WEAPON , which is equipped for free. You can only have one EXPERIMENTAL WEAPON at a time.

    Experimental Weapon 3 VOLLEY (RANGED) / 5 FIGHT (MELEE)

    CUSTOM WEAPON MAIN CUSTOM UNIQUE, RELOADING RANGE X 1D6+2 DAMAGE

    You have built this weapon yourself. You can choose some of its features when you equip it, and change them during Long Rests.

    Choose a damage type (Physical, Astral, Lunar, or Force) and one of the following profiles:

    • Melee Weapon: BLADE , CLUB , LONGARM , or MAGITECH REACH 1
    • Ranged Weapon: ARTIFACT , BOW , or MAGITECH RANGE 10

    This weapon doesn't need to be reloaded after every use. Instead, roll a d6 Malfunction Die after each use. On a 5-6 , the weapon must be reloaded.

    Rank 2: Improvements

    Your Experimental Weapon only malfunctions on a result of 6 on the Malfunction Die. Additionally, you may choose two of the following improvements for your weapon each time you equip it or during Long Rests.

    • +Tag (Can be Chosen Twice): Y our EXPERIMENTAL WEAPON gains one of the following: Accurate , Aetheric , Arcing , Push 1 , Reliable 2 , or Thrown 5 .
    • +AOE: When you attack with your EXPERIMENTAL WEAPON , you can spend 1 MP to attack with either of the following AOEs instead of its normal RANGE .
    • Ranged Weapon: LINE 8 , or BLAST 1 within weapon's RANGE .
    • Melee Weapon: BURST 1 or CLOSE BLAST 1

    .

    Rank 3: Perfection

    Your EXPERIMENTAL WEAPON no longer malfunctions and loses the Reloading tag. Additionally, when you equip your EXPERIMENTAL WEAPON or during a Long Rest , you may choose one of the following improvements for your weapon:

    • Clunky: Your weapon's damage becomes 2d6+3 but it gains Reloading .
    • Increased Range: Y our weapon gains +1 REACH if melee or +5 RANGE if ranged.
    • Increased Damage: Your weapon's damage becomes 1d6+4 .
    • Punch Through: Your weapon gains Piercing .

    ARTILLERIST

    The ability to shoot your enemy before they can hit you is a critical advantage. Artillerists can squeeze out every inch of range from their weapons.

    Rank 1: Siege Mode

    You may use your standard movement to enter or exit Siege Mode instead of moving. While in Siege Mode, you are always IMMOBILIZED and your ranged weapon attacks gain +3 RANGE and Arcing .

    Rank 2: Siege Ammo

    1/round when you make a ranged weapon attack in Siege Mode, you can spend 1 MP to apply one of the following effects in a BURST 1 AOE around one of the targets. The primary target is included in the area.

    • Aethermarker Round: Characters in the AOE must make a MAGIC save. Failure: They are MARKED .
    • Concussion Round: Characters in the AOE must make a MIND save. Failure: They are DAZED until the end of their next turn.
    • Grounding Round: Characters in the AOE must make a BULK save. Failure: They are knocked PRONE .
    • Shrapnel Round: Characters in the AOE must make an AGILITY save. Failure: They take 2 PIERCING PHYSICAL .

    Rank 3: Aetheric Bombard

    Siege Mode has the following effects:

    • You gain +3 SCOPE .
    • Your spells gain Arcing .
    • You have immunity to all forced movement and benefit from soft cover against attacks further than RANGE 8 .

    BRAWLER

    The unarmed gladiator leagues of Bastion are among its most popular fighting competitions. The leagues draw in competitors from dozens of different fighting styles, ensuring the bouts are always dynamic and fun. Gladiators in the league assume over-the-top personas and quickly amass dedicated fans.

    Rank 1: Quick Hands

    You can take 1 STRESS to GRAPPLE or SHOVE as a minor action .

    Additionally, you gain +1 on attacks against targets GRAPPLED by you.

    Rank 2: Fisticuffs

    Your improvised weapon attacks deal 1D6 PHYSICAL , and gain REACH 1 , which allows them to be used with OPPORTUNITY ATTACKS .

    Additionally, when you crit with an improvised weapon attack, choose one:

    • The target is DAZED until the end of their next turn.
    • You automatically succeed on a SHOVE against the target.

    Rank 3: Submission

    You gain the SUBMISSION action.

    Submission TALENT

    CHANNEL

    On Channel: A character GRAPPLED by you becomes DAZED until after you release this ability, and receives +1 on checks to break the grapple. This effect ends and the ability is cancelled if the target ceases to be GRAPPLED by you.

    On Release: The target takes 2D6+3 PHYSICAL and must succeed on a BULK save or be DISARMED and SILENCED until the end of their next turn.

    BREAKER

    Clubs are highly effective weapons against armor. Worst-case scenario, their powerful blows dent and deform armor, restricting foes' movements. Best-case scenario, they crush enemies inside their armor.

    Rank 1: Dazing Blows

    1/round when you hit a character with a club, they must make a BULK save. Failure: They are DAZED until the end of their next turn.

    Rank 2: Sunder Armor

    When you crit with a club, the target is SUNDERED until the end of their next turn and they receive -1 ARMOR (to a minimum of 0) for the rest of the scene.

    Rank 3: Ring the Bell

    You gain the RING THE BELL action.

    Ring the Bell TALENT

    CHANNEL

    On Release: Y ou make a melee attack with any club, even a Slow one:

    • On Hit: The weapon hits as normal, and the target is STUNNED until the end of their next turn.
    • On Miss: The weapon still hits as normal, but doesn't trigger any on-hit effects (e.g., Push , Pull , etc).

    COMMANDER

    The difference between a good commander and a bad one is trust. A bad commander issues orders and expects them to be followed because of their rank. A good commander knows their troops and trusts them to follow orders, and the team trusts the commander to keep them alive.

    Rank 1: Commander's Mark

    When you make a character MARKED , you can make it a special Commander's Mark . It functions as a normal MARK , but when an ally consumes it, you roll a 1d6: on a 5+, the target stays MARKED with the Commander's Mark. You can only have one Commander's Mark at a time; placing a new one turns the old one into a normal MARK .

    Rank 2: Planning

    When an ally uses the Strain option from the Reroll Table on an attack against a character with your COMMANDER'S MARK , the Stress cost is reduced by 1. Additionally, your Commander's Marks remain on a result of 4+ instead of a 5+.

    Rank 3: Order

    1/round when you make a character MARKED , you can announce an action that you want any ally to take against that target. The first ally that takes that action against the target while they are MARKED gains TEMP HP equal to your GRIT+2 .

    COPYCAT

    Copycats possess the rare ability to mimic the abilities of others. Those in possession of metamorphic ore can even copy the equipment of their enemies.

    Rank 1: Scan

    You can SEARCH as a minor action .

    Rank 2: Copy

    When you SEARCH an enemy to learn about their ability scores, attributes, and abilities, you can spend 1 MP to gain access to one of those pieces of equipment or techniques until the end of the scene. You can only copy one thing at a time.

    Rank 3: Imitate

    Copy can now be used to gain access to enemy traits, and you can copy up to two things at once.

    Additionally, when an enemy uses a piece of equipment, technique, or trait within your line of sight, you can spend 1 MP to gain access to it until the end of the scene.

    The COPYCAT talent is intended for fun, casual play only. It's not intended to be balanced. Check with your GM to see if they want this talent to be used.

    DEADEYE

    Everyone knows that you're better off hitting a specific body part than lashing out blindly, but it's incredibly difficult to put that knowledge into practice during a real fight. Those with the speed, skill, and accuracy to reliably do so can end fights quickly.

    Rank 1: Precision

    Minor Action: You take 1 STRESS to gain +1 on your next attack roll this turn. On a crit, it gains the Piercing tag.

    Rank 2: Body Parts

    1/round when you crit on an attack roll, you can choose to deal half damage and apply one of the following additional effects:

    • Foot: The target is IMMOBILIZED until the end of their next turn.
    • Head: The target is DAZED until the end of their next turn.
    • Leg: The target is SLOWED until the end of their next turn.

    Rank 3: Pinpoint Lethality

    The following are added to the list of BODY PARTS options:

    • Arm: The target is DISARMED until the end of their next turn.
    • Throat: The target is SILENCED until the end of their next turn.
    • Eye: The target is BLINDED until the end of their next turn.

    ENCHANTER

    Infusing items with aetheric energy allows you to grant them unique traits. Enchanted weapons are always better than their mundane counterparts.

    Rank 1: Apprentice Enchanter

    Each quest, you can equip one of the following support items KEEN , VARIABLE , or ASPECTED - for free.

    Keen SUPPORT ITEM ENCHANTMENT

    You may use one of the following Enchantments at a time:

    • Any Weapon, Skill Attack, or Spell Attack that deals damage: On a crit with this ability, you deal +1d3 bonus damage .
    • Any Weapon, Skill Attack, or Spell Attack that deals Stress: On a crit with this ability, you deal +2 Stress .
    • Any Weapon, Skill Attack, or Spell Attack that deals Discord: On a crit with this ability, you deal +1 Discord .

    Variable

    SUPPORT ITEM ENCHANTMENT

    You may use the following Enchantment :

    • Any Equipment or Technique: When you apply this Enchantment , REFRESH, or Rest , you can change its damage type from Physical, Astral, Lunar, or Force to another one of these damage types.

    Aspected SUPPORT ITEM ENCHANTMENT

    You may use one of the following Enchantments at a time:

    • Any Armor: You gain +1 to checks and saves with one ability score BULK , AGILITY , MIND , or MAGIC -chosen when you apply this Enchantment.
    • Any Equipment or Technique: When you attack with this ability, you can spend 1 MP to give it the Aetheric tag, or to remove it. This change lasts for the rest of the scene or until you use this ability again.

    Rank 2: Portfolio of Formulas

    You can apply one of your Enchantments to two different things.

    Additionally, the following support items ADAMANT , SPEED , and VORPAL - are added to the list of available support items from APPRENTICE ENCHANTER .

    Adamant

    SUPPORT ITEM ENCHANTMENT

    You may use one of the following Enchantments at a time:

    • Any Armor: As a minor action while wearing this armor, you can gain 1 FOCUS .
    • Any Weapon or Spell Attack: On a crit with this ability, you gain 1 FOCUS .

    SUPPORT ITEM ENCHANTMENT

    Speed

    You may use one of the following Enchantments at a time:

    • Any Non-Slow Weapon: You can VOLLEY or FIGHT (as relevant) with this weapon during PHASE BOLSTER .
    • Any Armor: While wearing this armor, you can take PHASE REPOSITION actions during PHASE BOLSTER .

    Vorpal SUPPORT ITEM ENCHANTMENT

    You may use the following Enchantment :

    • Any Melee Weapon: 1/round when you roll the highest possible value on a damage die as part of a melee attack with this weapon, roll that die again and add that result to the total damage. This effect can trigger multiple times.

    Only the damage from the weapon triggers this effect, not any bonus damage or extra sources of damage. On a crit, resolve which damage dice are being used before doing any of the rerolls.

    Rank 3: Master Enchanter

    You may have one ability at a time with two Enchantments applied, instead of just one. Additionally, you can equip a single Enchantment support item for free, which can be an additional one from this talent.

    GREAT WEAPON MASTER

    Heavy weapons have the advantage of great size, allowing powerful swings that create space between the wielder and their enemies.

    Rank 1: Cleave

    ent

    1/round after you hit and deal damage to a character with a HEAVY melee weapon attack, you can take 1 STRESS to Cleave . Choose a different character within the weapon's REACH and your line of sight, even a HIDDEN one. That character takes damage equal to half the total damage dealt to the original target. The Cleave target can't have been a target of the original attack.

    Rank 2: Carry Through

    When you roll damage from a HEAVY melee weapon, you can choose to treat any 1s as 2s.

    Additionally, when you use Cleave , you can choose to gain TEMP HP equal to the amount of damage you would deal to the second target instead of dealing that damage. You lose that amount of TEMP HP at the start of your next turn. If the first attack was a crit, you can both deal damage and gain TEMP HP .

    Rank 3: Wide Cleave

    When you roll damage from a HEAVY melee weapon, you can choose to treat any rolled 1s or 2s as 3s. If you defeat an enemy with damage from Cleave , you can trigger Cleave again that turn, bypassing the 1/ round limitation. This effect can trigger multiple times.

    GUN KATA

    In a prolonged firefight, it's just as important to avoid getting shot as it is to accurately hit your enemies. This fighting style uses movements meant to avoid the most commonly attacked areas.

    Rank 1: CQC

    Your ranged weapons with REACH don't receive from being ENGAGED if your target is within their REACH .

    Rank 2: Bullet Time

    Your LIGHT ranged weapons that don't have REACH gain REACH 1 . Additionally, 1/turn when you crit with a ranged attack against a target within that weapon's REACH , you gain 1 FOCUS .

    Rank 3: Death-Blossom

    You have a d6 Gun Kata Die that starts at 1. Each time you make a reaction attack, increase the value of the Gun Kata Die by +1, to a maximum of 6. When the die reaches 6, you can reset it to 1 as a free action during your turn to deal 6 PHYSICAL split however you like among any enemies of your choice within RANGE 3 .

    1/turn you can spend

    1

    FOCUS

    as a free action to increase the value of your Gun Kata Die by +1.

    Your Gun Kata Die keeps its value between scenes, but resets to 1 during Long Rests .

    HOSPITALLER

    The battlefield is no place for proper medicine and care, but in a pinch, the presence of a hospitaller can mean the difference between life and death.

    Rank 1: Reserves

    When you REFRESH , you can pick two different options from the second list instead of one.

    Rank 2: Help

    When you REFRESH , an adjacent ally gains TEMP HP equal to your GRIT+3 .

    Rank 3: Medic

    When you REFRESH , you can spend a RECOVERY for an adjacent ally to also gain the benefits of whatever options you selected.

    J UGGERNAUT

    'Never stop moving. If something stands in your way, run them over. You are unstoppable.' - Captain Inyanafretziel, retired beacon, training a new generation of linebreakers

    Rank 1: Leverage

    You are considered to have +1 SIZE for SHOVE and being smaller doesn't impose . Additionally, when you successfully SHOVE , you can choose to push the target up to 3 spaces instead of 1.

    Rank 2: Locomotion

    1/round when you push a character into another character or object, the pushed character takes 1D6 PHYSICAL . If you push them into another character, both must also make an AGILITY save against your SAVE TARGET . Failure: They fall PRONE .

    Rank 3: Runaway Train

    You gain the RUNAWAY TRAIN action.

    Runaway Train TALENT

    RUSH

    You move up to your SPEED in a straight line. While doing this, you ignore Engagement and difficult terrain , and you can move through other characters' spaces.

    Deal 10 PIERCING PHYSICAL your SIZE (minimum 10) to any objects in your path. If you destroy an object that would be an obstruction, you continue moving.

    If you move through a character, they must succeed on an AGILITY save or be automatically affected by a SHOVE from you, and be pushed out of your path.

    KNIFE JUGGLER

    With a quick flick of the wrist, the knife in your hand disappears, already embedded in your target.

    Rank 1: Thrower

    Your LIGHT melee weapons gain Thrown 3 , and your MAIN melee weapons gain Thrown 1 .

    Additionally, at the end of your turn all weapons you threw that turn return to you.

    Rank 2: Perfectly Balanced

    All of your Thrown weapons gain +2 Thrown (e.g., Thrown 3 becomes Thrown 5 ). Additionally, you can make thrown attacks with PHASE

    LIGHT Thrown weapons using FIGHT during SKIRMISH instead of during PHASE BRAWL .

    Rank 3: Flick

    Minor Action (1/round): You can make a thrown attack with a LIGHT Thrown weapon. This attack can't deal bonus damage and doesn't trigger linked attacks.

    KNIGHT

    'To Aliarra Landsritter, we award you the title of Knight Champion for your feats of courage, bravery, and strength in the face of overwhelming opposition.' The honorary title of knight is awarded to individuals for exemplary service to a nation. While working towards earning that title, many warriors focus on selfless acts of protection on the battlefield.

    Rank 1: Phalanx

    When you DEFEND , you can choose one of the following effects instead of gaining FOCUS normally:

    • Roll 1d3 for each ally within RANGE 3 and take the highest result, gaining FOCUS equal to the result plus your ARMOR .
    • You gain FOCUS equal to 1d3 plus the number of allies within RANGE 3 .

    Rank 2: Perfect Parry

    When you INTERPOSE , you can also COUNTERATTACK during the same turn.

    Rank 3: Hunker Down

    Instead of using your standard movement , you can perform a second minor action , but it must be a different minor action .

    MAGI-TECHNICIAN

    Magitech weapons utilize technology to mimic the effects of traditional spells, letting anyone harness the destructive power of magic. Different civilizations have created their own power sources for magitech, from electrical currents through to soul gems.

    Rank 1: Growing Power

    Whenever you crit with a magitech weapon, you get a d6 Power Die . Y ou can have up to 6 Power Dice, which last until the end of a quest or until spent.

    After rolling an attack or damage roll with a magitech weapon, you can roll any number of Power Dice, expending them in the process. The highest number rolled is added to the result of the attack roll or to the damage roll as bonus damage.

    Rank 2: Infused Ammo

    When you attack with a magitech weapon, you can spend up to 6 MP to increase the attack's existing Physical, Force, Astral, or Lunar by +1 per MP spent. The increased damage applies to every target hit by the attack.

    Rank 3: Unstable Power Core

    1/round when you crit with a magitech weapon, you can apply one of the following effects:

    • Magnetic: The target is DISARMED until the end of their next turn.
    • Shielded: You gain 2 FOCUS .
    • Shock: The target is DAZED and SLOWED until the end of their next turn.
    • Soul Gem: The target is WEAKENED until the end of their next turn and MARKED .
    • Volatile: The target is SUNDERED until the end of their next turn and knocked PRONE .

    SAVAGE FIGHTER

    In the face of unbridled savagery, most training and discipline finds itself lacking.

    Rank 1: Never Down

    You receive the following benefits:

    • While BLOODIED , you gain +1 on attacks.
    • While BREAKING , you gain 1 FOCUS at the start of each of your turns.

    Rank 2: Vicious

    You can use the Reroll Table to reroll damage rolls.

    Rank 3: Wild Attacker

    You can trigger the Overextend option from the Reroll Table multiple times per turn, but only for a different enemy each time.

    SHADOW

    'Shadows cloak and conceal. Keep us safe. Keep us hidden. Stay in the shadows. The light reveals to us our deaths.'

    • Myphos

    Rank 1: Blend

    While INVISIBLE or benefiting from cover against all enemies that have line of sight to you, you can take 2 STRESS to HIDE as a minor action .

    Rank 2: Hunt

    You gain +1 on your first attack roll while HIDDEN in a given turn.

    Additionally, whenever you defeat an enemy, roll a d6 Hunt Die . On a 6+, you can choose to become HIDDEN .

    Rank 3: Infiltration

    You can deploy in any free space within RANGE 5 of an edge of the map.

    Additionally, when you roll your Hunt Die , you become HIDDEN on a 5+; if you were already HIDDEN when you defeated the enemy, you become HIDDEN on a 4+.

    SLASHER

    Most cultures have their own unique version of the sword. Katanas, gladii, scimitars, and khopeshes are all considered swords. A skilled wielder of blades can adapt to just about any situation.

    Rank 1: Feint

    1/round when you hit with a blade weapon attack, you can take 1 STRESS to MARK the target.

    Rank 2: Hamstring

    1/round when you crit with a blade weapon attack, the target is SLOWED until the end of their next turn.

    Rank 3: Weeping Cuts

    1/round when you hit with a blade weapon attack, you can choose to treat half of the attack's damage as normal, and half of the attack's damage as Discord instead of its normal damage type. For example, if a blade attack deals 10 PHYSICAL , you can choose to have it deal 5 PHYSICAL + 5 DISCORD instead.

    SNIPER

    Snipers are deadly marksmen. They live by the motto, 'one shot, one kill' , no matter how long it takes.

    Rank 1: Steady Shot

    At the start of your turn, you can choose to start Aiming . You become IMMOBILIZED until the start of your next turn and gain +1 on all ranged attacks while IMMOBILIZED in this way.

    Rank 2: Zero In

    When you miss with a ranged attack, you gain +1 on all ranged attacks until you hit with one. This effect stacks.

    Rank 3: Pinpoint Shot

    1/round when you crit with a ranged attack while IMMOBILIZED , you deal +1d6 bonus damage .

    SOLDIER

    A versatile soldier must be consistent and reliable in any situation.

    Rank 1: Weapon Focus

    The first time each turn you perform a melee attack with a MAIN weapon, that attack gains +1 .

    Rank 2: Stances

    Minor Action: You take 1 STRESS and enter one of the following stances Wolf Stance , Snake Stance , or Eagle Stance . Y ou remain in this stance for the rest of the scene or until you perform this minor action again. You may enter each stance 1/scene.

    When you enter a stance, you gain a d6 Stance Die that starts at 6. After attacking with a MAIN melee weapon, reduce the value of your Stance Die by -2. If it reaches 0, you drop the stance.

    • Wolf Stance: Your MAIN melee weapon attacks gain Reliable X , where X is the value of your Stance Die. The Reliable damage can't exceed the weapon's maximum damage.
    • Snake Stance: The ARMOR of your targets can't reduce the damage of your MAIN melee weapon attacks below the value of your Stance Die.
    • Eagle Stance: Before rolling an attack with a MAIN melee weapon, you can do either of the following:
    • Treat one die as if it had rolled the value of your Stance Die.
    • Treat one die as if it had rolled 7 minus the value of your Stance Die. For example, if your Stance Die is 4, you could treat the result of a die as 3 (7 - 4 = 3).

    Rank 3: Practiced

    Instead of reducing your Stance Die by -2 after attacking with a MAIN melee weapon, you only reduce it by -1.

    Additionally, the following option is added to your

    Reroll Table :

    • Flowing Stance: Reduce your Stance Die by -2.

    SPEEDSTER

    Go fast. Embrace speed. Put your problems behind you, and never stop running, or they'll catch you.

    Rank 1: Sprint

    Minor Action: You take 2 STRESS and move up to half your SPEED .

    Rank 2: Supersonic

    When you RUSH or use Sprint , you gain 1 Sonido , up to a maximum of 6. As your standard movement , you can spend any number of Sonidos to teleport a number of spaces equal to the Sonidos spent and gain soft cover until the start of your next turn. You can't use this ability if you are SLOWED .

    Sonidos last between scenes, but reset to 0 during each Long Rest .

    Rank 3: Tactical Repositioning

    When you RUSH , you can use both options instead of choosing one.

    SPELLBLADE

    Spellblades weave magic into their weapons, casting spells between weapon strikes.

    Rank 1: Spellweaver

    1/turn after hitting the same target with both a weapon and spell attack in the same turn, you gain 1 Weave , to a maximum of 3. Weave lasts until you Rest. to per-

    During your turn, you can spend 3 Weave form the following Spellstrike minor action.

    Spellstrike TALENT

    You attack with either:

    • a LIGHT or MAIN weapon
    • a VOLLEY or FIGHT spell.

    This attack doesn't deal bonus damage or trigger linked attacks.

    Rank 2: Spellblade Training

    You gain the following benefits:

    • When you hit with a weapon attack, you gain +1 on your next spell attack against the same target.
    • When you hit with a spell attack, you gain +1 on your next weapon attack against the same target.

    You can't gain more than +1 this way at a time.

    Rank 3: Aetherblade

    You can link a weapon and a spell together as if they were a linked pair . When you would select equipment, choose an unlinked LIGHT or MAIN weapon and a VOLLEY or FIGHT spell attack. You can spend 1 MP to make a linked attack with them as though they were a linked pair. Unlike linked weapons, if either the weapon or spell is destroyed, it does not destroy the linked weapon or spell. This effect lasts until you select a new linked pair with this talent.

    MINOR ACTION

    SUMMONER

    Pull creatures from other Reflections and dimensions, or coalesce aether into solid forms. You have a close connection to the creatures you call forth that allows them to perform beyond expectations.

    Rank 1: Strong Summons

    Your Summons gain +5 MAXIMUM HP .

    • Minor Action: One of your Summons within SCOPE moves up to 4 spaces.

    Rank 2: Defender Summons

    Your Summons may spend your FOCUS , and they can INTERPOSE . Additionally, you gain 1 FOCUS if you end your turn within RANGE 5 of one of your Summons .

    Rank 3: Tend to the Swarm

    Minor Action ( 1 MP ) : You restore 4 HP to one of your Summons within SCOPE .

    SUN-BLOTTER

    'It rained for three days, an endless barrage of death. Our soldiers drowned in the deluge, and we were broken.' - An Ardentine soldier, recounting the battle of Idol

    Rank 1: Overdraw

    Minor Action (Stressful 1): Your next bow attack gains +5 RANGE . This effect can stack multiple times, and ends when you attack with a bow.

    Rank 2: Powershot

    When you attack with a bow while benefiting from Overdraw , you can take 1 STRESS to choose one of the following:

    • Ballista: Your attack becomes a LINE X attack, where X equals the weapon's RANGE . This replaces the attack's RANGE , and the attack can't benefit from Arcing .
    • Catapult: On a hit, the target must make a BULK save. Failure: They are automatically affected by a SHOVE from you.
    • Rain of Arrows: All enemies within a BURST 1 AOE around the target are MARKED .

    Rank 3: High Shot

    You punctuate your shots with arrows launched high into the air. Whenever you attack with a bow, you can either gain +1 Arrow or consume all Arrows . Y ou can only gain 1 Arrow per attack (not attack roll). When you consume all your Arrows, you roll an extra d20 for each Arrow and take the highest result as the attack roll. Arrows last until the end of the scene.

    THAUMATURGE

    Artifacts are the weapons of spellcasters. Tomes filled with arcane rituals, dueling wands, and powerful staves can amplify their wielders' mana.

    Rank 1: Magical Charges

    When you crit with an ARTIFACT , you regain 1 MP .

    Rank 2: Overcharge

    You gain the OVERCHARGE action.

    Overcharge

    TALENT

    On Release: Y ou auto-hit with an artifact weapon, even a Slow one.

    Rank 3: Empowerment

    1/round when you hit a target with an ARTIFACT , you can spend 1 MP to apply one of the following effects:

    • Cold: The target is SLOWED until the end of their next turn.
    • Dark: The target must make a MAGIC save. Failure: They are BLINDED until the end of their next turn.
    • Fire: The target takes 1 PIERCING ASTRAL for every space they move during their next turn.
    • Force: The attack gains Push 1 and the target is DAZED until the end of their next turn.
    • Light: The target is MARKED .
    • Lightning: The target can't use any reactions until the end of their next turn.
    • Toxic: The target takes 1 DISCORD .

    CHANNEL

    TRACEUR

    Parkour is a movement style focused on travelling between two points in the fastest, most efficient way. Practitioners can jump, roll, or climb over any obstacle.

    Rank 1: Limber

    You receive the following benefits:

    • You gain +1 on AGILITY checks and saves
    • You move normally in difficult terrain .
    • Climbing costs half as much movement as normal.
    • Standing from PRONE costs half your movement, instead of all of your movement.

    Rank 2: Rollout

    You receive the following benefits:

    • At the start of your turn, you can shift 1 .
    • You can move through spaces occupied by enemies.
    • When you become ENGAGED , you can take 1 STRESS to not lose your unused movement.
    • When you are subjected to forced movement from another character, you can slide yourself 1 space. You can't slide into a space the forced movement moved you out of.

    Rank 3: Free Movement

    When you move adjacent to an object (including terrain) of equal or greater SIZE , you can take 1 STRESS to move up to 2 spaces as a free action . Y ou can repeat this multiple times in a turn, taking 1 STRESS each time, but not from the same object twice in a row.

    TREASURE HUNTER

    Delving into caves and abandoned ruins is dangerous, but it can lead to great treasures and riches.

    Rank 1: Lucky Haul

    When you take this rank, the GM generates a loot crate for you (p. 257). You keep the loot even if you cease to have this talent, but you don't get additional loot crates if you later take this talent again.

    Rank 2: Gambler

    When you get loot crates, you can reroll either the Slot 1 or Slot 2 option once.

    Additionally, you automatically succeed at opening locks .

    Rank 3: Deep Pockets

    You gain an additional LIGHT support slot.

    WARCASTER

    Using magic on the battlefield is nothing like learning it academically. Battlemages sacrifice flexibility for power and speed. Warcasters must learn how to hold their focus no matter what is happening around or to them. Pain is a distraction that leads to death.

    Rank 1: Maintain

    You gain +1 on concentration saves . doesn't give your

    Additionally, being ENGAGED ranged spell attacks +1 .

    Rank 2: Spellfighter

    Your VOLLEY and FIGHT spell attacks that don't have REACH gain REACH 1 . You can OPPORTUNITY ATTACK with these spells.

    Rank 3: Unflinching

    While channeling, you gain resistance to Physical, Astral, Lunar, and Force .

    9: BASIC EQUIPMENT AND TECHNIQUES

    Beacons have access to an array of basic equipment and techniques. These abilities are always available to beacons, either because they're easy to find, learn, or craft, or because they're cheap.

    BASIC MELEE WEAPONS

    NAME ACTION SIZE/TYPE TAGS RANGE DAMAGE
    AETHERBREAKER FIGHT MAINCLUB INACCURATE REACH1 2D6+1 FORCE
    BLOODPIKE FIGHT HEAVYLONGARM - REACH2 2D6+1LUNAR
    HAMMER FIGHT LIGHTCLUB THROWN5 REACH1 1D3+1 PHYSICAL

    MOONKNIFE FIGHT LIGHTBLADE ACCURATE,THROWN3 REACH1 1D3LUNAR
    PHOTONAXE FIGHT HEAVYBLADE RELIABLE 4 REACH1 1D6+7ASTRAL
    RAPIER FIGHT LIGHTBLADE PIERCING REACH1 2PHYSICAL
    RUNESPEAR FIGHT MAINLONGARM THROWN3 REACH2 1D6+1 FORCE
    SWORD FIGHT MAINBLADE RELIABLE2 REACH1 1D6+1 PHYSICAL

    BASIC RANGED WEAPONS

    NAME ACTION SIZE/TYPE TAGS RANGE DAMAGE
    CROSSBOW VOLLEY HEAVYBOW PIERCING,RELOAD- ING RANGE10 2D6+3PHYS- ICAL
    CRYSTAL STAFF VOLLEY HEAVY ARTIFACT AETHERIC,MANA2 RANGE10,BLAST 2 2D6LUNAR
    FORBIDDENTOME VOLLEY MAINARTIFACT AETHERIC,ARCING, MANA1 RANGE15,BLAST1 1D3+1LUNAR

    Whenever you prepare for a quest, you can always choose equipment and techniques from those listed in this section. Additionally, if an ability isn't Unique , you can equip multiple copies of each, as long as you have the slots or MEMORY to equip them.

    NAME ACTION SIZE/TYPE TAGS RANGE DAMAGE
    LUNAR CANNON FULL ATTACK HEAVYMAGITECH RELIABLE 4, RELOADING,SLOW LINE 15 3D6+3LUNAR
    SHARDGUN PISTOL VOLLEY LIGHTMAGITECH RELIABLE 1 RANGE5,REACH3 1D3FORCE
    SHARDGUNRIFLE VOLLEY MAINMAGITECH RELIABLE2 RANGE10 1D6+1FORCE
    SHARDSHREDDER VOLLEY MAINMAGITECH - RANGE5,REACH3 2D3FORCE
    SHORTBOW VOLLEY MAINBOW ARCING RANGE10 1D6PHYSICAL
    STARWAND VOLLEY LIGHTARTIFACT ACCURATE,AETHERIC RANGE5 1D3ASTRAL
    STORMBOW VOLLEY HEAVYBOW ARCING,PUSH1 RANGE15 2D6ASTRAL

    BASIC SUPPORT ITEMS

    Aquatic Gear

    SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT

    You move normally in liquid-based difficult terrain, and have an Aquatic Adaptation .

    Arcana Crystal SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT CONSUMABLE 3

    When you use a spell, you can expend a charge for one of the following effects:

    • Potent: If it forces saves, it gains +2 SAVE TARGET .
    • Seeking: If it's a spell attack, you gain +1 for the attack.

    Armor, Heavy SUPPORT ITEM HEAVY ARMOR

    • +3 ARMOR , -1 SPEED , and -1 DODGE .

    Armor, Light

    SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT ARMOR

    • +1 ARMOR .

    Armor, Medium SUPPORT ITEM MAIN ARMOR

    • +2 ARMOR and -1 DODGE .

    Battering Ram

    SUPPORT ITEM HEAVY

    You receive the following benefits:

    • Whenever you push or slide another character, you can move them +2 spaces .
    • You gain +2 SAVE TARGET .

    Minor Action: You push an adjacent character 1 space or deal 10 PIERCING PHYSICAL to an adjacent piece of cover.

    Caltrops

    MINOR ACTION

    SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT CONSUMABLE 3, THROWN 5, TRAP

    You can expend a charge for one of the following effects:

    • Nails (Thrown 5): On Hit: The target takes 1 PIERCING PHYSICAL for every space they move during their next turn.
    • Spikes (Trap): When triggered, this Trap creates a BLAST 1 zone centered on itself that lasts until the end of this phase in the next round. Characters that start their turn in the zone or enter it for the first time in a turn take 1D6 PIERCING PHYSICAL .

    Climbing Gear

    SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT

    Climbing costs half as much movement as normal. When you climb , you can bring a willing adjacent ally with you as long as there is enough space for both of you to stand in separate spaces.

    Companion MINOR ACTION SUPPORT ITEM MAIN SUMMON RANGE = SCOPE

    Companion ( SIZE 1/2 , HP 5 , DODGE/A-DEF 10 , SPEED 0 )

    You summon or dismiss your companion , which can be a beast, friend, or anything else willing to aid you in combat. 1/turn when you attack a character adjacent to your companion, the companion deals 3 PHYSICAL to them.

    As a reaction after a character adjacent to your companion moves, your companion can shift 5 . They must end this movement as close to the triggering character as possible.

    You can only have one companion in play at a time and they retain their current HP when dismissed. They regain all HP during Rests . If they are defeated, this item is destroyed.

    Explosive Materials MINOR ACTION SUPPORT ITEM MAIN CONSUMABLE 3, THROWN 5, TRAP

    When you equip this item, choose either Physical, Astral, Lunar, or Force. This determines the damage it deals. You can expend a charge for one of the following effects:

    • Explosive Bomb (Thrown 5): Center a BLAST 1 AOE on the target space. All characters in the AOE must make an AGILITY save. Failure: They take 1D6 DAMAGE . Success: They take half damage.
    • Explosive Trap (Trap): When triggered, this Trap creates a BURST 1 AOE. All characters in the area take 6 DAMAGE .

    Healing Potion MINOR ACTION SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT CONSUMABLE 2

    You can expend a charge and a RECOVERY to regain all HP .

    Lore Book MINOR ACTION SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT MANA 1

    Choose a character in the scene. You can SEARCH them, but only to learn their ability scores, attributes, and abilities.

    Mana Potion MINOR ACTION SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT CONSUMABLE 2

    You can expend a charge to regain all MP .

    Poison SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT CONSUMABLE 2

    You can expend a charge when you hit with a weapon. The target must make a BULK save. Failure: They take 2 STRESS are DAZED until the end of their next turn, and become MARKED .

    Resistance Enchantment SUPPORT ITEM MAIN ENCHANTMENT

    You may use one of the following Enchantments at a time:

    • Any Armor: While this Armor is equipped, you gain resistance to Physical, Astral, Lunar, or Force , chosen when you apply this Enchantment .
    • Any Weapon, Skill Attack, or Spell Attack: This weapon or technique ignores one type of resistance - Physical, Astral, Lunar, or Force - chosen when you apply this Enchantment .

    Resistance Potion MINOR ACTION SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT CONSUMABLE 2

    You can expend a charge to gain resistance to Physical, Astral, Lunar, and Force until the end of your next turn.

    Shield SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT

    You gain the SHIELD BLOCK reaction. If you meet the trigger condition of SHIELD BLOCK while using INTERPOSE , you can automatically use its effect as part of that INTERPOSE reaction.

    Shield Block

    REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Trigger: You would take Physical, Astral, Lunar, or Force .

    Effect: You take 2 STRESS and gain resistance to that damage .

    Shield, Tower SUPPORT ITEM MAIN

    Allies gain the benefits of cover from you as if you were a piece of hard cover .

    You gain the SHIELD BLOCK reaction. If you meet the trigger condition of SHIELD BLOCK while using INTERPOSE , you can automatically use its effect as part of that INTERPOSE reaction.

    Shield Block

    REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Trigger: You would take Physical, Astral, Lunar, or Force .

    Effect: You take 2 STRESS and gain resistance to that damage .

    Smoke Charges

    MINOR ACTION

    SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT CONSUMABLE 3, THROWN 5, TRAP

    You can expend a charge for one of the following effects:

    • Smoke Bomb (Thrown 5): Center a BLAST 2 zone on the target space that lasts until the end of your next turn. Characters fully within the zone gain soft cover .
    • Smokestick (Trap): When triggered, this Trap creates a BURST 3 zone that lasts until the end of this phase in the next round. Characters fully within the zone gain soft cover .

    Stoneskin Potion MINOR ACTION SUPPORT ITEM MAIN CONSUMABLE 3

    You can expend a charge to gain 1D3+2 FOCUS .

    Sunrod SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT CONSUMABLE 3, THROWN 5

    You ignore penalties from low visibility (p. 56) while this item is equipped, even if it has no charges.

    Minor Action: Y ou expend a charge for the following effect:

    • Flash Bomb (Thrown 5): All characters in a BLAST 1 AOE centered on the target space must make a BULK save. Failure: They are BLINDED until the end of their next turn.

    Supply Convoy SUPPORT ITEM HEAVY LIMITED 4

    You receive -1 SPEED while this item has charges remaining.

    Minor Action (You or Adjacent Ally): You expend a charge to do one of the following:

    • Regain all MP .
    • Regain all HP .
    • Clear all Stress .
    • Repair one destroyed piece of equipment or technique.

    Thieves' Tools SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT

    You receive the following benefits:

    • You can automatically open locks as a free action .
    • You can attempt to disable HIDDEN Traps .
    • You gain +1 on checks to disarm Traps and saves triggered by Traps .

    Whetstone SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT CONSUMABLE 2

    When you hit with a weapon, you can expend a charge to deal its maximum damage. Bonus damage and other effects are rolled normally.

    Wire Charges MINOR ACTION SUPPORT ITEM LIGHT CONSUMABLE 3, THROWN 5, TRAP

    You can expend a charge for one of the following effects:

    • Wire Knot (Thrown 5): Target a character within RANGE . On a hit, they must make an AGILITY save. Failure: They are IMMOBILIZED until the end of their next turn.
    • Wire Trap (Trap): When triggered, all characters in a BURST 1 AOE must make an AGILITY save. Failure: They are IMMOBILIZED until the end of their next turn.

    BASIC TECHNIQUES

    Adaptive Caster SKILL 2 MEMORY

    When you RELEASE a channeled ability, you can take 2 STRESS to release a different one than the one you were channeling. You must pay the costs of both abilities.

    Arcane Bolt

    RANGED SPELL ATTACK

    1 MEMORY

    Arcane Explosion

    RANGED SPELL ATTACK

    On Release: Y ou can spend 1 MP to increase the damage to 1D6+5 FORCE .

    Block REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Trigger: You are hit by an attack.

    Effect: Y ou gain +1 DODGE against the attack and can spend any amount of FOCUS , gaining an additional +1 DODGE for each. If this raises your DODGE above the result of the attack roll, it misses.

    Bolster Aether SKILL 1 MEMORY REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Trigger: You are hit by an attack.

    Effect: You gain +1 A-DEF against the attack and can spend any amount of FOCUS , gaining an additional +1 A-DEF for each. If this raises your A-DEF above the result of the attack roll, it misses.

    1/turn when you would take Physical, Force, Astral, or Lunar after ARMOR and resistances , you can reduce the amount by -1 for every point of FOCUS you spend. You can't use this ability if you are unable to take reactions .

    On Miss: You can spend 1 MP to deal 2 STRESS to the target.

    For every MP spent, you deal 1D6 FORCE to a different character within RANGE , with damage rolled once for all targets.

    Power Attack

    MINOR ACTION

    SKILL

    2 MEMORY

    You receive +1 on your next melee attack before the start of your next turn, but it deals +3 bonus damage on a hit.

    Resolve SKILL 1 MEMORY FOCUS X

    1/turn when you make a save, you can gain +1 to the result for each point of FOCUS spent. You can't use this ability if you are unable to take reactions .

    Shield Bash SKILL 1 MEMORY

    When you INTERPOSE and end the movement next to the attacker, you can push them 1 space after the attack.

    Shocking Grasp MELEE SPELL ATTACK 1 MEMORY REACH 1 2 STRESS

    On Hit: The target can't use reactions until the end of their next turn.

    Support Training, Basic

    SKILL 2 MEMORY UNIQUE

    You can equip one MAIN support item in a LIGHT slot.

    Support Training, Heavy

    SKILL 3 MEMORY UNIQUE

    You can equip one HEAVY support item in a MAIN slot.

    Two-Weapon Fighting SKILL 2 MEMORY UNIQUE

    1/round immediately after you VOLLEY or FIGHT with a LIGHT weapon, you can attack with a different LIGHT weapon as a free action . The extra attack can't include a weapon used as part of the original action, and doesn't trigger linked attacks.

    Weapon Training, Basic SKILL 3 MEMORY

    You can equip one MAIN weapon in a LIGHT slot or in a LIGHT LIGHT slot instead of two LIGHT weapons.

    Weapon Training, Heavy SKILL 4 MEMORY

    You can equip one HEAVY weapon in a MAIN slot or in a MAIN LIGHT slot instead of a MAIN weapon and a LIGHT weapon.

    SECTION 3 RUNNING THE GAME

    10: GAME MASTER'S GUIDE

    This chapter is for those who are interested in running a game of BEACON . Congratulations! You are now a highly sought-after person. TTRPGs usually have more willing players than willing GMs, so by reading this chapter and running a game for people, you're bringing the joy of this game to them.

    You will find that these sections are written more casually and conversationally than the past few, as they are about how you can make the game enjoyable for both your players and yourself, which is less precise a matter than the game rules themselves.

    GAME MASTER TIPS

    Running BEACON can be harder than just playing it. There are more things to keep track of, more stories to tell, and it can sometimes feel overwhelming, especially for people who are new to GMing. The purpose of this section is to make that job easier.

    THE CORE PRINCIPLES

    The core principles of BEACON apply to both players and the GM.

    1. The well-being and fun of the group, including both the players and the GM, is the top priority.

    The GM has the greatest ability to impact the fun of a game, but the players have a role as well. It's your job to make sure the story and game you're playing is fun for everyone. Anything else in the game is secondary to this rule. Sure, I've spent a lot of time trying to make the game fun to play, but if your group thinks that changing something would result in a better experience for everyone, then you should absolutely do that.

    1. Specific text takes precedent over general text.

    Some of the game rules in BEACON are general rules. For example, players can only perform certain actions in specific phases of combat. Weapons with the Slow tag, for instance, can only be used with the FULL ATTACK action. These are general rules.

    Many of the abilities available to players allow them to break these general rules, and that's intentional. To follow on from the above example, certain abilities allow players to attack with Slow weapons without using the FULL ATTACK action. That's a specific rule - it takes precedence over the general one.

    1. BEACON does not model reality or real-life physics, and is not meant to.

    This is not a simulation game. The Rule of Cool is the physics engine of this game, and the combat mechanics are designed like a board game or video game.

    1. Narrative play and combat play are distinct modes of play. The ability to do something in one mode does not automatically grant the ability to do it in the other.

    BEACON is designed to allow a wide variety of character types to exist without hampering player creativity; however, combat play features strict rules. It was designed to be played like a board game or video game, and only uses abilities specifically designed for combat play. Even though your character might be strong enough to throw an ox in narrative play, they can't just throw people around or tear down walls in combat play. They need an ability that allows them to do so, or a GM willing to let them make an ability check to attempt it.

    5. In combat play, players can do anything their abilities allow, even if it doesn't make narrative sense.

    It is the duty of the players and GM to explain how things happen in combat play, not to find reasons why they can't work. Basically, work backwards. If you're in a cave and a player calls down a lightning bolt from the sky, it happens. Now it's your job to figure out how or why the lightning bolt struck from the sky. Is the cave large enough to have clouds? Did it break through the roof? Was there a tiny hole?

    This intersects with several of the other principles listed here, such as Principle 3 and Principle 4. If a combat ability does something, it does that thing no matter what. The flavor text of that ability is just that: flavor.

    6. Always round up to the nearest whole number.

    This one's simple: when in doubt, round up.

    GAME MASTER ADVICE

    This section contains suggestions and tips for running roleplaying games, especially BEACON . There are a ton of other resources on this subject, from books to podcasts and videos.

    Two books I recommend are the Dungeons & Dragons 4th Edition Dungeon Master's Guide and Dungeon Master's Guide 2 . Both books contain a wealth of useful information applicable to running any game, not just D&D.

    The following tips are intentionally framed as suggestions, not rules. While they might be good practice, a skilled GM or one that knows their group might intentionally ignore one or more of them. But for new GMs, these suggestions can help you practice and improve your GMing skills.

    AVOID SAYING 'NO'

    When a player has a cool idea or suggestion, try not to say 'no' to it. In improv, this known as 'Yes, AND ' , because you take the idea the other person is offering and roll with it, building on it as needed.

    Of course, sometimes you do need to say 'no' . In those cases, try using 'No, BUT ' instead of just refusing. Incorporate some element of the player's offer, or give them a piece of what they were looking for.

    As much as possible, try to avoid the hard 'no' .

    ESTABLISH MOTIVATIONS

    When your players are creating their beacons, make sure to ask them about both what motivates their characters and what they're interested in as players. Their characters will have certain drives, but what do they want to happen with their characters as players, or what do they want to see happen during the game?

    For example, a character may want to explore dungeons and collect loot, which lets you know they're motivated by treasure; however, the player might want to experience a heroic sacrifice. To help make this happen, you stay in communication with the player about how early they want that to happen, and then set a narrative scene in the game where their character can hold the line while their friends escape.

    ASK FOR PLAYER INTENTIONS

    When a player is struggling to explain what they want to do, or you're having problems understanding or deciding how to rule a decision, ask the player in question what their intent is. What do they hope to accomplish? What do they want to happen? You can use these answers to help shape your decision.

    For example, the player of a timid beacon might describe their character as a wallflower who avoids talking with other characters. In reality, however, the player might actually want their character to be confronted with social situations that they have to maneuver. What the character wants in this situation is different from what the player wants, and if you only used their ingame description, you might miss that. But by knowing the player's intention, you could place the character into social situations, giving them the scenes they're looking for.

    ROOT FOR THE PLAYERS

    You should be a fan of your player's characters, and want them to succeed. Your job is not to have an adversarial relationship with them, to try and make them fail. Your job is to provide them with challenges to overcome . Help bring their plans to fruition and offer them challenges when needed.

    It's okay if the characters fail, since that can lead to interesting stories. But you shouldn't be hoping for them to fail - ever. If you feel that way, take a step back to examine why, and see if it's something you should address with the group.

    ASK LEADING QUESTIONS

    Questions are a powerful tool in your kit. They can help push players or characters into action, shed light on their internal thoughts, and help scenes evolve. You might ask questions of the players, or about what their characters are thinking or feeling in a given moment. Here are some examples:

    • 'What do you want to do?'
    • 'How do you feel at this moment?'
    • 'What's going through your mind?'
    • 'Who in the group reacts poorly to this information?'
    • 'Where do you think this will lead?'
    • 'When did you last see this same phenomenon?'

    ASK THE PLAYERS FOR IDEAS

    You don't have to come up with every story idea on your own. Your players are creative people who can have really cool ideas that you wouldn't think of.

    If you ever feel stumped, ask the players for help. Ask them, 'what would be cool to happen?' or, 'how do you want this to turn out?' .

    TALK TO THE GROUP

    Most questions you might have about your group or about how to deal with a situation can be handled by actually talking to your group. Explain your concerns or thoughts. Don't take actions or deliver punishments in game for out-of-game situations. Don't be a jerk.

    FAIL FORWARD

    Failing forward refers to the idea that, even on a failed roll, the action keeps moving forward. Having something just fail is unsatisfying because it doesn't add anything to the story, it just stops it in its tracks. Failing forward changes failures from hard stops to successes with complications.

    For example, a beacon, the Quicksilver Shadow, tries to sneak past some guards in a narrative scene. They fail their skill check, but instead of being immediately caught, they are spotted as soon as they get past the guards. They've technically succeeded in their goal of getting past the guards, but now have to flee in a chase scene. Without failing forward, the Quicksilver Shadow would have just been caught or prevented from getting past the guards, which isn't anywhere near as exciting.

    Failing forward is especially useful in BEACON because the characters are extremely competent heroes. It feels better and is less jarring for the legendary Quicksilver Shadow to fail forward when sneaking then to get caught.

    USE CUTSCENES

    Cutscenes or vignettes can be used to show what is happening in the world, or to give insight into specific NPCs. Cutscenes are great tools for giving players information without having to reveal it to their characters.

    For example, whenever the players gain a level, you might show a short cutscene of what the Scourge is doing behind the scenes. This keeps the players informed about how the story is progressing even though their characters aren't experiencing it directly.

    ADD ROLEPLAYING TO COMBAT SCENES

    There are a lot of things to keep track of in combat play, and it can be easy to focus on just running scenes efficiently. Adding little bits of roleplaying, however, can help elevate your combat scenes.

    Dialogue is a good way to do this. Whenever an NPC acts, narrate a line of dialogue or something they do, aside from just their combat action. Compare 'the cleaver attacks you' to 'the cleaver attacks you, announcing, 'Oh ho! You're in trouble now!'' The second version adds more to the scene.

    'BORROW' IDEAS LIBERALLY

    Take ideas from other stories you enjoy. It doesn't matter if the players are familiar with them. If they are, they might enjoy figuring out the connection and they can still be surprised if it differs from their expectations. Use other stories as blueprints for your own.

    NO TRULY HOPELESS SITUATIONS

    Scenes where the heroes are defeated by an overwhelming foe only to grow stronger and then defeat them later in the story are common in media. They are also terrible ideas for combat scenes.

    Combat scenes in BEACON can be long affairs. In such a situation, it's not fun to fight against someone who can't be hurt, or who instantly defeats the heroes. Even worse, it feels like a waste of time.

    If you want to use this sort of scene, either handle it in narrative play, or make it the outcome of a combat scene. Perhaps the PCs win the combat scene, but in the aftermath, the villain defeats them. Holdout combat scenes (p. 248) are great for this, since they're about trying to outlast an overwhelming number of foes. 'Success' in these situations is merely avoiding the worst-case scenario.

    NO PLAYER VERSUS PLAYER

    BEACON is not designed for player vs player fights, especially not in combat scenes.

    If some of the beacons want to fight each other, start by evaluating why . If there's an out-of-character conflict, see if you can come up with a compromise or change a story element that will appease everyone. After all, the most important part of the game is that everyone is having fun - it's okay to change things.

    If it's truly an in-character conflict, the best way to handle it is through narrative play. Have the players use the MAKE CONFLICT narrative action (p. 25) to find out how it resolves, and keep an open dialogue throughout. Discuss how the players want the scene to end and provide ways for that to happen.

    RECURRING CHARACTERS

    When the beacons make a connection with an NPC, whether positive or negative, make a note of it. Try to reintroduce that NPC again at future points in the story, giving the beacons a chance to build upon their existing history with that character.

    LEGACY CHARACTERS

    Has your gaming group played together before? If so, were there any NPCs or PCs that everyone enjoyed? You can introduce them into your BEACON game as legacy NPCs!

    A legacy NPC is an NPC whose name appears across multiple Reflections. They are (usually) completely distinct individuals, but share similar names.

    Basically, legacy characters are an excuse to introduce NPCs that your group might already be familiar with.

    You can still do this even if your group hasn't played together before. You can just name existing characters after other characters you know or like. This can be helpful when you need to come up with an NPC name on the spot.

    SETTING UP THE GAME

    Before you play a game of BEACON , you'll want to figure out what sort of game you're looking for. This isn't about the setting or characters, but about the type of gameplay that you're going to present to your players.

    BEACON is good at:

    • high fantasy
    • action
    • interesting, tactical battles
    • powerful player characters

    BEACON is not good at:

    • subterfuge and heists
    • intrigue and social manipulation
    • horror
    • quick battles

    BEACON isn't designed for games focusing on subterfuge, intrigue, or horror. These situations are often about avoiding fights, and BEACON is very much about fighting.

    That doesn't mean that BEACON can't have moments of subterfuge or intrigue. It very much can, and often does. But if you want those to be the main focus of the game, there are honestly other games that would do a better job of capturing the feeling of those stories.

    If the type of game you want to play aligns with BEACON ' s strengths, then your next step will be to sit down with your players for a session 0, during which you'll go over safety tools, set the tone for your game, and design your setting. Having read this section means you'll be able to guide those conversations so they remain in line with BEACON ' s strengths.

    SESSION 0

    Once you know what sort of game you want to play, you can present this information to your players during an initial meeting, before you actually begin playing the game. This is often referred to as ' Session 0 ' .

    Session 0 is an opportunity to establish safety tools, discuss the type of game you will be running, design your setting together, and design the Hub your beacons will use as their base of operations.

    As the GM, you should come to this session with a few key pieces of information that you want to share with the players, like what BEACON is and the type of gameplay it has. Most of the time you shouldn't show up with a fully fleshed-out setting for your players, as designing a world with player input is a fun part of the game (p. 228). It's okay to have some predetermined elements in mind, and there's nothing wrong with having a setting you already want to use if that is the case.
