    aPPendiceS

    Gang Up

    Outlaws are criminals and outcasts that prey on others. Their tactics are cruel and underhanded.

    Base Features

    TRAIT

    Poor Training

    The Outlaw's abilities deal +1 bonus damage for each of their allies adjacent to the target.

    The Outlaw is DAZED while BREAKING .

    Extra Features

    SKILL

    Ambush

    1/round , one of the Outlaw's abilities can deal +3 bonus damage while HIDDEN or if their target is an enemy that hasn't taken a turn yet this round.

    Chain Weaponry

    SUPPORT ITEM MAIN RECHARGE 5+

    When the Outlaw hits with a melee weapon attack roll, the target must make a BULK save. Failure: They are DISARMED until the end of their next turn.

    Cruel

    TRAIT

    Characters receive +1 on saves forced by the Outlaw.

    Dirty Fighter

    TRAIT

    The Outlaw's attacks against BLOODIED targets gain +1 and Piercing .

    Fearsome Leader

    TRAIT

    Other Outlaws within RANGE 5 of one or more Outlaws with this trait gain +1 on attacks, checks, and saves. Additionally, when this Outlaw is defeated, all other Outlaws in the scene receive +1 on attacks, checks, and saves for the rest of the scene.

    Flintlock

    VOLLEY +2/4/6, +1

    VS DODGE

    RANGED WEAPON

    MAIN MAGITECH

    PIERCING,

    RELOADING

    RANGE 5 / REACH 3

    6/7/8 PHYSICAL

    Low Blow

    MINOR ACTION

    SKILL STRESSFUL 1, RECHARGE 6+

    The Outlaw chooses an adjacent enemy. The target must make a BULK save. Failure: They are STUNNED until the end of their next turn.

    Rusty Weaponry

    SUPPORT ITEM

    MAIN

    Whenever the Outlaw makes a character BLOODIED , that character takes 2/3/4 DISCORD .

    Steal

    SKILL RECHARGE 6+

    The Outlaw chooses an adjacent enemy. They must make an AGILITY save. Failure: The Outlaw selects one of the target's pieces of equipment without the Armor or Innate tags. The target can't use or benefit from that item until the Outlaw is defeated or until the end of the scene.

    Thief

    TRAIT

    The Outlaw can automatically open locks. If they open a treasure chest, the reward is removed from the scene.

    MINOR ACTION

    TRAIT

    aPPendiceS

    BuildinG BeaconS

    13: temPlateS

    aPPendiceS

    Plant Nature

    Plants include all manner of animated trees, vines, roots, and fungi. Plant creatures have a strong synergy with each other.

    Base Features

    TRAIT

    The Plant has resistance to Lunar and is VULNERABLE to Astral .

    Extra Features

    TRAIT

    Foliage

    The Plant has hard cover while within difficult terrain .

    Hallucinogenic Spores

    SKILL

    FIGHT

    MANA 1, RECHARGE 5+

    BURST 2

    Non-Plant characters in the AOE must make a BULK save. Failure: They take 2 STRESS and treat all enemies as INVISIBLE until the end of their next turn. Success: They take 2 STRESS .

    In the Weeds

    TRAIT

    Non-Plant characters treat all spaces adjacent to the Plant as difficult terrain .

    Living Trees

    SPELL

    MANA X, SUMMON

    VOLLEY

    RANGE = SCOPE

    Living Tree ( SIZE 1-3 , HP 5 , ARMOR 1 , DODGE/A-DEF 10 , SPEED 0 )

    The Plant spends 1-3 MP and creates a living tree of equal SIZE within RANGE . The tree counts as having the Plant template with no extra features.

    A BURST 1 zone around the tree counts as difficult terrain to non-Plant characters.

    The living tree remains in play until defeated, even if its summoner is defeated.

    Undead are reanimated or ghostly creatures. While they come in many shapes and forms, they usually share an ability to endure greater injuries than the living.

    Base Features

    Undead Construction

    The Undead gains one of the following effects:

    Cadaverous: The Undead doesn't make wound or overstress rolls. Additionally, when they would take their last Wound, roll 1d6. On a 5-6, they don't take a Wound and instead go to 1 HP . Astral damage and damage from critical hits ignore this effect.

    Ghostly: The Undead is immune to Physical , but VULNERABLE to Force . They ignore ENGAGEMENT , and can move through the spaces of other characters and objects, but can't end their turn sharing spaces. They ignore dangerous terrain and difficult terrain .

    Extra Features

    Call of the Grave

    TRAIT

    When the Undead gives an enemy a Wound or Overstress, the target rolls the wound or overstress roll twice and takes the lowest result.

    Curse of Death VOLLEY +2/4/6 VS A-DEF

    RANGED SPELL ATTACK AETHERIC, INDIRECT RANGE = SCOPE 4/6/8 LUNAR

    On Hit: The target can't regain HP until the end of their next turn.

    Death Grip

    SKILL

    Characters GRAPPLED by the Undead are WEAKENED while GRAPPLED .

    Festering Bite FIGHT +1/3/5, +1 VS DODGE MELEE WEAPON MAIN CLUB RELOADING REACH 1 5/6/7 LUNAR

    On Hit: The target loses 2 FOCUS and the Undead regains 2/3/4 HP .

    On Crit: As a hit, but the target must make a BULK save. Failure: They are STUNNED until the end of their next turn.

    Life Sense

    SKILL

    The Undead's attacks against BLOODIED targets gain +1 and Homing .

    Infect

    TRAIT RECHARGE 4+

    When the Undead hits with a weapon attack, the target becomes infected with the following effects:

    • Infected characters are DAZED .
    • Whenever one of the infected character's allies becomes adjacent to them, they also become infected.
    • Infected characters can attempt a BULK save as a minor action to end the infection.
    • Clearing the DAZED condition removes the infection.

    Respawn, Minion

    TRAIT

    This trait requires the NPC to have the Minion template, and replaces the One Hit trait.

    The Undead has 1 HP and 1 STRESS CAP , and is defeated whenever they take any damage or Stress. When defeated, unless the damage or Stress was Astral or from a critical hit , they turn into a SIZE 1/2 object in one of their spaces ( HP 1 , DODGE 8 ). If this object hasn't been defeated by the end of the next round, it turns back into a fresh, new version of that Undead.

    Respawn Point

    TRAIT

    This trait can only be taken when the Undead has more than WOUND CAP 1 and OVERSTRESS CAP 1 .

    When the Undead enters a combat scene, mark a free space in the scene as their Respawn Point . Whenever they take a Wound or Overstress, they don't make a wound or overstress roll, and instead teleport to their Respawn Point.

    The Undead is still defeated when they reach their WOUND CAP or OVERSTRESS CAP .

    TRAIT

    Skeletal: The Undead has resistance to Physical from non-club weapons , but is VULNERABLE to damage from club weapons .

    The toughest enemies in the game are Bosses . Unlike Mini-Bosses, each Boss is designed to be an entire combat scene in its own right - a boss battle . When your players face a Boss, they face that specific Boss and their Guardians - no other NPCs are added to the scene.

    Bosses make for perfect capstone fights in campaigns or quests. Because of their unique rules, though, they should be used sparingly. Not every quest needs to end in a boss battle. Save them for important moments.

    Boss battles don't use battle plans. The goal in these fights is to defeat the Boss. Additionally, Bosses don't use NPC types or templates. They are in a category all of their own, although they do have tiers of power ( T1-3 , like other NPCs).

    During a boss battle, the Boss passes through multiple stages. This can represent physical transformations or just changes in tactics.

    Additionally, each Boss is accompanied by a number of Guardians , which are NPC units built around the Boss's unique features.

    This section introduces three specific Bosses: the Great Wyrm , the Kraken , and the Lich .

    BOSS SPECIAL RULES

    Bosses operate differently from other NPC units. This reflects the fact that they are standalone threats - fearsome challenges for any foe.

    Stages

    Each boss battle has three stages, representing changes in the Boss's abilities and fighting style. During each stage, the Boss is essentially a new character with different ability scores, attributes, and abilities, though they always have WOUND CAP and OVERSTRESS CAP 1 .

    When the Boss takes a Wound, they undergo a transformation and the next stage begins.

    WOUNDS AND OVERSTRESS

    Like other NPCs with OVERSTRESS CAP 1 , Bosses are VULNERABLE while exceeding their STRESS CAP .

    Turns

    Bosses take a number of turns each round equal to the number of PCs in the combat scene. This number doesn't decrease when PCs are defeated. Bosses' turns alternate with PC turns just like normal NPC turns do.

    Despite having extra turns, Bosses can only take one turn during each phase, except for PHASE DELAY , during which they can take multiple turns. Bosses decide which phases they take their turns in each round.

    Actions

    During each of a Boss's turns, they can perform a standard action , a standard movement , and a minor action . Their standard action must be one available in the current phase.

    Bosses have access to the same standard actions as other NPCs, but with the following changes.

    Phase Full Attack

    Full Attack: The Boss can FULL ATTACK .

    Phase Delay

    Delay: The Boss can only DELAY actions they haven't used this round. For example, if the boss has used VOLLEY , they can't VOLLEY again in PHASE DELAY .

    Reactions

    Opportunity Attack: The boss can OPPORTUNITY ATTACK any number of times each round.

    Bosses can't SURGE or use the Reroll Table unless otherwise indicated.

    GettinG Started

    BuildinG BeaconS

    runninG tHe Game

    14: BoSSeS

    aPPendiceS

    Events

    Bosses are powerful enemies that shape and alter the environment around them. These effects are called events , and each stage of a boss battle has events associated with it.

    Events and their effects just happen. The Boss and their Guardians don't activate them, and aren't considered to be using them as they might an ability.

    Events are tied to specific stages. When a boss transforms and the boss battle moves to a new stage, the old event ends and the new one begins.

    Abilities

    Bosses' abilities change from stage to stage. Each stage of the boss battle provides the Boss with a wide array of abilities. They have every ability from their current stage equipped.

    The equipment carried by Bosses don't always list a size or type. These abilities are not considered to have any size or type.

    Some abilities mention a phase and its number followed by a plus sign (e.g., ' Phase + '). These abilities can be used with a standard action during any phase from the listed one onward. For example, an ability with ' Phase + ' can be used as a standard action in PHASE , , , and so on all the way up to PHASE .

    Transformation

    When a Boss takes a Wound, they begin to transform. While transforming, Bosses still count as obstructions and are immune to all damage , Stress , and other effects until they enter their next stage. This does not affect Guardians.

    Although the Boss is considered to have taken a Wound, they don't make a wound roll and are not defeated.

    At the start of the next round, the next stage begins. The Boss clears all Stress , conditions, statuses, and effects, and takes on the listed ability scores, attributes, and abilities. Any events relevant to the new stage then take effect.

    Although the Boss is considered the same character throughout all stages, no damage is carried over.

    Complexity

    The SEARCH action doesn't work the same way against Bosses and their Guardians as it does against normal NPC units. Instead, each use of the action reveals one of the following:

    • The target's current HP , MP , and STRESS .
    • The target's traits.
    • If the target is the Boss, any abilities they can take on a specific phase (excluding PHASE DELAY ), or any reactions or minor actions they have.
    • If the target is a Guardian, their base features.

    Deployment

    Bosses and their Guardians always deploy first. The Boss can deploy anywhere on the map (usually in the middle), and the rules for each Boss explain when and where their Guardians are deployed.

    Guardians

    Guardians are special NPCs that accompany Bosses. Each stage of a boss battle introduces a certain number of new Guardians. These foes persist between stages, and have the potential to overwhelm the beacons if they aren't dealt with quickly.

    Each Boss's Guardians operate uniquely. Some take their own turns, while others act during their Boss's turns.

    When a new stage begins, any existing Guardians gain the Guardian profile for the new stage.

    G R E AT W Y R M

    Dragons are incredibly long-lived creatures that grow throughout their lives. The largest and most powerful of these dragons, called Great Wyrms, are terrifying creatures imbued with explosive elemental power.

    The Great Wyrm presented here is associated with fire, but you can easily change it to be associated with a different element.

    Because the Great Wyrm and its Guardians can fly, the scene should have three or so harpoon terrain features (see below) that the PCs can use to deal ranged damage and bring their enemies to the ground. You can flavor them as magical stones, prepared missiles, or whatever fits for your Reflection.

    HARPOON

    PCs standing in a harpoon's space can use their standard action during any phase to make a ranged weapon attack against a target within RANGE 15 .

    On Hit: The target takes 1D6+1 PIERCING PHYSICAL , loses FLYING , and cannot resume FLYING until this phase in the next round.

    Harpoons must be reloaded after each use. They can be reloaded with a standard action during any phase, or are automatically reloaded if a PC in its space reloads a weapon.

    Tactics

    The Great Wyrm and its Guardians prefer when enemies bunch up, which makes it easier to hit them with AOE attacks and abilities. They are at their strongest when they can stack Discord on enemies and move around to catch as many enemies in AOEs as possible.

    In Stage 1, the Great Wyrm is most mobile. In Stage 2, it looks for opportunities to knock enemies into Traps . In Stage 3, it becomes enraged and acts less intelligently than before.

    Scene

    Don't set up a small or tight battlefield, as one of the PCs' primary defensive strategies will be to spread out.

    Fill the map with rocks and rubble for cover and difficult terrain, and place pools of fire or lava as dangerous terrain. You can also change the environment as the scene progresses through each stage, adding more lava and cracks in the ground in the later stages.

    S TA G E 1: T H E D O O M W I N G

    The Great Wyrm takes to the sky with a deafening roar.

    Small cracks and fissures appear on the ground, and the temperature begins to rise.

    TIER 1 TIER 1 TIER 1 TIER 1 TIER 2 TIER 2 TIER 2 TIER 2 TIER 3 TIER 3 TIER 3 TIER 3

    Ability Scores: +1 Ability Scores: +2 Ability Scores: +3

    Guardians

    Deploy a number of Guardians equal to the number of PCs + 1 in free spaces. During the Great Wyrm's turns, each Guardian can move up to their SPEED .

    GUARDIAN BASE FEATURES

    Fire Aura TRAIT AURA1
    Enemies that start their turn in one or more of these

    Ember

    RANGED SPELL ATTACK

    RANGE 10

    2 DISCORD

    This attack can only be used as part of the Great Wyrm's WHELPS trait.

    VOLLEY +2/3/4 VS A-DEF

    AETHERIC

    Events

    FIRE RAIN

    At the start of the first round, create three non-adjacent BLAST 1 zones. At the end of the round, enemies in one or more of the zones must make an AGILITY save. Failure: They take 8/12/16 ASTRAL + 4 DISCORD . Success: They take 4/6/8 ASTRAL + 2 DISCORD .

    The zones then disappear.

    Repeat this at the start of each new round, increasing the number of zones by one each time.

    Burdened Flight

    Traits

    TRAIT

    The Great Wyrm and its Guardians have flight and gain +2 SPEED while FLYING . If they are BREAKING , they lose flight and immediately stop FLYING.

    Red Scales

    TRAIT

    The Great Wyrm and its Guardians have resistance to Astral and Discord .

    Standard Actions

    Ranged Destruction

    TRAIT

    The Great Wyrm can VOLLEY during PHASE BRAWL .

    Whelps

    TRAIT

    On each of the Great Wyrm's turns, one Guardian can make an EMBER attack. Each Guardian can only do so 1/round .

    ACTIONS ARE ORDERED ACCORDING TO THE PHASES IN WHICH THEY CAN BE USED.

    Hatch Egg SKILL ANY PHASE

    A new Guardian appears in a free space adjacent to an enemy with 5+ Discord , ignoring line of sight.

    Fire Breath I SKILL

    CHANNEL

    CLOSE BLAST 3

    On Channel: Whenever the Great Wyrm would lose concentration , it instead loses 1 MP . If the Great Wyrm has no MP to lose, it loses concentration .

    On Release: Characters in the AOE must make an AGILITY save.

    Failure: They take Success: They take

    8/12/16 ASTRAL + 4 DISCORD .

    4/6/8 ASTRAL + 2 DISCORD .

    Burn

    VOLLEY +2/3/4 VS DODGE

    RANGED SPELL ATTACK

    LINE 15 2/4/6 ASTRAL + 3 DISCORD

    Doomwing PHASE REPOSITION/ FULL ATTACK SKILL RECHARGE 5+

    The Great Wyrm flies up to up 10 spaces in a straight line. Enemies through which it moves must make an AGILITY save.

    Failure: They take 4/6/8 ASTRAL + 2 DISCORD .

    Success: They take 2/3/4 ASTRAL + 1 DISCORD .

    Claw MELEE WEAPON

    FIGHT +2/3/4, +1 VS DODGE

    REACH 1 8/10/12 PHYSICAL

    Swoop

    PHASE BRAWL / FULL ATTACK

    SKILL

    The Great Wyrm makes a CLAW attack, and can automatically GRAPPLE the target on a hit. Before or after the attack, the Great Wyrm can fly up to its SPEED (4/4/4) . It can't use this ability if it is unable to fly or move.

    Fireball

    VOLLEY +2/3/4 VS DODGE

    RANGED SPELL ATTACK MANA 2, RELIABLE 2/3/4

    RANGE = SCOPE (10/10/10), BLAST 2

    5/6/7 ASTRAL + 2 DISCORD

    Superhot SKILL MANA 2

    FULL ATTACK

    All enemies (ignoring line of sight) must make a MAGIC save. Failure: They gain Discord equal to their current Discord . If they don't have any Discord , they take 2 DISCORD . Success: They take 1 DISCORD .

    Reactions

    Spreading Flames SKILL MANA 1

    REACTION

    Trigger: An enemy ends their turn adjacent to one of their allies that has Discord .

    Effect: The target gains Discord equal to their ally's Discord .

    S TA G E 2 : T H E E R U P T I O N

    The ground ripples and cracks, sending geysers of lava spewing into the air. The rumbling continues, as the ground slowly becomes an active, erupting volcano.

    Guardians

    At the beginning of this stage, deploy a number of additional Guardians equal to the number of PCs + 1 in free spaces. During the Great Wyrm's turns, each Guardian can move up to their SPEED .

    GUARDIAN BASE FEATURES

    Fire Aura TRAIT AURA1
    Enemies that start their turn in one or more of these

    Fissure

    TRAIT TRAP FREE ACTION

    On each of the Great Wyrm's turns, one Guardian can place a FISSURE TRAP in an adjacent, free space. When triggered, the Trap creates a BURST 1 AOE, which can affect FLYING characters. Characters in the AOE must make an AGILITY save. Failure: They take 4 ASTRAL + 1 DISCORD . Success: They take 2 ASTRAL .

    After it is triggered, the Trap's space becomes dangerous terrain ( AGILITY , 5 DISCORD ) until the end of the scene.

    Each Guardian can place a Trap 1/round.

    Events

    ERUPTION

    At the start of each round, place three eruption points scattered in single free spaces anywhere on the map. Each eruption point must be within 4 spaces of one or more PCs.

    At the end of each round, all PCs in the scene take 15/18/21 ASTRAL . This damage is reduced by 5/6/7 for every PC standing on an eruption point. PCs standing in one of the eruption points take 2 DISCORD in addition to the above damage. All eruption points then disappear.

    FORMING FISSURES

    At the beginning of this stage, place Fissure Traps in free spaces equal to the number of PCs. These Traps can't be within RANGE 3 of a PC.

    Burdened Flight

    Traits

    TRAIT

    The Great Wyrm and its Guardians have flight and gain +2 SPEED while FLYING . If they are BREAKING , the lose flight and immediately stop FLYING.

    Red Scales

    TRAIT

    The Great Wyrm and its Guardians have resistance to Astral and Discord .

    Standard Actions

    ACTIONS ARE ORDERED ACCORDING TO THE PHASES IN WHICH THEY CAN BE USED.

    Hatch Egg SKILL ANY PHASE

    A new Guardian appears in a free space adjacent to an enemy with 5+ Discord , ignoring line of sight.

    Chomp SKILL RECHARGE 5+ ANY PHASE

    An enemy GRAPPLED by the Great Wyrm must make a BULK save. Failure: They take 10/12/14 PHYSICAL .

    Fire Breath II SKILL

    On Channel: Whenever the Great Wyrm would lose concentration , it instead loses 1 MP . If the Great Wyrm has no MP to lose, it loses concentration .

    On Release: Characters in the AOE must make an AGILITY save.

    Failure: They take 8/12/16 ASTRAL + 4 DISCORD . Success: They take 4/6/8 ASTRAL + 2 DISCORD .

    Roar

    PHASE

    MANA 1

    BURST 2

    Enemies in the AOE must make a MIND save. Failure: They take 2 STRESS and must move up to their SPEED directly away from the Great Wyrm in a straight line. This movement doesn't provoke reaction attacks. Success: They take 2 STRESS .

    Bite MELEE WEAPON

    On Hit: The target is pulled adjacent to and automatically GRAPPLED by the Great Wyrm.

    FULL ATTACK

    All enemies (ignoring line of sight) must make a MAGIC save. Failure: They gain Discord equal to their current Discord . If they don't have any Discord , they take 2 DISCORD . Success: They take 1 DISCORD .

    Reactions

    Spreading Flames SKILL MANA 1 REACTION

    Trigger: An enemy ends their turn adjacent to one of their allies that has Discord .

    Effect: The target gains Discord equal to their ally's Discord .

    Tremor Maker

    TRAIT

    The Great Wyrm and its Guardians don't trigger FISSURE TRAPS (but are still affected by them).

    S TA G E 3 : T H E I N F E R N O

    The Great Wyrm turns its head upward in anger and frustration, unleashing a gout of flame. The heat is so great it feels like the air is on fire. The race is on. Can you defeat this force of nature before you burn alive?

    TIER 1 TIER 1 TIER 1 TIER 1 TIER 2 TIER 2 TIER 2 TIER 2 TIER 3 TIER 3 TIER 3 TIER 3

    GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS
    Size: 1/2 Armor 0 Size: 1/2 Armor 0 Size: 1/2 Armor 0
    HP: 10 MP: 2 HP: 12 MP: 2 HP: 14 MP: 2
    Scope: 10 Save Target: 12 Scope: 10 Save Target: 14 Scope: 10 Save Target: 16
    Dodge: 8 A-Def: 10 Dodge: 10 A-Def: 12 Dodge: 12 A-Def: 14
    Stress Cap: 4 Speed: 4 Stress Cap: 4 Speed: 4 Stress Cap: 4 Speed: 4
    Ability Scores: +1 Ability Scores: +2 Ability Scores: +3

    Guardians

    At the beginning of this stag, deploy a number of Guardians equal to the number of PCs + 1 in free spaces. During the Great Wyrm's turns, each Guardian can move up to their SPEED .

    During this stage, all Guardians begin channeling WHELP BREATH at the start of each round. They release it at the end of PHASE RELEASE.

    GUARDIAN BASE FEATURES

    Fire Aura

    TRAIT AURA 1

    Enemies that start their turn in one or more of these Auras take 1 DISCORD per adjacent Guardian.

    Whelp Breath SKILL

    On Release: Enemies in the AOE must make an AGILITY save. Failure: They take 3/4/5 ASTRAL + 2 DISCORD . Success: They take 1/2/3 ASTRAL + 1 DISCORD .

    Events

    RIVERS OF LAVA

    At the start of each round, create 10 spaces of dangerous terrain ( AGILITY , 5 DISCORD ) in free spaces. Each space of dangerous terrain must be adjacent to either the Great Wyrm or another of piece of dangerous terrain created by this event, a Fissure Trap , or a piece of dangerous terrain from the start of the scene.

    Traits

    Burdened Flight

    TRAIT

    The Great Wyrm and its Guardians have flight and gain +2 SPEED while FLYING . If they are BREAKING , the lose flight and immediately stop FLYING.

    Red Scales

    TRAIT

    The Great Wyrm and its Guardians have resistance to Astral and Discord .

    Tremor Maker

    TRAIT

    The Great Wyrm and its Guardians don't trigger FISSURE TRAPS (but are still affected by them).

    Inescapable Heat

    TRAIT

    All characters in the scene other than the Great Wyrm and its Guardians take 1 DISCORD at the start of each of their turns. Each round, this amount increases by +1 DISCORD .

    Standard Actions

    ACTIONS ARE ORDERED ACCORDING TO THE PHASES IN WHICH THEY CAN BE USED.

    Chomp SKILL RECHARGE 5+ ANY PHASE

    An enemy GRAPPLED by the Great Wyrm must make a BULK save. Failure: They take 10/12/14 PHYSICAL .

    Inhale

    PHASE CHANNEL

    SKILL RECHARGE 6+

    The Great Wyrm uses FIRE BREATH III , and can't lose concentration while channeling it.

    Fire Breath III SKILL

    CHANNEL

    CLOSE BLAST 5

    On Channel: Whenever the Great Wyrm would lose concentration , it instead loses 1 MP . If the Great Wyrm has no MP to lose, it loses concentration .

    On Release: Characters in the AOE must make an AGILITY save.

    Failure: They take

    8/12/16 ASTRAL + 4 DISCORD

    Success: They take 4/6/8 ASTRAL + 2 DISCORD

    . .

    Burn

    VOLLEY +2/3/4 VS DODGE

    RANGED SPELL ATTACK

    LINE 15 2/4/6 ASTRAL + 3 DISCORD

    Fireball

    VOLLEY +2/3/4 VS DODGE

    RANGED SPELL ATTACK MANA 2, RELIABLE 2/3/4

    RANGE = SCOPE (10/10/10), BLAST 2

    5/6/7 ASTRAL + 2 DISCORD

    Shaking Ground SKILL PHASE REPOSITION

    All nonFLYING enemies (ignoring line of sight) must make an AGILITY save. Failure: They fall PRONE .

    The Great Wyrm can move up to its SPEED (4/4/4) after using this ability.

    Bite

    FIGHT +2/3/4, +1 VS DODGE

    MELEE WEAPON

    REACH 2 8/10/12 PHYSICAL

    On Hit: The target is pulled adjacent to and automatically GRAPPLED by the Great Wyrm.

    Gulp SKILL FULL ATTACK

    If the Great Wyrm isn't GRAPPLED , it can use BITE instead of this ability. If it does have a character GRAPPLED , that character must make a contested BULK check as if breaking out of GRAPPLED. Failure: They take 3/4/5 STRESS and are swallowed . They are moved into the Great Wyrm' space and no longer GRAPPLED . The swallowed character is permanently DAZED and IMMOBILIZED and can't target or be targeted by anything outside the Great Wyrm's space. They move when the Great Wyrm moves. Additionally, they take an additional +1 Discord from INESCAPABLE HEAT . Swallowed characters can break free by making a BULK save as a minor action .

    The Great Wyrm can only swallow characters if there is sufficient room in its space.

    Reactions

    Spreading Flames SKILL MANA 1 REACTION

    Trigger: An enemy ends their turn adjacent to one of their allies that has Discord .

    Effect: The target gains Discord equal to their ally's Discord .

    Krakens are powerful underwater creatures that prey on ships with their powerful tentacles and storm magic. Fights against the Kraken must take place aboard a ship (see below).

    KRAKEN

    THE SHIP

    The ship counts as an object that can't be moved. Only the Kraken and its Guardians can damage the ship, but only using abilities that specifically mention this. Instead of having HP , damage to the ship is represented by the destruction of 1-space segments. Destroyed segments of ship are replaced by water.

    Beacons can repair destroyed ship segments with standard actions during any phase. Each time a beacon performs repairs, they can restore 1d3 spaces within SCOPE , changing them back from water spaces to ship spaces. They can take 1 STRESS to reroll the 1d3.

    Tactics

    The full Kraken only appears during the final stage of this boss battle. In Stage 1, the PCs fight its tentacles, which are its Guardians. The Guardians focus on damaging the ship on which the beacons fight. In Stage 2 the PCs must contend with dangerous events. In Stage 3, the Kraken appears and focuses on attacking as many enemies as possible.

    Scene

    The combat scene takes place on a 12 x 12 map, with the beacons deploying on a 6 x 6 ship in the middle of the map. The rest of the map is water, which is considered difficult terrain . Characters with Aquatic Adaptations can move normally in these spaces, but are still imperiled by the Kraken's SNAPPING JAWS trait.

    S TA G E 1: T H E A R M S

    Towering tentacles rise out of the water and begin smashing into the nearby ship.

    TIER 1 TIER 1 TIER 1 TIER 2 TIER 2 TIER 2 TIER 2 TIER 2 TIER 3 TIER 3 TIER 3 TIER 3
    GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS
    Size: 3 Armor 0 Size: 3 Armor 0 Size: 3 Armor 0
    HP: 12 MP: 1 HP: 16 MP: 1 HP: 20 MP: 1
    Scope: 5 Save Target: 12 Scope: 5 Save Target: 14 Scope: 5 Save Target: 16
    Dodge: 8 A-Def: 8 Dodge: 10 A-Def: 10 Dodge: 12 A-Def: 12
    Stress Cap: 5 Speed: 3 Stress Cap: 5 Speed: 3 Stress Cap: 5 Speed: 3
    Ability Scores: +1 Ability Scores: +2 Ability Scores: +3

    Guardians

    There are two types of Guardians: Slammers and Smashers . Slammers have INITIATIVE 2 , Smashers have INITIATIVE 5 . Deploy one Slammer and one Smasher per PC in free water spaces adjacent to the ship.

    Each Guardian takes up 1 space - like a SIZE 1 character - but they still count as SIZE 3 .

    GUARDIAN BASE FEATURES

    Sea Monster

    TRAIT

    The Kraken and its Guardians move normally in water spaces, but treat non-water spaces as difficult terrain . They generally avoid entering ship spaces.

    Slam (Slammer Only) SKILL

    CHANNEL

    LINE 3

    On Channel: The AOE is a zone that lasts while it is channeling. If the Slammer moves or is moved, the area moves with them, mirroring its movement.

    On Release: Any ship spaces in the zone are destroyed and characters in the zone take 8/10/12 PHYSICAL .

    Smash (Smasher Only) FIGHT +1/2/3 VS DODGE MELEE WEAPON REACH 1 6/8/10 PHYSICAL

    If there are any enemies adjacent to the Smasher and targetable, attacks with this weapon must target them. Otherwise, it automatically destroys an adjacent ship space.

    Events

    SNAPPING JAWS

    If a character other than the Kraken or one of its Guardians ends their turn in a water space, they must make an AGILITY check or take 3 STRESS .

    Special Rules

    The Kraken does not actually appear in this stage. Instead, the PCs fight its tentacles, represented by Guardians.

    In this stage, the Guardians are treated like normal NPCs. They take their own turns and have their own Initiatives; however, they can only use the abilities listed in their base features, taking no other actions.

    The Kraken begins its transformation when either of the following takes place:

    • Half of the originally deployed Guardians have been defeated.
    • Half of the total ship spaces are destroyed.

    Once the transformation is initiated, Stage 2 begins in the following round.

    Keep track of the number of Guardians remaining when Stage 2 begins, as it is relevant in Stage 3.

    BuildinG BeaconS

    runninG tHe Game

    14: BoSSeS

    aPPendiceS

    S TA G E 2 : T H E S T O R M

    The tentacles suddenly retreat underwater, earning the beacons a brief respite. But within moments, they feel their hair beginning to stand on end. Electric storms begin to coalesce, crackling with static energy, while the Kraken sends a tidal wave to sweep the beacons away.

    Events

    BUILDING STORM

    Randomly place one 1-space Building Storm Marker per PC. At the end of Round 2, these storms begin discharging their energy. All characters take 5 ASTRAL per building storm.

    Characters can dispel a storm by succeeding on a MAGIC check as a standard action during any phase. Attempting this causes the character to take 5 ASTRAL .

    TIDAL WAVE

    A tidal wave forms along one of the edges of the map. It is a straight line as long as that side of the map and 1 space wide.

    Each round, the tidal wave moves 3 spaces toward the other end of the map twice: once at the end of PHASE and once at the end of PHASE . Any characters it moves through must destroy a piece of equipment or technique and are knocked PRONE .

    Each space of the tidal wave has 10 HP , and is destroyed when it reaches 0 HP . These spaces are immune to all statuses, conditions, and effects except for damage. Attacks auto-hit them, and they automatically fail any checks or saves.

    When the tidal wave reaches the other side of the map, it disappears.

    SNAPPING JAWS

    If a character other than the Kraken or one of its Guardians ends their turn in a water space, they must make an AGILITY check. Failure: They take 3 STRESS .

    Special Rules

    At the beginning of this stage, note how many Guardians remain and remove them from the scene - there is no Kraken or Guardians until Stage 3.

    This stage lasts for two rounds, after which Stage 3 begins.

    CHALLENGE MODE

    To make the fight more difficult, you can create a new tidal wave at any side of the map once the old one disappears. This continues until the end of the scene.

    S TA G E 3 : T H E D E E P O N E

    The full scale of this monster is finally revealed as the Kraken emerges! Its tentacles flail in anger as it attempts to grab and crush the puny beacons arrayed before it.

    TIER TIER TIER 1 1 1 1 1 TIER 3 TIER 3 TIER 3 TIER 3
    Size: 3 Save Target: 12 Size: 3 Save Target: 14 Size: 3 Save Target: 16
    Armor: 3 Scope: 10 Armor: 3 Scope: 10 Armor: 4 Scope: 10
    ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES
    Bulk: 4 Mind: 0 Bulk: 6 Mind: 0 Bulk: 6 Mind: 1
    Agility: 1 Magic: 3 Agility: 2 Magic: 4 Agility: 4 Magic: 5
    ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES
    HP: 15+5/PC Stress Cap: 7 HP: 20+5/PC Stress Cap: 8 HP: 25+5/PC Stress Cap: 9
    Dodge: 7 A-Def: 7 Dodge: 9 A-Def: 9 Dodge: 11 A-Def: 11
    Speed: 4 MP: 4 Speed: 4 MP: 4 Speed: 4 MP: 4
    GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS
    Size: 3 Armor 0 Size: 3 Armor 0 Size: 3 Armor 0
    HP: 12 MP: 1 HP: 16 MP: 1 HP: 20 MP: 1
    Scope: 5 Save Target: 12 Scope: 5 Save Target: 14 Scope: 5 Save Target: 16
    Dodge: 8 A-Def: 8 Dodge: 10 A-Def: 10 Dodge: 12 A-Def: 12
    Stress Cap: 5 Speed: 3 Stress Cap: 5 Speed: 3 Stress Cap: 5 Speed: 3
    Ability Scores: +1 Ability Scores: +2 Ability Scores: +3

    Special Rules

    The Kraken itself enters play during this stage, deploying in free water spaces anywhere in the scene.

    Guardians

    At the beginning of this scene, deploy one new Guardian per PC, plus one new Guardian for every Guardian that remained undefeated at the end of Stage 1. All Guardians are deployed in free water spaces adjacent to the ship.

    Guardians can only use Snatch , taking no other actions except for those granted by the Kraken's Grand Slam ability. They automatically have this action ready to perform as an OPPORTUNITY ATTACK. They can also perform it if one of the Kraken's actions allow them to do so.

    During the Kraken's turns, its Guardians can move up to their SPEED .

    GUARDIAN BASE FEATURES

    Sea Monster

    TRAIT

    The Kraken and its Guardians move normally in water spaces, but treat non-water spaces as difficult terrain . They generally avoid entering ship spaces.

    Snatch FIGHT +1/2/3VSDODGE
    MELEEWEAPON REACH2 3PHYSICAL

    On Hit: The target is pulled adjacent to and automatically GRAPPLED by the Guardian.

    Events

    SNAPPING JAWS

    If a character other than the Kraken or one of its Guardians ends their turn in a water space, they must make an AGILITY check. Failure: They take 3 STRESS .

    RAGING STORM

    All Building Storm Markers from Stage 2 become Raging Storm Markers . Additionally, at the start of every round, randomly place another 1-space Raging Storm Marker .

    At the end of each round, all storms discharge their energy, dealing 5 ASTRAL per marker to all characters other than the Kraken and its Guardians.

    Characters can dispel a storm by succeeding on a MAGIC check as a standard action during any phase. Attempting this causes the character to take 5 ASTRAL .

    Disarmed

    Traits

    TRAIT

    The Kraken is VULNERABLE while it has no Guardians .

    Standard Actions

    Stormcaller

    SPELL

    Sea Monster

    TRAIT

    The Kraken and its Guardians move normally in water spaces, but treat non-water spaces as difficult terrain . They generally avoid entering ship spaces.

    ACTIONS ARE ORDERED ACCORDING TO THE PHASES IN WHICH THEY CAN BE USED.

    ANY PHASE

    MANA 2, RECHARGE 5+

    Place a Raging Storm Marker in a random space.

    Grand Slam

    SKILL

    CHANNEL

    On Channel: The Kraken and all Guardians begin channeling. Each Guardian creates a LINE 3 zone that lasts while it is channeling. If a Guardian moves or is moved, this area moves with it, mirroring the movement.

    On Release (Kraken): The Kraken creates a LINE 8 AOE. All ship spaces in the AOE are destroyed and characters in the AOE are auto-hit by a melee weapon attack for 8/10/12 PHYSICAL .

    On Release (Guardian): All ship spaces in the zone are destroyed and characters in the zone are auto-hit by a melee weapon attack for 8/10/12 PHYSICAL .

    Ink Spray

    SKILL

    PHASE

    RECHARGE 5+

    RANGE = SCOPE (10/10/10), BLAST 1

    The AOE is a zone. Enemies are BLINDED while fully within the zone, and line of sight can't be drawn through the zone unless it's from an AOE. The zone lasts until this ability is used again or the Kraken dismisses it as a free action .

    Fling SKILL VOLLEY One enemy GRAPPLED by the Kraken or a Guardian is pushed up to 5 spaces in a straight line in any direction. If this would push them into one of their allies, they take 6/8/10 PHYSICAL . As a reaction , the ally can split the damage evenly between themselves and the pushed character.

    Rogue Wave

    SKILL

    REPOSITION

    BURST 1

    All enemies in the AOE must make a BULK save. Failure: They fall PRONE .

    The Kraken can then teleport to another side of the ship.

    Grabby Hands PHASE BRAWL / FULL ATTACK SKILL

    All Guardians can attack with SNATCH and the Kraken can make a melee weapon attack against an adjacent enemy with a +2/+3/+4 bonus, dealing 10/12/14 PHYSICAL on a hit.

    Constrict

    SKILL

    FULL ATTACK

    All enemies GRAPPLED by the Kraken or one of its Guardians must make a BULK save.

    Failure:

    They take

    12/16/20 PHYSICAL

    Success:

    They take

    6/8/10 PHYSICAL

    .

    Reactions

    REACTION

    Switch

    SKILL

    Trigger: An enemy starts their turn GRAPPLED by a Guardian, ignoring line of sight.

    Effect: They are teleported to a space adjacent a different Guardian and become GRAPPLED by the new Guardian.

    .

    PHASE

    SKIRMISH

    Tactics

    Liches and their Guardians are fragile and dependent on mana. They want to remain as far away from enemies as possible. Despite this, once the Lich's Living Soul leaves their body in Stage 2, they immediately play more aggressively, since they will remain invulnerable until the end of Stage 3.

    Scene

    This boss battle benefits from a larger map. The Lich's long SCOPE and the Guardians' ranged abilities mean they want to keep their distance. Because the Lich can teleport , consider creating locations on the battle map that are hard to access without teleportation , flight , or climbing . Don't make them completely inaccessible, but give the Lich plenty of opportunities to evade danger so the PCs can focus on taking out Guardians.

    Liches are the ultimate spellcasters, immortal beings that use magic to fuel their undying existence. Lichdom requires extensive knowledge of necromancy, but their long lives and raw magical power allow them to master other forms of magic as well.

    Be sure to include cover and terrain that blocks line of sight so the PCs can avoid or mitigate the significant number of ranged attacks they are likely to face in this boss battle. You may also want to include beneficial terrain features for the PCs, either as a way to entice them to good positions or to force them to choose between a good position or a bad one with a beneficial terrain effect.

    The Lich and certain PCs will want to be in Mana Nexuses as much as possible, so think ahead where you'd like to place them. You can change their positions in each stage, but having the position of at least the Stage 1 nexuses planned will save you time.

    S TA G E 1: T H E W I Z A R D S U P R E M E

    The Lich uses illusions to mask their true appearance, presenting themselves as a grand wizard with a retinue of apprentices. The illusion can't fully compensate for the jerking movements of their undead attendants, or the uneasy feeling caused by their presence.

    TIER 1 TIER 1 TIER 1 TIER 1 TIER 2 TIER 2 TIER 2 TIER 2 TIER 3 TIER 3 TIER 3 TIER 3
    Size: 1 Save Target: 13 Size: 1 Save Target: 15 Size: 1 Save Target: 18
    Armor: 0 Scope: 25 Armor: 0 Scope: 25 Armor: 0 Scope: 25
    ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES ABILITY SCORES
    Bulk: 0 Mind: 4 Bulk: 0 Mind: 6 Bulk: 0 Mind: 8
    Agility: 0 Magic: 4 Agility: 0 Magic: 6 Agility: 0 Magic: 8
    ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES ATTRIBUTES
    HP: 10+3/PC Stress Cap: 12 HP: 15+3/PC Stress Cap: 12 HP: 20+3/PC Stress Cap: 12
    Dodge: 10 A-Def: 12 Dodge: 11 A-Def: 14 Dodge: 12 A-Def: 16
    Speed: 5 MP: 8 Speed: 5 MP: 9 Speed: 5 MP: 10
    GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS GUARDIANS
    Size: 1/2 Armor 0 Size: 1/2 Armor 0 Size: 1/2 Armor 0
    HP: 3 MP: 1 HP: 4 MP: 1 HP: 5 MP: 1
    Scope: 20 Save Target: 12 Scope: 20 0 14 Scope: 20 Save Target: 16
    Dodge: 8 A-Def: 12 Dodge: 9 A-Def: 14 Dodge: 10 A-Def: 16
    Stress Cap: 6 Speed: 3 Stress Cap: 6 Speed: 3 Stress Cap: 6 Speed: 3
    Ability Scores: +1 Ability Scores: +2 Ability Scores: +3

    Guardians

    Deploy a number of Guardians equal to the number of PCs + 2 in free spaces.

    When the Lich takes a turn, all Guardians can move up to their SPEED and then use ARCANE MISSILE simultaneously.

    GUARDIAN BASE FEATURES

    Arcane Missile

    VOLLEY

    RANGED SPELL ATTACK

    AUTO-HIT

    RANGE 20

    X FORCE

    The Guardian targets the enemy closest to them with this spell attack. Instead of taking damage for each hit, the target takes damage from one source equal to 1 FORCE per Guardian that attacks them this way. For example, a character targeted by three Guardians would take 3 FORCE , not three lots of 1 FORCE .

    Events

    MANA NEXUS I

    At the start of the scene, place four 1-space mana nexuses spread around the map, with at least one close to the Lich and at least one close to the PCs.

    Characters that start their turn in a mana nexus regain 3 MP .

    Traits

    Mana Application

    TRAIT MANA 1

    The Lich can reroll an attack, check, or save. They can use this trait any number of times per roll.

    Perfected Spellcasting

    TRAIT

    If the Lich would be SILENCED , they instead lose 2 MP and can't perform reactions until the end of their next turn.

    Additionally, the Lich can't use any reactions while exceeding their STRESS CAP .

    Ranged Destruction

    TRAIT

    The Lich can VOLLEY during PHASE BRAWL .

    Recycle Mana

    TRAIT

    Whenever an enemy spends MP , the Lich regains that same amount of MP .

    Standard Actions

    Summoned by Pain

    ACTIONS ARE ORDERED ACCORDING TO THE PHASES IN WHICH THEY CAN BE USED.

    SKILL

    ANY PHASE

    The Lich creates a new Guardian in a free space adjacent to an enemy that took a Wound or Overstress this round.

    Meteor Strike

    CHANNEL

    SPELL ARCING, MANA 3 RANGE = SCOPE (25/25/25)

    On Channel: The Lich chooses 4 spaces within RANGE .

    On Release: Any objects or terrain in the chosen spaces are destroyed. Then create a BLAST 4 AOE centered on each chosen space. Characters in one or more AOEs take 12/16/20 ASTRAL .

    Targets take -2 damage for every space they are away from the center (i.e., at 4 spaces away from the center space, the damage is reduced by 8) and must make an AGILITY save. Success: They reduce this damage by half, after the original reduction.

    Disintegrate VOLLEY +2/4/6 VS DODGE RANGED SPELL ATTACK RECHARGE 5+ RANGE 25 8/10/12 FORCE

    On Hit: The target must make an AGILITY save. Failure: One of their weapons or support items is destroyed (their choice).

    Creeping Rime VOLLEY +2/4/6 VS DODGE RANGED SPELL ATTACK RANGE 25 8/10/12 LUNAR

    On Hit: The target must make a BULK save. Failure: They are SLOWED until the end of their next turn.

    Reactions

    REACTION

    Spell Shield SPELL MANA X

    Trigger: The Lich takes Physical, Astral, Lunar, or Force.

    Effect: The Lich takes -2 damage per MP spent.

    Transpose PHASE REPOSITION / FULL ATTACK SPELL MANA 1, RECHARGE 5+

    RANGE = SCOPE (25/25/25)

    The Lich swaps places with an ally within RANGE , which counts as a teleport .

    Paralyzing Touch FIGHT +1/2/3, +1 VS DODGE MELEE WEAPON

    REACH 1 6/8/10 LUNAR + 2 STRESS

    On Hit: The target must make a BULK save. Failure: They are STUNNED and DAZED until the end of their next turn. Success: They are DAZED until the end of their next turn.

    Dominate SPELL MANA 2

    FULL ATTACK

    RANGE = SCOPE (25/25/25)

    An enemy within RANGE must make a MIND save, taking +1 if they are BREAKING . Failure: They take 3 STRESS and must move up to their SPEED toward their closest ally and attack them with a weapon or spell attack of the Lich's choice. Success: They take 3 STRESS and must move up to their SPEED toward their closest ally.

    S TA G E 2 : T H E N E C R O T I C

    The Lich drops their illusion, revealing their true form and those of their undead attendants. Taking the fight seriously now, they unleash their necrotic powers.

    Guardians

    Deploy a number of Guardians equal to the number of PCs + 1 in free spaces.

    When the Lich takes a turn, all Guardians can move up to their SPEED and then use VILE CURSE simultaneously.

    GUARDIAN BASE FEATURES

    The Guardian targets the enemy closest to them with this spell attack. Instead of taking Stress for each hit, the target takes Stress from one source equal to 1 STRESS per Guardian that attacks them this way. For example, a character targeted by three Guardians would take 3 STRESS , not three lots of 1 STRESS .

    Events

    MANA NEXUS II

    The Lich can reposition the mana nexuses placed at the beginning of the scene, with at least one close to the Lich and at least one close to the PCs.

    Characters that start their turn in a mana nexus regain 3 MP .

    Traits

    Mana Application

    TRAIT MANA 1

    The Lich can reroll an attack, check, or save. They can use this trait any number of times per roll.

    Living Soul

    TRAIT

    If there are any Guardians remaining when the Lich would take a Wound, the Lich's energy visibly leaves their body and enters that of a Guardian. This Guardian becomes the Lich's living soul .

    While the living soul remains undefeated, the Lich is locked at 1 HP and becomes immune to all damage and Stress .

    When the living soul is defeated, the Lich takes a Wound and begins their transformation, with Stage 3 beginning at the start of the next round. This ability only triggers once.

    Perfected Spellcasting

    TRAIT

    If the Lich would be SILENCED , they instead lose 2 MP and can't perform reactions until the end of their next turn.

    Additionally, the Lich can't use any reactions while exceeding their STRESS CAP .

    Ranged Destruction TRAIT

    The Lich can VOLLEY during PHASE BRAWL .

    Standard Actions

    Recycle Mana

    TRAIT

    Whenever an enemy spends MP , the Lich regains that same amount of MP .

    ACTIONS ARE ORDERED ACCORDING TO THE PHASES IN WHICH THEY CAN BE USED.

    Soulcrux

    ANY PHASE

    SPELL MANA 2

    RANGE = SCOPE (25/25/25)

    The Lich creates a Guardian in a free space within Range.

    Meteor Strike

    CHANNEL

    SPELL ARCING, MANA 3 RANGE = SCOPE (25/25/25)

    On Channel: The Lich chooses 4 spaces within RANGE .

    On Release: Any objects or terrain in the chosen spaces are destroyed. Then create a BLAST 4 AOE centered on each chosen space. Characters in one or more AOEs take 12/16/20 ASTRAL .

    Targets take -2 damage for every space they are away from the center (i.e., at 4 spaces away from the center space, the damage is reduced by 8) and must make an AGILITY save. Success: They reduce this damage by half, after the original reduction.

    Disintegrate VOLLEY +2/4/6 VS DODGE RANGED SPELL ATTACK RECHARGE 5+

    RANGE 25 8/10/12 FORCE

    Creeping Rime VOLLEY +2/4/6 VS DODGE RANGED SPELL ATTACK RANGE 25 8/10/12 LUNAR

    On Hit: The target must make a BULK save. Failure: They are SLOWED until the end of their next turn.

    Dimension Door

    SPELL MANA 1

    The Lich teleports up to 6 spaces.

    Paralyzing Touch

    FIGHT +1/2/3, +1 VS DODGE

    MELEE WEAPON

    On Hit: The target must make a BULK save. Failure: They are STUNNED and DAZED until the end of their next turn. Success: They are DAZED until the end of their next turn.

    Power Word: Stun

    FULL ATTACK

    SPELL MANA 3

    RANGE = SCOPE (25/25/25)

    An enemy within RANGE must make a MAGIC save, taking +1 if they are BLOODIED . Failure: They take 3 STRESS and are STUNNED and SLOWED until the end of their next turn. Success: They take 3 STRESS and are SLOWED until the end of their next turn.

    Reactions

    Antilife SPELL MANA 1 REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Effect: They only regain half as much HP .

    Spell Shield

    Effect: The Lich takes -2 damage per MP spent.

    PHASE

    +

    S TA G E 3 : T H E U N D Y I N G

    With their physical form destroyed, all that remains of the Lich's body is their head, floating and brimming with magical energy.

    Guardians

    Deploy a number of Guardians equal to the number of PCs in free spaces.

    All Guardians turn into jars that are Summons with the DEATH JAR trait:

    Guardian ( SIZE 1/2 , HP 1 , ARMOR 2 , DODGE/A-DEF 6 , SPEED 0 )

    GUARDIAN BASE FEATURES

    Death Jar

    TRAIT AURA 2

    Enemies in these Auras are unable to regain HP . Additionally, enemies that start their turn in one or more of these Auras take 2/3/4 LUNAR and are unable to regain HP or gain TEMP HP until the start of their next turn.

    Events

    MANA NEXUS III

    The Lich can reposition the mana nexuses from their Stage 2 positions, with at least one close to the Lich and at least one close to the PCs.

    Characters that start their turn in a mana nexus regain 3 MP .

    Traits

    Doublecast

    TRAIT

    1/round , the Lich can spend 2 MP when taking an action to take it twice that turn.

    Mana Application

    TRAIT

    MANA 1

    The Lich can reroll an attack, check, or save. They can use this trait any number of times per roll.

    Soulcrux Immortality

    TRAIT

    The Lich is immune to all damage and Stress while any Guardians remain. Nothing supersedes this trait.

    Perfected Spellcasting

    TRAIT

    If the Lich would be SILENCED , they instead lose 2 MP and can't perform reactions until the end of their next turn.

    Additionally, the Lich can't use any reactions while exceeding their STRESS CAP .

    Ranged Destruction

    TRAIT

    The Lich can VOLLEY during PHASE BRAWL .

    Recycle Mana

    TRAIT

    Whenever an enemy spends MP , the Lich regains that same amount of MP .

    Standard Actions

    Vengeful Ghost

    SPELL MANA 1, SUMMON

    RANGE = SCOPE (25/25/25)

    Howl FIGHT

    +

    Failure: They take 2/3/4 STRESS , are DAZED until the end of their next turn, and must immediately move their SPEED directly away from the Lich.

    Success: They take 4/5/6 LUNAR .

    Paralyzing Touch FIGHT +1/2/3, +1 VS DODGE MELEE WEAPON REACH 1 6/8/10 LUNAR + 2 STRESS

    APPENDICES

    KEY SECTIONS APPENDIXA:SHOPSANDSUPPLIES p. 346
    APPENDIXB:LOOT p. 356
    APPENDIXC:NPCTYPES p. 387
    APPENDIXD: GLOSSARY p. 388

    A: SHOPS AND SUPPLIES

    Shops are places where beacons can exchange GOLD for SUPPLIES (p. 18). SUPPLIES are minor items beacons can bring on quests that don't cost equipment slots or MEMORY to equip. They must be equipped at the beginning of each quest, at the same time as other equipment and techniques. Beacons can equip up to three SUPPLIES per quest (no duplicates), and all equipped SUPPLIES are destroyed at the end of the quest.

    Shops provide a way to thematically group SUPPLIES together. For example, the Alchemy Shop sells SUPPLIES that are narratively potions and elixirs, while the Tavern sells food and drink SUPPLIES . Beacons can buy or acquire SUPPLIES with the Go Shopping or Pursue a Profession downtime activities (p. 29, p. 31), but the GM can also give them out as rewards (p. 20).

    When beacons Go Shopping or otherwise have an opportunity to select SUPPLIES from a shop, not every option is always in stock. Instead, the GM either randomly or manually decides which SUPPLIES are currently available. It is recommended that no more than five different SUPPLIES are available in each shop at a time.

    Similarly, not every shop will be available during every downtime. For example, a city that hates magitech may not always have an Engineer available; however, the General Store should always be available.

    GENERAL STORE GENERAL STORE GENERAL STORE ADVENTURINGSUPPLIESANDCOMMONGOODS .
    EFFECT
    SUPPLY COST
    1 Compass 1GOLD You gain +1 on skill checks to navigate.
    2 Holster 2GOLD You gain an extra LIGHT weapon slot.
    3 Pouch 2GOLD You gain an extra LIGHT support slot.
    4 Rations 1GOLD Minor Action (1/quest) :You can regain HP equal to your BLOODIED value.
    5 Rented Gear XGOLD You gain access to any weaponorsupport item from any class for the duration of onequest, although it still needs to beequipped as normal.This costs GOLD equal to the class rank required to unlock it.
    6 Rumors 1GOLD You learn the environmental factors and NPCtypes that will be encountered during this quest. If the GM doesn't know them all yet, they will instead provide as much guidance as they can on what the environments and NPCs might be like.
    7 Sleeping Bag 1GOLD At the end of each combat scene, you regain HP equal to 1/4 of your MAXI- MUMHP .
    8 Treasure Map 1GOLD 1/quest at the start of a combat scene, the GMwill place a treasure chest in the scene.
    9 Tutor XGOLD You gain access to any technique from any class, although it still needs to be equipped as normal.This costs gold equal to the class rank required to unlock it.
    10 Waterskin 1GOLD MinorAction(1/quest): You can clear Stress equal to your BREAKING point.
    11 Well Stocked 1GOLD You gain +1 RECOVERY .
    ALCHEMY SHOP ALCHEMY SHOP ALCHEMY SHOP POTIONSANDELIXIRSWITHAVARIETYOFMAGICALEFFECTS .
    SUPPLY COST EFFECT
    1 Acid 1GOLD This support item is equipped for free. SUPPORTITEM MAIN CONSUMABLE 3,INNATE,THROWN5 MINORACTION . Expend a charge to makeasupport attack within the thrown RANGE . OnHit: The target is SUNDERED until the end of their next turn.
    2 Alchemist's Fire 1GOLD This support item is equipped for free. SUPPORTITEM LIGHT CONSUMABLE 3,INNATE,THROWN5 MINORACTION . Expend a charge to makeasupport attack within the thrown RANGE . OnHit: The target takes 1 DISCORD .
    3 Antitoxin 1GOLD Free Action (1/quest): You can clear all Discord .
    4 Astral Potion 1GOLD 1/quest at the start of a combat scene, you gain resistance to Astral for the rest of the scene.
    5 Barkskin Potion 1GOLD 1/quest at the start of a combat scene, you gain resistance to Physical for the rest of the scene.
    6 Catseye Elixir 2GOLD During this quest, you can SEARCH as a minor action for 1 STRESS .
    7 Crystal Flask 1GOLD One piece of Consumable equipment gains +1 Consumable .
    8 Diamond Flasks 3GOLD All of your Consumable equipment gains +1 Consumable .
    9 Displacer Flask 3GOLD You gain +2 AGILITY .
    10 Elixir of Agility 1GOLD You gain +1 AGILITY .
    11 Elixir of Fortitude 2GOLD You gain +3 MAXIMUMHP .
    12 Elixir of Magic 1GOLD You gain +1 MAGIC .
    13 Elixir of Strength 1GOLD You gain +1 BULK .
    14 Elixir of Wisdom 1GOLD You gain +1 MIND .
    15 Empyrean Flask 3GOLD You gain +2 MIND .
    16 Flask of Life 1GOLD 1/quest at the start of a combat scene, you gain +5 MAXIMUMHP for the rest of the scene. Your current HP also increases.
    17 Force Potion 1GOLD 1/quest at the start of a combat scene, you gain resistance to Force for the rest of the scene.
    18 Invisibility Potion 2GOLD Free Action (1/quest): Youbecome INVISIBLE until the start of your next turn.
    19 Lunar Potion 1GOLD 1/quest at the start of a combat scene, you gain resistance to Lunar for the rest of the scene.

Whenever you take damage, increase the value of your Explosion Die by 1 to a maximumof6.Asafree action you can discharge this unstable energy in a BURST 2 area, dealing an amountof Force equal to your Explosion Die to characters in the AOE.You take halfasmuch Force .This effect then ends.

    MAGIC SHOP / DOJO

    MAGIC SHOPS AND DOJOS STOCK RANDOM ASSORTMENTS OF LOOT TECHNIQUES, WHICH CAN BE PURCHASED AS SUPPLIES. MAGIC SHOPS SELL SPELLS, WHILE DOJOS SELL SKILLS.

    TECHNIQUES RECEIVED AS SUPPLIES ARE EQUIPPED FOR FREE, AND ARE DESTROYED AT THE END OF THE QUEST AS NORMAL.

    Uncommon Technique 1GOLD
    Rare Technique 2GOLD
    Legendary Technique 3GOLD

    GettinG Started

    BuildinG BeaconS

    runninG tHe Game aPPendiceS

    a: SHoPS and SuPPlieS

    Loot is bonus equipment and techniques that beacons earn as quest rewards. Loot is usually presented to the players in loot crates (p. 257), each of which is three pieces of loot from which the player can select one to keep.

    The GM can either randomly or manually pick loot to give to PCs. The tables later in this appendix arrange loot by type (weapon, support item, technique) and rarity (Uncommon, Rare, Legendary) to make it easier to randomly generate loot. In addition, a loot crate randomizer can be found here .

    This section lists all loot in alphabetical order.

    Absorb Elements

    SPELL (RARE)

    1 MEMORY

    MANA 1

    Trigger: You or an ally within SCOPE would take Astral or Lunar.

    Effect: They gain resistance to that damage .

    Absorption

    FIGHT

    MELEE WEAPON (UNCOMMON) MAIN ARTIFACT REACH 1 1D6+1 PHYSICAL

    On Crit: You regain 1 MP and your target loses 1 MP .

    Adamantine Armor

    SUPPORT ITEM (RARE) HEAVY ARMOR, UNBREAKABLE

    • +3 ARMOR , -2 SPEED , -2 DODGE . Additionally, when you would be critically hit, it becomes a normal hit instead.

    Adamantine Construction

    SUPPORT ITEM (LEGENDARY) LIGHT ENCHANTMENT, UNBREAKABLE, UNIQUE

    You may use one of the following Enchantments at a time:

    • Any Armor: This ARMOR gains +1 ARMOR and is Unbreakable .
    • Any Weapon: This weapon gains Piercing and Unbreakable .

    REACTION

    Aether Flask

    MINOR ACTION

    SUPPORT ITEM (UNCOMMON) LIGHT CONSUMABLE 2

    Drinking this potion suffuses you with aetheric energies until the end of your next turn. You can expend a charge to receive all of the following effects:

    • You cannot attack or use spells.
    • You are immune to Physical, Astral, and Lunar .
    • You can move through solid objects as if they were difficult terrain , but you can't end a turn inside one. If you end a turn inside or partly inside an object, you are moved to the last free space you moved through that turn.

    Aether Shield SPELL (RARE) 1 MEMORY MANA X, UNIQUE

    When you would take damage (after ARMOR and resistances ), you can spend MP to reduce the damage taken. You take -2 damage for every 1 MP spent. This spell can't reduce Piercing damage or Discord , and can't be used if you are incapable of taking reactions .

    Agile Discord SKILL (RARE) 1 MEMORY

    You can use AGILITY instead of MAGIC when making checks to clear Discord .

    Aid

    REACTION (1/ROUND)

    SPELL (UNCOMMON) 1 MEMORY MANA 1

    Trigger: An ally within SCOPE makes an ability check or save.

    Effect: You grant them +1 on the check or save.

    Ammo Kit MINOR ACTION

    SUPPORT ITEM (UNCOMMON) MAIN CONSUMABLE 2

    You or an adjacent ally can expend a charge to reload a single weapon.

    Amulet of Health

    SUPPORT ITEM (UNCOMMON) LIGHT

    You gain +1 on BULK checks and saves. Additionally, when you REFRESH , you gain 4 TEMP HP .

    Angelsteel Armor

    SUPPORT ITEM (LEGENDARY) HEAVY ARMOR

    • +2 ARMOR , -1 SPEED , -1 DODGE . Additionally, when you are hit by an attack, you can spend 1 MP to add your current ARMOR to your DODGE or A-DEF against the attack, potentially turning a hit into a miss. This effect can be used once per attack, and can't be used while you are SUNDERED .

    Animate Objects

    MINOR ACTION SPELL (UNCOMMON) 1 MEMORY MANA X

    RANGE = SCOPE

    You move an object or piece of terrain within RANGE up to 6 spaces. The amount of MP you spend determines the SIZE of the object or piece of terrain you can move:

    • SIZE 1/2: 1 MP
    • SIZE 1: 2 MP
    • SIZE 2: 3 MP
    • SIZE 3: 4 MP

    Animated Shield SUPPORT ITEM (RARE) LIGHT SUMMON RANGE = SCOPE

    You gain the SHIELD BLOCK reaction. If you meet the trigger condition of SHIELD BLOCK while using INTERPOSE , you can automatically use its effect as part of that INTERPOSE reaction.

    Animated Shield ( SIZE 1 , HP 5 , DODGE/A-DEF 10 , SPEED 0 )

    Minor Action: You deploy this shield as a Summon within RANGE or return it to you. While it is deployed, it provides hard cover and you cannot use the other effects provided by this support item.

    Shield Block REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Trigger: You would take Physical, Astral, Lunar, or Force.

    Effect: You take 2 STRESS and gain resistance to that damage .

    Armor of Growing Endurance SUPPORT ITEM (RARE) LIGHT ENCHANTMENT

    You may use one of the following Enchantments at a time:

    • Any Armor: When you take a Wound while this Armor is equipped, you gain TEMP HP equal to your BLOODIED value.
    • Any Armor: When you take an Overstress while this Armor is equipped, you gain charges equal to your BREAKING POINT . Until the end of the scene, whenever you would take Stress , you can instead spend 1 charge per Stress .

    Armor Plates

    SUPPORT ITEM (UNCOMMON) LIGHT ENCHANTMENT, UNIQUE

    You may use one of the following Enchantments at a time:

    • Any Armor: This Armor grants +1 ARMOR .
    • Any Weapon: On a critical hit with this weapon, you gain +1 ARMOR until the end of your next turn.

    Astral Infusion MINOR ACTION SPELL (RARE) 1 MEMORY MANA 1 RANGE = SCOPE

    You place the following Enchantment on a weapon equipped by an ally within RANGE (their choice). It lasts until the end of their next turn:

    • Any Weapon: On a hit, this weapon deals +1d6 bonus Astral .

    Astral Projection VOLLEY SPELL (RARE) 2 MEMORY MANA 3, SUMMON RANGE = SCOPE

    Astral Projection ( SIZE = your SIZE , HP 5 , DODGE/A-DEF 10 , SPEED 0 )

    You create a projection within RANGE that doesn't require line of sight. It is immune to Physical .

    You can use this projection as the point of origin for your spell and Aetheric attacks. Additionally, 1/ turn on your turn, the projection can MARK a target within your SCOPE as a free action .

    Backstabber

    FIGHT

    MELEE WEAPON (UNCOMMON) LIGHT BLADE ACCURATE REACH 1 1D3 PHYSICAL

    On Crit: This attack deals +1d6 bonus damage .

    Bag of Holding

    SUPPORT ITEM (RARE) FREE UNIQUE, UNBREAKABLE

    One of your other support slots increases by one size (i.e., from LIGHT to MAIN , or MAIN to HEAVY ).

    Baleful Polymorph

    CHANNEL

    SPELL (LEGENDARY) 3 MEMORY MANA 3, POLYMORPH RANGE = SCOPE

    On Release: One target within RANGE is transformed into a SIZE 1/2 creature that can't attack or use spells. They can make a MAGIC save at the end of each of their turns to end this effect, and they automatically revert to their normal form if they take any damage. Each character can only be affected by this spell 1/scene .

    Bane

    REACTION (1/ROUND)

    SPELL (UNCOMMON) 1 MEMORY MANA 2

    Trigger: An enemy within SCOPE

    makes an attack roll.

    Effect: They receive +1 on the roll.

    Banish CHANNEL

    SPELL (LEGENDARY) 3 MEMORY MANA 2 RANGE = SCOPE

    On Release: One target within RANGE is removed from play. They return to play during PHASE DELAY of the next round in the same space or the nearest free space. Each character can only be affected by this ability 1/scene .

    Barbed Enchantment

    SUPPORT ITEM (UNCOMMON) LIGHT ENCHANTMENT

    You may use one of the following Enchantments at a time:

    • Any Armor: This Armor grants +1 on GRAPPLE attacks and checks related to GRAPPLE and being GRAPPLED . Additionally, when you end your turn GRAPPLED with a character, they take 2 PHYSICAL .
    • Any Melee Weapon, Skill Attack, or Spell Attack: On a critical hit with this weapon, you can GRAPPLE the target as a free action .

    Barkskin

    MINOR ACTION

    SPELL (UNCOMMON)

    2 MEMORY RANGE = SCOPE

    An ally within Range gains 1 FOCUS .

    Barkskin Armor

    MINOR ACTION

    SUPPORT ITEM (RARE) LIGHT ARMOR, MANA X

    You gain ARMOR equal to the MP spent. Whenever you take damage, the ARMOR granted by this effect decreases by -1.

    Battle Chant

    MINOR ACTION

    SKILL (UNCOMMON) 1 MEMORY STRESSFUL 1

    Allies adjacent at the time of use gain +1 on their next attack roll before the end of the round.

    Beam Saber FIGHT

    MELEE WEAPON (RARE) MAIN BLADE PIERCING REACH 1 1D6+1 ASTRAL

    You ignore all penalties from low visibility .

    Beast Bond SKILL (LEGENDARY) 2 MEMORY

    When you use the Reroll Table , you can choose one of your Summons within RANGE 3 to suffer the effects instead of you.

    Belt of Giantkind

    SUPPORT ITEM (UNCOMMON) LIGHT

    You count as +1 SIZE larger for the purposes of SHOVE , GRAPPLE , and stopping movement as a result of ENGAGEMENT .

    Belt of Growing and Shrinking MINOR ACTION SUPPORT ITEM (UNCOMMON) MAIN MANA 1

    Your SIZE changes by +1 or -1 , to a minimum of 1/2 and maximum of 4 . This effect lasts until the end of the scene.

    Bestow Curse MINOR ACTION

    SPELL (UNCOMMON) 1 MEMORY MANA 2

    An adjacent enemy must make a MAGIC save. Failure: They are DAZED until the end of their next turn.

    Black Hole

    VOLLEY

    RANGED WEAPON (RARE) HEAVY ARTIFACT MANA 1, AETHERIC RANGE 15, BLAST 1 2D6+1 FORCE

    On Hit: The target is SUNDERED until the end of their next turn.

    Blackiron Armor

    SUPPORT ITEM (RARE) HEAVY ARMOR

    +3 ARMOR , -1 SPEED , -1 DODGE . Additionally, you gain resistance to Astral and Lunar .

    Blinding Powder MINOR ACTION SUPPORT ITEM (RARE) LIGHT CONSUMABLE 3

    You can expend a charge to make an adjacent enemy BLINDED until the end of their next turn.

    Bloodstone Armor

    SUPPORT ITEM (UNCOMMON) LIGHT ARMOR, CONSUMABLE 1

    +1 ARMOR . Additionally, when you become BLOODIED , you can expend a charge to gain resistance to all damage until the end of your next turn.

    You can regain charges for this item during Short Rests by spending 1 RECOVERY per charge.

    Bloodthirst

    FIGHT

    MELEE SKILL ATTACK (UNCOMMON) 1 MEMORY ACCURATE, STRESSFUL 1 REACH 1 1D3+1 LUNAR

    On Crit: Y ou regain HP equal to the damage the target takes from the attack (after ARMOR and resistance ).

    Blur

    SKILL (LEGENDARY) 1 MEMORY UNIQUE

    You gain +2 DODGE .

    Bonecaller Armor SUPPORT ITEM (RARE) MAIN ARMOR, SUMMON

    • +1 ARMOR .

    Shambling Skeleton ( SIZE 1 , HP 5 , DODGE/A-DEF 10 , SPEED 2 )

    Minor Action: You create a shambling skeleton in a free adjacent space. Enemies that end their turn adjacent to the skeleton take 3 PHYSICAL .

    Book of Alternative Explosions SUPPORT ITEM (LEGENDARY) LIGHT MANA X

    1/turn when you use an ability with an AOE ( Blast , Burst , Close Blast , Line ), you can apply one of the following effects. Each effect costs a different amount of MP :

    • Restorative ( 2 MP ): Instead of taking any damage, characters in the AOE regain HP equal to the damage that would have been dealt.
    • Flexible ( 1 MP ): You can change the damage that would be dealt from Physical , Astral , Lunar , or Force to a different one of these types.
    • Eye of the Storm ( 2 MP , Blast only ): The center space of the AOE is excluded from the effects.
    • Phased ( 2 MP ): Cover and terrain don't block line of sight for the AOE.
    • Reliable ( X MP ): If the AOE deals Physical , Astral , Lunar , or Force , it gains Reliable equal to the MP spent.

    Submitted by Saleibriel

    Book of Endless Pages SUPPORT ITEM (LEGENDARY) MAIN UNIQUE

    One of your equipped techniques has its MEMORY cost reduced to 1. This lasts for the rest of the quest, even if this item is destroyed.

    Effect: The character must make a MAGIC save. Failure: The spell fizzles and the action is lost.

    SKILL (UNCOMMON) 1 MEMORY UNIQUE

    When you restore HP to a BLOODIED character, they regain an additional +2 HP .

    +2 ARMOR . Gain the CURSE reaction .

    Curse

    REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Trigger: You are hit by an attack from a character within SCOPE .

    Effect: You spend up to 3 MP, giving them +1 on all attacks, checks, and saves per MP spent. This decreases by -1 at the end of each of their turns.

    Dancing Blade

    FIGHT

    MELEE WEAPON (RARE) MAIN BLADE SUMMON REACH 1 1D6+1 PHYSICAL

    Dancing Blade ( SIZE 1/2 , HP 10 , DODGE/A-DEF 10 , SPEED = your SPEED )

    Minor Action: You deploy this weapon within SCOPE . It has flight . You can attack with this weapon from its space.

    If the dancing blade is reduced to 0 HP , it is destroyed and returns to you. You can recall it as a minor action if it is within SCOPE , but any damage it has taken remains until you Rest .

    Danger Sense

    SKILL (UNCOMMON) 1 MEMORY UNIQUE

    You get +1 on saves against AOE effects.

    • +1 ARMOR . Gain the DARKSHADE reaction.

    Darkshade REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Trigger: You are hit by a melee attack.

    Effect: You spend 1 FOCUS and deal 3 LUNAR to the attacker.

    Darksight Armor SUPPORT ITEM (UNCOMMON) LIGHT ARMOR

    +1 ARMOR . Additionally, you ignore all penalties from low visibility and don't treat HIDDEN characters as INVISIBLE in areas of low visibility .

    Death's Gambit Dice

    SUPPORT ITEM (UNCOMMON) LIGHT

    When you make a wound roll, you can roll twice and take either result.

    Defender's Bond SUPPORT ITEM (RARE) LIGHT UNIQUE

    When you equip this item or during a Rest , you and one ally can attune to this item. Only one ally can be attuned at a time, and they can end the attunement at any time, including during combat. This doesn't require an action. You and the attuned ally each gain the UNBREAKABLE BOND reaction.

    Submitted by M. Tyson.

    Unbreakable Bond REACTION (1/ROUND)

    Trigger: Y our attuned ally is targeted by an attack while within RANGE 10 .

    Effect: You and the ally switch places, teleporting into each other's spaces, and you become the target of the attack instead. This effect counts as if you used INTERPOSE on that ally.

    Defending Enchantment SUPPORT ITEM (RARE) MAIN ENCHANTMENT

    You may use one of the following Enchantments at a time:

    • Any Weapon: 1/turn when you hit with this weapon, you gain 1 FOCUS .
    • Any Armor: When you DEFEND or REFRESH while this Armor is equipped, you gain 2 FOCUS .

    Defensive Fighter

    SKILL (UNCOMMON) 1 MEMORY UNIQUE

    1/round when you critically hit, you gain 1 FOCUS .

    Deflect REACTION (1/ROUND)

    SKILL (RARE) 2 MEMORY UNIQUE

    Trigger: Y ou are hit by an attack and reduce the damage to 0 through ARMOR or other effects.

    Effect: Y ou negate any effects the attack would have on you, and can force the attacker to reroll the attack against a character or object adjacent to you.

    Delayed Healing SKILL (RARE) 1 MEMORY UNIQUE

    When you would regain HP from any source other than this skill, you only regain half the amount. Then, at the start of your next turn, you regain HP equal to the original full amount. This effect isn't optional.

    Demigod

    SKILL (LEGENDARY) 1 MEMORY UNIQUE

    You are immune to the DAZED condition, and you gain +2 STRESS CAP .

    Desync SKILL (LEGENDARY) 1 MEMORY UNIQUE

    Whenever you take a Wound or Overstress, you can choose to be removed from play until the start of your next turn. You are immune to all damage and effects while removed from play and can't move or perform any actions, but your Traps and Summons are unaffected as long as they don't require you to perform an action. You return to play in the space you left, or the nearest free space.

    Devil's Crown REACTION (1/ROUND) SUPPORT ITEM (LEGENDARY) LIGHT MANA 1

    Trigger: You take Physical , Astral , Lunar , or Force after ARMOR and resistance .

    Effect: The damage is reduced by -1d6 . If the source of the damage is within SCOPE , deal Piercing damage to them equal to the damage reduced.

    Feel No Pain

    SKILL (RARE) 2 MEMORY UNIQUE

    While you have 3+ Wounds, you gain resistance to all damage . While you have 3+ Overstresses, you gain resistance to Stress .

    Additionally, when you receive your fourth Wound or Overstress, you aren't defeated and can keep acting as normal, although you can't regain HP or clear Stress until you Rest . Roll 1d6 whenever you take damage or Stress in this state. On a 1, you are defeated.

    Gambling Dice

    SUPPORT ITEM (UNCOMMON) LIGHT CONSUMABLE 3, UNIQUE

    When you would make an attack roll, you can instead expend a charge and roll 1d6 to determine the outcome of the attack:

    • 1: You miss and take 2 STRESS
    • 2-3: You miss.
    • 4-5: You hit.
    • 6: You crit.

    Golden Carp VOLLEY SPELL (LEGENDARY) 2 MEMORY SUMMON

    RANGE = SCOPE

    Golden Carp ( SIZE 1/2 , HP 15 , DODGE/A-DEF 10 , SPEED 1 )

    You create a golden carp within RANGE . It cannot perform actions.

    As a free action during each of your following turns, you must spend 2 MP or the carp is dismissed. Once you have spent 6 MP in this way, the carp transforms with the following effects:

    • It becomes a SIZE 3 Summon , pushing other characters out of its spaces and destroying non-objective objects and terrain it grows into.
    • It regains all HP , clears all conditions, and gains the ability to take actions.
    • It gains flight , a SPEED of 4 , and 2 ARMOR .
    • It gains the DRAGONFLAME weapon listed below, and can use it as a standard action .

    You must continue spending 2 MP as a free action during each of your turns to keep the carp in play active. If you fail to do so, it is dismissed.

    Dragonflame MELEE WEAPON

    FIGHT

    LINE 15 6 DISCORD

    The AOE becomes dangerous terrain ( AGILITY , 5 ASTRAL ) for the rest of the scene or until the carp is defeated or dismissed.

    Lunar Infusion

    MINOR ACTION

    SPELL (RARE)

    1 MEMORY

    MANA 1 RANGE = SCOPE

    You place the following Enchantment on a weapon equipped by an ally within RANGE (their choice). It lasts until the end of their next turn:

    • Any Weapon: On a hit, this weapon deals +1d6 bonus Lunar .

    This weapon counts as a BOW (ranged weapon) and BLADE (melee weapon), and effects that apply to either apply to this weapon regardless of profile used. You can VOLLEY using this weapon's ranged profile or FIGHT with its melee profile.

    SKILL (UNCOMMON) 1 MEMORY

    1/turn when you FIGHT and hit a target, you can take 1 Stress to make the attack a mortal strike . The target can't regain HP or gain TEMP HP until the start of your next turn.

    FREE ACTION

    SUPPORT ITEM (UNCOMMON) LIGHT MANA 1

    1/turn , one of your targets receives +1 to their save against one of your effects.

    Orbital Strike

    CHANNEL

    SUPPORT ITEM (RARE) HEAVY CONSUMABLE 2 RANGE = SCOPE

    On Channel: Expend a charge and pick a space within Range. If you stop channeling for any reason, you regain the spent charge.

    On Release: All characters in a BLAST 3 AOE centered on the selected space must make an AGILITY save, taking +1 if they are in the center space, or +1 if they are at least 3 spaces away from the center space. Failure: They take 14 ASTRAL . Success: They take 7 ASTRAL .

    Submitted by Aioran.

    Oversized Enchantment

    SUPPORT ITEM (RARE) HEAVY ENCHANTMENT, UNIQUE

    You may use the following Enchantment :

    • Any Weapon That Rolls for Damage: This weapon deals 1 additional die of damage of its usual damage type (excluding Stress and Discord ). If the weapon has multiple damage types, pick one of them.

    SKILL (LEGENDARY) 1 MEMORY UNIQUE

    You gain +2 SAVE TARGET . Additionally, whenever a character fails a save against you, they take 1 STRESS .

    You may use the following Enchantment :

    • Any Non-Slow Equipment or Technique: When you FULL ATTACK , you can attack with this weapon twice instead of with two different weapons.

    You can pick two ancestry traits each quest.

    You and all adjacent allies become INVISIBLE until the start of your next turn. If an affected character forces a save, makes an attack, or targets something with a hostile effect, they lose INVISIBLE .

    .

    Penta Quiver

    SUPPORT ITEM (LEGENDARY) MAIN ENCHANTMENT

    You may use the following Enchantment :

    • Any Ranged Weapon: As a minor action , choose one of the following effects for this weapon, lasting until you pick a new one. Each effect can be used 1/turn , and 'on-hit' effects only apply to a single attack roll.
    • Steel: This weapon gains Piercing .
    • Flaming: On Hit: The target takes 1 DISCORD for every damage die rolled for this attack.
    • Explosive: On Hit: Characters in a BURST 1 AOE around the target are auto-hit for half of the attack's damage.
    • Seeker: This weapon gains Homing .
    • Poisoned: On Hit: The target is DAZED until cleared. They can make a BULK save at the end of each of their turns, clearing the condition on a success.

    Submitted by Nick Hanson.

    Perfect Accuracy

    SKILL (LEGENDARY) 2 MEMORY UNIQUE

    You can choose each option from the Reroll Table any number of times per turn, as long as the conditions are met for the option in question.

    You can use BULK instead of MAGIC when making checks to clear Discord .

    1/round when you VOLLEY or FIGHT , you can attack with two different weapons. All attacks must target the same target. You can't use this ability with FULL ATTACK .

    You create a SIZE 1 or SIZE 2 object that counts as hard cover in a free adjacent space.

    MELEE WEAPON (RARE)

    REACH 2 1D3 PHYSICAL

    You can use this weapon to attack targets that are exactly RANGE 5 from you, and deal +2 damage when doing so. This doesn't extend the weapon's REACH .
